Title: LENS GENERATOR
Definition: see LENS- GENERATING- MACHINE TENDER.

Title: HAM-ROLLING-MACHINE  OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that winds binding around boned hams: Threads binding string through winding shaft and starts machine. Impales boned ham on spiked pilot. Pushes lever to engage winding shaft with pilot and steps on treadle to wind string spirally around ham. Holds ham between hands during winding to maintain its round shape. Stops machine, cuts and ties string, and removes bound ham.

Title: DEALER-CONTACT MAN
Definition: salea.

Title: SHEET-METAL-CUT-OUT MAN
Definition: Lays out and cuts sheet metal for brass-wind instrument bells and bell necks, using templates and power tools or handtools: Determines placing of templates on sheet metal to obtain minimum of waste. Positions template on sheet metal and draws line around template, using scriber. Marks cutting and forming lines on sheet metal, following templates. Cuts metal, following guide lines, using hand or power shears.

Title: BROOCH MAKER
Definition: Jeweler. Fabricates and assembles brooches following design or oral instructions, using handtools: Draws outline of design for hrooch on precious metal stock with gravers, following design Cuts metal along markings with handsaw and smooths edges with file. Places shaped metal parts on scale drawing to determine if they are in conformance with design. Heats metal parts to soften and shape them, using gas torch. Hammers, carves, shapes, and builds up metal parts to obtain desired contours, using handtools. Assembles and solders together parts, such as joints, catches, and stone settings, using pliers and solder. May rivet parts together.

Title: PLASTIC-FIXTURE BUILDER
Definition: model maker, plastic; plastic duplicator. Fabricates precision plastic checking fixtures used to determine accuracy of parts stamped out on power presses: Casts plastic reproduction from model of part [PLASTIC LAY-UP MAN]. Lays out reference lines on cast as guides in assembling, fitting, and trimming operations, using height gages, surface plates, squares, protractors, and other measuring instruments. Cuts and trims casts following reference lines, using file, saws, planes, and other handtools. Assembles casts with glue, bolts, and other fasteners. Fits and fastens metal inserts into fixture at specified points to increase strength or accuracy. Verifies dimensions of completed checking fixture for conformance to specifications, using templates and measuring instruments. May fabricate metal inserts used in fixture, using powered saws, powered grinder, and files. May direct activities of PLASTIC LAY-UP MAN.

Title: EXPERIMENTAL ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembles, Inspects, tests, and adjusts a variety of optical, electrical, and mechanical devices on pilot-run basis to improve assembly methods and to discover and correct deficiencies in materials, specifications, and equipment prior to production runs: Reads and interprets blueprints, diagrams, schematics, and narrative instructions to determine required parts and tools and lays out workbench to provide assembly arrangement. Assembles up to 100 units or components of optical, electrical, or mechanical devices, such as slide projectors, plastic tape dispensers, thermal-process duplicating machines, and ribbon-bow-making machines, using power- tools and handtools. Inspects, tests, and adjusts assembled devices for specified functioning, using light meter, ammeter, voltmeter, stopwatch, rulers, feeler gages, spring tension tester, torque tester, and depth micrometer.

Title: OFFAL MAN
Definition: Separates edible portions of animal viscera from offal, performing any combination of the following tasks: Cuts away such organs and glands from adjoining tissue as heart, sweetbreads, stomach, spleen, gall bladder, liver, and thyroid, using knife. Skins outer tissue of bung gut with fingers. Washes parts and places them in containers. Cuts off ends of oxtails and trims loose tissues, using knife and rotary brush. Trims excess fat and tissue from muscles, intestines, and organs, using knife. Separates membrane from gullet and windpipe, inner lining from stomach, and small intestines from large. Flushes Intestines and bladders with water hose and squeezes them to remove water, slime, and foreign matter. Weighs and sorts viscera, according to condition, and discards diseased or damaged parts. Bleaches casings (intestines) by soaking them in salt solution. Brands tails and tongues with electric iron. May tend machine that washes viscera and flesh parts. May grind meat. May be known according to specific task performed or part of viscera processed as BEEF- PLUCK TRIMMER; BLADDER TRIMMER; BUNG GRADER; CASING PULLER; GLAND MAN; LUNG SPLITTER; VISCERA WASHER (slaught. & meat pack.).

Title: MILLER, WOOD FLOUR
Definition: Operates milling machine that pulverizes and sifts sawdust to make wood flour: Reads work order to ascertain quantity and particle size of flour required. Selects screen of specified mesh and places it on bed of reciprocating sifter. Starts hammer mill, conveyors, and sifter, and observes pulverizing and sifting operation. inspects flour samples to verify adherence to specifications. Empties sifters, conveyors, or mills with hand- scoop when overloading or jamming occurs. Repairs holes in screens by gluing section of mesh over damaged area or by fastening screen onto frame. May sack flour.

Title: UPPER-AND-BOTTOM LACER, HAND
Definition: bottom- and -upper lacer. hand. Assembles parts of novelty shoes by lacing together with braided cloth or leather strips: Fashions upper portion of shoe by lacing quarters to vamp. Alines perforated upper and sole, inserts tipped lacer, and draws together by lacing backward around shoe on either side. Ties lacer at top of heel. Smooths outside of shoe sole and heel stitches by pounding with hammer.

Title: LOWERATOR OPERATOR
Definition: Removes wrapped felt-base rugs and felt-base floor coverings from machine that automatically lowers them to lower floor for final processing. Weighs rugs and coverings, using floor scale, and sorts them according to grade. Moves products to storage rooms, using hand truck. Records weights and grades of products.

Title: ARCHEOLOGIST
Definition: Reconstructs record of extinct cultures, especially preliterate cultures: Studies, classifies, and interprets artifacts, architectural features, and types of structures recovered by excavation in order to determine their ago and cultural identity. Establishes chronological sequence of development of each culture from simpler to more advanced levels. May specialize in study of literate periods of major civilizations in Near and Middle East and be designated ARCHEOLOGIST, CLASSICAL.

Title: LEAF CONDITIONER
Definition: caster; casing wetter; cellarman; conditioner; preparing hand; tobacco conditioner; tobacco carer; tobacco dipper; water caser. Moistens (conditions or cases) hands of tobacco to make the leaves pliable for processing: Removes hands from receiving box and dips them into water or sprays water over leaves. Stacks leaves, stem down, on drain- board and covers leaves with doth or paper. May pack drained leaves in cases and transfer cases to steam or humidifier room, using handtruck. May mix various grades and types of tobacco prior to conditioning. May be designated according to type of tobacco as BINDER CASER; SUMATRA CABER; WRAPPER CASER.

Title: CRYSTAL CUTTER
Definition: Grinds improperly fitting watch crystals to desired size and to remove rough or chipped edges by holding crystal against revolving abrasive wheel. Brushes crystal with protective layer of lacquer and dries lacquer under lamp.

Title: CALENDER OPERATOR, OILCLOTH
Definition: Tends calender that compresses cloth and coated cloth sheeting to produce oilcloth: Changes cloth rolls on letoff and windup racks, and threads sheeting through calender rollers with assistance of LABORER, GENERAL. Scrapes surfaces of fiber rollers to remove foreign material. Sews ends of cloth rolls together to form continuous sheet, using sewing machine. Inspects sheeting being calendered to detect turned edges, material defects, or uneven coating. Applies gummed tape to holes, faulty seams, or frayed edges, and smooths wrinkles. Applies soap solution to roller to remove surface depressions, and starts calender to dry rollers by friction. May be designated according to processing stage as RAW CALENDER OPERATOR; SECOND- CALENDER OPERATOR; THIRD-CALENDER OPERATOR.

Title: BULK FILLER
Definition: Fills wooden tuba, barrels, or containers with processed food products and other ingredients to preserve them: Dumps food into barrel, tub, or container, and adds prescribed amounts of such preservatives as salt, sugar, brine, sirup, or vinegar. Covers container with lid, waxed paper, or plastic. May weigh contents of container. May apply labels to outer surface of container. May be designated according to container filled as BARREL FILLER or product treated as GARBAGE SALTER.

Title: BILLBOARD-ERECTOR HELPER
Definition: Assists BILLBOARD ERECTOR-AND-REPAIRMAN to erect wood and metal bulletin and poster panels for outdoor advertisements: Assists in erecting scaffolds and hoists. Lifts structural members into position by hand or with hoist, and holds them until secured to supports. Bolts, screws, nails, or clips structural members, panels, and trim in position. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: OVEN UNLOADER
Definition: Removes form boards containing cured ballons from oven and breaks boards down for reprocessing: Pulls boards from oven with steel hook. Inverts board and dips ballons in soap solution to prevent adherence and create glossy finish. Removes balloons from solution and lays board on table. Removes bolts with Impact wrench to break form boards into form strips. Pushes form strips onto roller conveyor to supply TAKE- OFF GIRLS with balloons to be stripped from forms. OVERALL-BIB MAKER (garment) tee SEWING- MACHINE OPERATOR, REGULAR EQUIPMENT.

Title: ARRANGER
Definition: adapter; transcriber; transcripter. Transcribes musical compositions or melodic lines to adapt them to or to create particular style for orchestra, band, choral group, or individual: Familiarizes self with composition and imagines effects of various combinations of voices, instruments, harmonic structures, rhythms, tempos, and music dynamics. Selects instruments or voices to be employed to obtain desired effects, utilizing knowledge of their range, characteristics, limitations, and key and talents of individual performers. Writes score employing knowledge of music theory, harmony, form, notation, and dynamics and wide background and experience In music [ORCHESTRATOR]. May use piano to plan harmony and chords. May copy parts from score for individual performers within group.

Title: DRESSER
Definition: Fits tourists with raincoats and rubber boots to protect them against spray and dampness when visiting natural phenomena, such as caves and waterfalls. May check patrons' shoes.

Title: CLOTH-SKEINING-REEL-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: put-up-man helper. Assists CLOTH SKEINING-REEL OPERATOR in winding unfinished cloth into skeins by feeding and off bearing reeling machine: Lifts one end of doth roll and mounts roll in box or on bar of reeling machine. Observes doth being wound and guides cloth into even skeins on reel. Sews edges of reeled doth together to secure them in place for further processing, using needle and thread. Lifts doth skeins from machine and performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: REVIEWING OFFICER, DRIVER'S LICENSE
Definition: Evaluates traffic record, and other aspects of drivers' attitude and behavior to recommend suspension, revocation, or reinstatement of State operators licenses. Reviews written record of driver, considering applicable laws and such factors as number and nature of accidents, interval between accidents or convictions, driver's occupation, and number and gravity of traffic convictions, to evaluate driver's attitude and determine probability of repeated offenses. Conducts hearings at request of persons whose licenses have been suspended or revoked to receive testimony and facts bearing on action. Receives petitions for reinstatement of licenses and approves or disapproves petitions according to evaluation of all pertinent facts. Confers with police and court officials to compile information, facilitate location or punishment of violators, and promote traffic safety. May allocate points for accidents or convictions and mail warnings to violators facing automatic penalties. May be designated HEARING INSPECTOR whenreceiving testimony from permit holders attempting to show cause why their licenses should not be suspended or revoked.

Title: FURNACE OPERATOR
Definition: soaking-pit operator. Operates furnace to heat aluminum slabs and fabricated forms to specified temperature for rolling or processing: Sets furnace controls to regulate temperatures and heating time. Starts conveyors and opens furnace doors to admit slabs, plate, sheet, and coil or signals ELECTRIC- BRIDGE-OR-GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to uncover soaking pits and lower ingots into them. Observes pyrometer and adjusts rheostat controls to maintain temperature between specified limits. Measures temperature of product to determine necessity for adjusting furnace temperature or timing cycle, using thermal Instruments and charts. Removes material from furnace, using crane, or signals ELECTRIC-BRIDGE-OR- GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to transfer it to next station. Records time and production data.

Title: SPREADER OPERATOR, AUTOMATIC
Definition: atrip feeder. Tends machine that spreads tobacco evenly onto conveyor belt: Places Saratoga filled with tobacco on hydraulic lift and starts machine. Pulls lever to hoist Saratoga and dump tobacco into hopper of machine where prong-studded shaft fluffs tobacco and spreads tobacco evenly onto conveyor belt. Cleans tobacco from prongs of shaft. SPREADING-

Title: DYER
Definition: Dumps feathers into dye vats and stirs them, using broomstick, to color feathers used as trimmings for ladies' garments. Removes feathers with wire scoops and places them in steam- heated drums to dry.

Title: DIRECTOR, VOCATIONAL, TRAINING
Definition: Organizes and coordinates vocational training program in public school system, and negotiates with business and labor leaders to Insure that training conforms with community needs, Collaborates and cooperates operates with education officiais in joint programs. Organises on-the-job training programs.

Title: TUBE WINDER, HAND
Definition: tube maker; winder operator. Tends machine that winds material, such as asbestos or felt paper, around mandrel to form insulated pipe-covering: Places mandrel of designated size in winding jig and attaches end of sheet to mandrel. Turns mandrel wheel specified number of times to wind layers of liner, filler, and outer materials, such as adhesive coated asbestos, tar, and corrugated and wool felt papers, around mandrel. Cuts material from roll sheet, using knife. Lifts and turns mandrel to vertical position. Grasps and shakes tube to drop mandrel from center of tube. Stacks tubes on hand tracks and replaces mandrel in jig. May manually paste and wrap completed tube in canvas outer jacket.

Title: LINTER-SAW SHARPENER
Definition: linter-saw-sharpening-machine operator; saw filer; sharpener. Operates machine to sharpen cylinders of circular saws used in linter machines: Removes saw cylinders from linter machine and mounts cylinder in feeding head of sharpening machine. Examines saw blades to determine amount of cut necessary to sharpen them. Turns handwheels to set cutting control to specified depth of cut for saw teeth, and to adjust space between cutting tools. Starts machine and observes operation.

Title: PATHOLOGIST
Definition: medical pathologist. Studies nature, cause, and development of diseases, and structural and functional changes caused by them: Diagnoses, from body tissue, fluids, secretions, and other specimens, presence and stage of disease, utilizing laboratory procedures. Acts as consultant to other medical practitioners. Performs autopsies to determine nature and extent of disease, cause of death, and effects of treatment. May direct activities of pathology department in medical school, hospital, clinic, medical examiner's office, or research institute. May be designated according to speciality as CLINICAL PATHOLOGIST; FORENSIC PATHOLOGIST; NEUROPATHOLOGIST; SURGICAL PATHOLOGIST.

Title: MOLDER, FOAM RUBBER
Definition: Tends hydraulic steam press that heats molds filled with mixture of foam rubber particles and latex (liquid rubber) to form cushions and mattresses: Carries filled mold from mixing machine to table of press. Smooths mixture in mold to distribute it evenly. Positions top cover on mold and places mold on press bed. Turns valve to lower ram against mold that heats and cures mixture. Removes mold, dumps molded product, and places it on storage rack. May grind foam rubber scrap, using electrically powered grinding machine. May mix ground foam rubber particles with latex, using mixing machine, and fill molds with mixture [MIXER, FOAM RUBBER].

Title: COATING-LINE CHECKER
Definition: Inspects finished panels of Insulation board for trimming imperfections and flaws in color or uniformity of coating: Observes board passing on conveyor for trimming flaws, such as incomplete cuts, chewed or mis beveled edges, and wandering kerfe. Examines board emerging from drying kiln after coating for streaks, brush marks, tin- painted areas, and presence of foreign matter In paint. Conducts flame and colorimetry tests of coated boards to verify conformity of product to plant standards, using standard test procedure and equipment. Rejects faulty board and notifies equipment operator, maintenance personnel, or supervisor to shut down equipment for adjustment or repair. May adjust coating and trimming machines, using wrenches. May start and stop conveyors as necessary to prevent jamming and flaws in trimming and coating operations.

Title: SCREEN-TENDER HELPER
Definition: screen clean-up man; screen washer. Performs the following tasks in screening ground wood or cooked pulp: Washes clogged masses of fibers and impurities from screen plates, using water hose. Washes and scrapes sand and sludge from riffiers and flow boxes. Removes and replaces screen plates at request of sCREEN TENDER, using handtools.

Title: INSTRUCTOR, RIDING
Definition: riding master; teacher, riding. Instructs pupils in techniques of horsemanship: Teaches pupils how to mount horse and how to post. Explains and demonstrates methods of controlling horse's actions in walking, trotting, cantering, pacing, and in various other gaits. May drill advanced pupils in art of jumping, horsemanship competitions. and in trail riding.

Title: STONE-MILL OPERATOR
Definition: burr-mill operator; paint grinder, stone mil]; stone- grinder operator. Operates mills equipped with grinding stones to grind paint or paint ingredients to specified fineness: Weighs ingredients, such as white-lead pulp, pigments, and oil on scale and dumps them into feed hopper of mill. Starts mill and turns valve to admit steam into mill jacket to heat ingredients. Feels or examines mixture to determine fineness of grind. Turns screws to set clearance between grinding stones to grind ingredients to specified fineness. Opens valve or starts pump to transfer mixture into cooling and storage tanks. Cleans millstones, hoppers, and scrapers, using hot water hose, solvent, and brushes. Replaces worn grinding stones, using handtools and hoist.

Title: BATCHER, PRECAST AND PRESTRESSED CONCRETE
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in assembly of precut wood forms for molding reinforced concrete slabs and beams, and pouring and finishing of concrete: Lays flat and marks measurements for assembly of new forms on prepared molding floor, from blueprints and drawing. Directs workers engaged in bolting or clamping together of farms and tightens bolts to attain prescribed tension on wire or cable reinforcing members, using wrench equipped with torque gage. Directs workers engaged in mixing and pouring of concrete into molds, finishes concrete to impart uniform texture, using trowel, floats, and other handtools or work aids. Releases tension on reinforcing members during drying and earing process, using wrench, to impart slight arc and increase strength of concrete.

Title: PROOF MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: proof clerk; proof operator. Sorts, records, and proves records of bank transactions, such as checks, deposit slips, and withdrawal slips, using proof machine: Depresses keys to sort items into various categories and to list items simultaneously on master control tape and individual batch tapes. Positions items in machine to be endorsed and grouped automatically or manually sorts items. Totals tapes and locates, corrects, and records errors. Attaches tapes to sorted batches and prepares recapitulation sheet. Proves deposits, checks, debits, and credits listed on batch sheet. May be designated according to trade name of machine used as BURROUGHS PROOF-MACHINE OPERATOR; IBM PROOF- MACHINE OPERATOR; NCR PROOF-MACHINE OPERATOR.

Title: GENERAL HELPER
Definition: Performs any combination of duties, such as carrying supplies to work area, forming cartons for packing, feeding cans onto conveyor, removing scrap, cleaning work area, and reclaiming oil stock from damaged containers. Dumps containers into steam tub, covers tub with canvas, and opens valve to introduce heat to melt and reclaim contents. Cleans work area, using brooms, mops, and detergents.

Title: BEAMER
Definition: brasher, hand; fine grainer; fine hairer; fine unhairer; flesher; grainer, hand; green shaver; hand-sanding fine-hairer; mooner; reflesher; scudder, hand; slicker; sickering beamster. Scrapes flesh and hair from hides prior to tanning: Positions hide on beam or pole. Pulls beaming knife over surface of hide to remove flesh and hair. Piles hide on cart.

Title: FLOOR CLERK
Definition: Compiles and maintains work-production records of each employee for use in payroll and efficiency records. Frequently performs other clerical duties, such as recording weights of laundry bundles. May convert count of each type of garment to production points achieved, following prepared charts or verbal instructions.

Title: PUMPMAN, GAS PLANT
Definition: Operates compressors and pumps to move gas and liquids between processing stations and storage tanks in gas manufacturing plant: Starts, stops, and regulates speed of gas compressor (exhauster) to force gas from gas generators through purifiers or to storage tank or mains, performing duties essentially as described under GAS-COMPRESSOR OPERATOR (any ind.). Operates pumps to supply water to boilers, condensers, and scrubbers, drain tar from separators, and pump oil from tank cars to storage tanks and gas generators [PUMPMAN (any ind.)]. Drains condensation from drips on gas mains [DRIP PUMPER (light, heat, & power; pipe lines)]. Cleans, oils, and makes minor repairs on motors or engines driving pumps.

Title: ROLL BUILDER
Definition: Assembles roughing stands used on rolling mills, following rolling orders, using handtools: Signals ELECTRIC-BRIDGE-OR- GANTRY-CRANE OPERATOR (any ind.) to position specified rolls in stands. Insets rolls in housing, installs roll bearings, and bolts rolls in place, using handtools. Installs specified guides on stands, using handtools. Grinds guides, using portable grinder, to insure smooth passage of steel through mill. Disassembles roll stands removed from line and examines parts to determine need for replacement. Sorts and stores rolling equipment. Records size, quantity, and condition of rolls.

Title: CUSTOMER-CONTROL CLERK
Definition: Keeps records of customer's purchases, entering type and amount of sale on card index or other form in order that follow-up letters or advertising literature may be sent to customers.

Title: DESSERT-CUP-MACHINE FEEDER
Definition: Feeds freshly baked wafers into machine that forms dessert cups: Positions and holds wafer over male die. Withdraws hand as female die forces wafer over male die to form dessert cup.

Title: PUMPMAN
Definition: neon-tube pamper; pamper. Charges illuminated sign tubing with rare (inert) gases: Attaches formed sign tubing to pumping unit through fused tabulations (glass nipples). Exhausts air from tubing by means of vacuum pump. Bombards tubing with high-voltage electric current to eliminate gaseous impurities. Reduces vacuum in tubing to specified point, using vacuum gage. Connects and opens rare gas bottle to admit rare gas, such as neon, argon, helium, krypton, xenon, distilled mercury, or blue gas (depending on color desired), to specified pressure as indicated by pressure gage. Tests sign by connecting electrodes to secondary winding of transformer and observing color of light. Seals tubing by heating and closing tabulations. Connects tubing to transformer and operates several hours to age tubing (consume gaseous Impurities). May paint or tape tubing to separate symbols.

Title: GARNETTER
Definition: Tends machine to garnet waste yarn and fibers and to compress garneted fibers into rolls of felt, batting, or padding: Moves weight on lever of automatic feeder to control amount of waste material fed into machine and weight of product produced. Spaces knives on either side of delivery end of machine according to width specified for rolls. Turns handwheel to increase or decrease space between compressor roller according to thickness specified for product. Threads end of garneted material through folding device that spreads layers of material on delivery table preparatory to winding web into rolls.
Industry: (felt goods; house furn.; matt. & bedspring; waste & batting)

Title: PANEL MAKER
Definition: panel coverer. Pads and covers panels for use in upholstered furniture: Places pre cut felt or cotton batting over cardboard or wood panel and stretches covering material over padding. Staples edges of material to back of panel so that material is tight, smooth, and even. May sew edging on panels, using sewing machine.

Title: EDITOR, NEWS
Definition: editor, make-up. Plans layout of news stories for newspaper edition, according to prescribed apace allocation, principles of layout, and judgment of relative significance of each story: Receives from EDITOR, MANAGING, NEWSPAPER notification of available column-inches of space to be allotted to news stories. Receives dummy sheet of each news page, showing portion of each column consumed by advertising matter. Issues news copy, received from each department in editorial room, to COPT READERS for editing. Marks dummy sheet indicating position and length of each story and accompanying cuts (photographs), according to relative significance of stories and knowledge of newspaper layout principles. Approves proofs submitted by composing room. May edit copy and relay it to composing room. May write or alter headlines to fit space allotment. May select items from telegraph copy for publication [EDITOR, TELEGRAPH.]

Title: SHOELACE-TIPPING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: shoelace tipper; tipping- machine operator, automatic. Tends one or several machines that wrap plastic, fiber, or metal bands at intervals around strands of braid to form tips of shoelaces and cut braid into laces: Sets measuring device to cut laces of specified length, using handtools and rule guide on machine. Threads end of braid through guides and carrier, and around measuring device and feeder wheels, or ties end of braid to braid in machine. Positions container of glue or solvent solution on machine or pours solution into container attached to machine. Places roll of tipping material in holder and draws end through guides and feeder roller of tipping mechanism. Starts machine that feeds braid through gluing, tipping, and cutting mechanisms and drops laces onto racks. Removes laces from rack, picks out defective laces, and ties laces in bundles.

Title: HATTER HELPER
Definition: Cleans and blocks hats: Loads and unloads dry-cleaning machine, or washes hats by hand, using brush and cleaning solutions. Pulls bats over wooden blocks and forms to mount them for blocking, selecting forms according to size specified on work ticket. Blocks crown on crown- ironing machine and finishes brims by hand or using flange ironer. Cleans work area.

Title: ACETONE-BUTTON PASTER
Definition: Cements metal shanks to plastic buttons by brushing or dropping acetone cement on back of button and pressing shank into softened plastic.

Title: ALARM-TROUBLE MAN
Definition: Adjusts, repairs, and tests electrical equipment to maintain burglar and fire alarm systems: Examines protective system prior to installation, using continuity meter. Directs workers placement of units to provide efficient operation and concealment. Repairs damages on installed system due to accident, break-in, fire, or other causes.

Title: BAKER HELPER
Definition: Assists BAKERS by performing any combination of the following duties in bread- baking department: Carries and distributes supplies, such as flour, shortening, and baking pans. Mixes, kneads, or shapes dough for bread, rolls, muffins, or biscuits. Cuts dough into uniform portions. Greases pans used to mold or bake breads and lines pans with waxed paper. Places pans of dough into oven to bake. Removes baked products from oven. Cleans bakery utensils, equipment, and work area. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: FISH-LIVER SORTER
Definition: Sorts fish livers according to species of fish and sice, shape, color, and texture of liver; Cots liver from viscera with knife and places it in specified tub. Discards diseased, spoiled, and poor quality livers. May clean and fillet fish [FISH CLEANEB.)J.

Title: SHELL MOLDER
Definition: Tends machine that makes shell molds used to produce metal castings: Starts machine that automatically forms and cures shell. Strips cured shell halves from machine and positions shell half on fixture of mold-closing machine. Brushes glue around edges of shell half. Positions remaining shell half on top of lower half and activates ram that exerts pressure on shell until glue has set. May glue and assemble shell halves by hand. May clamp, wire, or bolt shell halves together. May producecores on shell making machine and be designated SHELL COREMAKER.

Title: HONEY EXTRACTOR
Definition: Tends machine that extracts liquid honey from combs: Places decapped honeycombs in baskets of honey-ex- tracting machine and closes cover. Starts machine and sets clock for specified time cycle. Stops machine when time bell rings. Removes emptied honeycombs from machine and places them in vacant supers. May cut caps from honeycombs [HONEYCOMB DECAPPER].

Title: EXPANSION MAN
Definition: temperature inspector; temperature man. Inspects temperature readings of meat coolers for conformance to standards: Tours coolers periodically and compares temperature readings of each cooler with charts. Adjusts expansion valve in coolers to maintain specified temperature in each cooler.

Title: COMMUNICATION ENGINEER
Definition: Tests, repairs, and operates radio transmitting and receiving equipment and privately owned telephone systems: Inspects and repairs radio receiving and transmitting apparatus [RADIO MECHANIC II (any ind.)]. Tests and repairs telephone equipment to maintain private telephone systems [COMMUNICATION MAN (any ind.)]. May operate radio transmitter [TRANSMITTER OPERATOR (radio & tv broad.)] and send and receive telegraphic messages [MORSE OPERATOR (tel. & tel.)].

Title: CROWN-ASSEMBLY-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: assembly-machine operator; cap-lining- machine operator; inserting-machine operator; Inserting- press operator; lining-machine tender; spot-machine operator. Tends machine that inserts and glues cork, paper, plastic, or aluminum foil in bottle cap shells: Pours glue into pot. Turns valves to adjust gas flame for heating glue and to regulate flow of glue into machine. Mounts roll of lining material on machine spindle and starts machine. Observes disks and shells flowing from hopper into machine and pries jammed disks or shells loose with poker. Examines glued shells on conveyor and rejects bent shells and offcenter or chipped disks. Pries glued disks from sample shell with pick, observes quantity and texture of glue on sample, and adjusts valves to maintain specified temperature and rate of flow of glue.

Title: PROFILING-MACHINE SET-UP OPERATOR, TOOL
Definition: duplicator; milling, machine operator, profiling; profiler; profiling- machine operator; tracer-controlled-milllng-machine operator. Sets up and operates various types of tracer-controlled profile milling machines to mill duplicates of template or model contour on metal workpieces, such as cams, metalworking dies, aircraft parts, and automobile prototype parts, determining tooling according to knowledge of profiling procedures: Studies blueprint or layout on workpiece and template (or model) to visualize milling required and plans sequence of operations. Positions and secures workpiece and template on angle plates or machine table, using clamps, wrenches, and such devices as height and planer gages, parallel blocks, shims, and screwjacks. Selects cutting speeds, depth of cut, cutting tool, and corresponding tracing stylus. Positions and secures cutter and stylus in respective spindles. Turns switches or dials to set feed and speed and to position cutter and stylus at reference points on workpiece and template allowing for tool pressure, die clearance, and amount of stock to be left for subsequent removal. Engages feeding mechanism. Adjusts cutter position, cutting speed, and feed rate to irregularities of work. Verifies conformance of milled workpice to specifications, using gages, calipers, and micrometers. May work on nonmetallic materials. May be required to have specialized experience with particular operation, product, material, precision level, or size, or type of machine and be designated accordingly.

Title: CARBONATION MAN
Definition: Tends equipment to regulate flow of carbon dioxide into beer lines and tanks to carbonate beer: Observes volume meters and pressure gages and turns valves to admit specified amounts of carbon dioxide at specified pressures into tanks and lines. Observes beer through sight glasses and adjusts flow and pressure of carbon dioxide to control turbulence.

Title: UTILITY OPERATOR
Definition: Tends pumps that refill purification filters with water and solutions to maintain operating levels: Reads gages to check levels of water, liquid nitrogen, and caustic solution in air and hydrogen purification filters. Starts pumps that refill purification filters with water or other solutions to maintain specified levels. Cleans and changes filters of air and hydrogen driers. Records pressure and temperature readings of compressors, filters, and driers.

Title: RIVET CATCHER
Definition: rivet sticker. Catches hot rivets, thrown by RIVET HEATER, in bucket and inserts them into holes of plates, castings, and structures, using tongs. Removes retaining bolts from holes. May ream misaligned rivet holes, using portable drill or hand reamer. May buck rivets.

Title: SUPERINTENDENT, MAINTENANCE
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers in repair, maintenance, and installation of machines, tools, and equipment and in maintenance of buildings and grounds of industrial plant: Analyzes work loads and schedules repair, maintenance, and installation of machines, tools, and plant facilities to maintain continuous production operations. Supervises fabrication or modification of machines and equipment to process new products or to facilitate revisions of existing products. Requisitions equipment and directs receipt and inspection of all purchases. Supervises maintenance of continuous supply of utility services, such as heat, electricity, steam, water, gas, air, and janitorial services. Supervises training of personnel in duties and company policies. Reviews department operations and recommends changes to management. Submits budget recommendations to management.

Title: PERSONNEL CLERK SUPERVISOR
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in compilation and maintenance of personnel records, performing duties as described under SUPERVISOR: Coordinates recording and filing of information about company personnel, such as promotions, wage scales, absences, training status, and discharges. Compiles reports of absences, accession rates, salaries, and other matters of interest to company management, using typewriter and calculator. May hire and discharge subordinates.

Title: RIBBON INKER
Definition: inking- machine tender. Tends machine that impregnates ribbons with ink to make typewriter ribbons: Fills ink pan of machine and loads machine with roll of silk or nylon ribbon. Starts machine to rotate rollers that dip into ink pan and press ink on ribbon. Adjusts speed of machine and amount of ink to be pressed on ribbon according to type of ribbon to be made. Inspects inked ribbons for imperfections. May shape inner curve of divider that separates inks of bicolored ribbons, using file and emery cloth, until curve matches that of inking roller.

Title: AIR-TRAFFIC COORDINATOR
Definition: Coordinates movement of air traffic between altitude sectors and control centers to provide maximum separation and safety for aircraft: Maintains radio and telephone contact with AIR-TRAFFIC COORDINATORS in adjoining control centers. Relays information regarding air traffic by radio to AIR-TRAFFIC-CONTROL SPECIALIST, TOWER and AIR-TRAFFIC-CONTROL SPECIALIST, STATION, monitoring each sector, for transmittal to AIRPLANE PILOT, COMMERCIAL (air trans.). Relays information, such as altitude, expected time of arrival, and course. Determines procedure and time for altitude changes to prevent collisions and excessive traffic buildup in one sector. Completes daily activity report.

Title: SPEECH PATHOLOGIST
Definition: Diagnoses, treats, and performs research related to speech and language problems: Diagnoses speech and language disorders by evaluating etiology. Treats language and speech impairments, such as aphasia, stuttering, and articulatory problems of organic and nonorganic etiology. Plans, directs, or conducts remedial programs designed to restore or improve communicative efficiency. Provides counseling and guidance to speech and language handicapped individuals. May act as consultant of educational, medical, and other professional groups. May teach or direct scientific projects concerned with investigation of biophysical and biosocial phenomena associated with voice, speech, and language. May conduct research related to development of diagnostic and remedial techniques or procedures, or design of apparatus. May be employed in university, hospital, public school or community or governmental organization, or may engage in private practice.See AUDIOLOGIST for cue who specializes in diagnosis and treatment of auditory and language problems.

Title: RADIO-MESSAGE ROUTER
Definition: Classifies messages at central-office exchange and routes them for transmission: Counts words in message and examines them for spelling and clarity. Places routing information on message, such as method of transmission, route, and operator's code. Places message in pneumatic tube or basket for delivery to operator.

Title: COMPOUNDER, CORK
Definition: cork mixer. Measures or weighs ingredients, such as sulfur, zinc oxide, stearic acid, and granulated cork, preparatory to mixing into cork composition material: Scoops or pours ingredients on scale or in graduate and dumps prescribed quantities into containers. Marks or stencils container to identify materials and records quantities and types. Scoops samples from containers and delivers them to laboratory for analysis. Delivers filled containers to mining machine, mining hand truck.

Title: SALESMAN, TOILET PREPARATIONS
Definition: Sells toilet preparations, such as cosmetics, perfumes, and facial and hair preparations, utilizing knowledge of promotion, and display techniques. Performs other duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.).

Title: CAR-DUMPER-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: car- unloader helper. Performs the following tasks in dumping grain from railroad cars: Slides open and secures car doors. Removes wood and paper from grain flowing from tipped cars, using grappling hooks. Positions metal plank in car to guide grain dumped into hopper. Sweeps empty car and doses door.

Title: POLISHER, SAND
Definition: Polishes sterling or silver-plated hollowware, such as bowls, dishes, and trays, and flatware by applying compound of powdered pumice and oil to workpiece while turning it against felt, leather, or brush polishing wheel. Mixes pumice and oil according to established proportions for type of workpiece being polished. Holds workpiece against revolving brush to remove excess solder from Joints, using care not to cut through soldered Joint.

Title: RESERVATION CLERK
Definition: Receives requests for and assigns space on trains to passengers on railroad passenger trains. Accepts requests for space assignments and verifies available space on specified train by examining diagram charts of each car on train. Informs STATION AGENTS I or INFORMATION CLERKS (clerical) of available space. Marks blocks on diagram to indicate that space is reserved. Prepares teletype requests to other interline carriers to complete passage. Informs STATION AGENTS I and INFORMATION CLERKS (clerical) when complete booking has been arranged. Informs RESERVATION CLERKS at other cities and towns of space reserved or space remaining available.

Title: DIP-LUBE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends tanks in which lead bullets are cleaned and coated with wax: Scoops bullets into perforated drum and immerses them in solvent to remove chips and grease and then into molten wax. Presses buttons on portable control box to rotate drum. "Empties coated bullets onto conveyor belt, closes cover, and starts blower to dry wax and draw off solvent fumes. Examines bullets and discards those that are malformed, gouged, dented, or blunted. Starts conveyor to dump acceptable bullets into tote boxes. Tests coating solution, using hydrometer, and adds solvent or wax to maintain specified viscosity.

Title: MOLD-MAKER APPRENTICE
Definition: chaser apprentice. Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: CLEARING FOREMAN
Definition: clean-up foreman; right-of-way foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of work crews engaged in dealing way for structures such as buildings, bridges, highways, and pipelines: Directs workers engaged in cutting timber, burning brush, blasting stumps, and grading and leveling land. Directs workers engaged in constructing temporary bridges and roads to provide access to construction site. Directs workers engaged in restoring property such as land, roadways, drainage ditches, and fences, damaged by construction activity. Confers with CLAIM MAN (petrol, production; pipe lines) to insure that restorations comply with agreements. May load and fire charges of explosives to blast stumps [BLASTER (any ind.)]. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: FOREMAN, CUTTING DEPARTMENT
Definition: Coordinates activities of and supervises workers engaged in spreading, marking, and cutting fabrics for garments: Determines quantity and type of material to be cut and cutting patterns to be used, according to cutting orders and design specifications. Directs MARKERS (any ind.) in positioning patterns or paper markers on lays of cloth to insure that pattern and weave of parts match when assembled and to minimize waste. Examines cut garment parts for conformance to outline, notches, and other markings on paper patterns. Trains workers in Job duties. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: STAGE-PROPERTY FOREMAN
Definition: property foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in dressing sets with props as specified by PROPERTY MASTERS and SET DECORATORS and in striking sets and storing props used in motion pictures. Examines props to insure good repair and cleanliness. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: SHEET-PILE-HAMMER OPERATOR
Definition: Hammers sheet piling into ground around excavation to prevent cave-ins, using air-driven hammer equipped with a U-shaped head that is adaptable to driving sheet piling: Lifts hammer to top of piling and places inverted U-shaped hammering head over edge of piling. Presses trigger to start hammer. May stand on stirrups protruding from side of hammer to add weight to force of hammer blows.

Title: STAKE BOATMAN
Definition: skiff man. Operates seiner skiff to bold one end of purse seine in place while purse seiner (mother ship) circles school of fish to set net. Holds purse seine away from ship during pursing and brailing operations.

Title: LUDLOW-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Sets up and operates machine to cast lines of type: Sets up matrices in assembly stick by hand, according to copy for which slugs are to be made. Locks assembly stick containing matrices in groove on top of machine. Starts machine and monitors it while metal slugs, bearing printed characters corresponding to characters on matrices, are automatically produced. Removes assembly stick after slugs are made and distributes matrices and slugs in compartments of cases used for storing them until use.

Title: PRODUCT TESTER, FIBER GLASS
Definition: roving technician. Tests fiber glass products, such as bonded cord, insulation mats, roving, and staple lengths to determine if products conform to specifications: Determines breaking strength of bonded cord by mounting sample on arms of testing machine and moving machine controls that apply force necessary to rupture sample. Weighs insulation mat, bonded cord, or roving on balance scales before and after drying and computes percentage of moisture, wax binder, and solids in sample, using slide rule. Observes machines in operation to detect worn equipment, irregular roving packages, or dull cutters. Examines products for defects, such as dirt, frayed ends, clumps in mats, discoloration, and variation in number of ends. Measures staple lengths to verify conformance to standards, using ruler. Tests speed of machine spindles, using tachometer. Records tests results on quality control records and notifies production supervisors, machine repairman, and workers as machine operation, material, or products vary from standards. May perform physical tests to determine yarn porosity, diameter, or denier.

Title: LABORATORY ASSISTANT, LIAISON INSPECTION
Definition: Acts as liaison man between manufacturer and private consumer or government agency to expedite testing and inspection of products according to contract specifications: Notifies consumer representative or government inspector when an order of steel is ready for testing. Notes tests required according to individual specifications. Reviews laboratory reports for completeness and accuracy and for test characteristics, such as strength, hardness, and quality of steel. Maintains good will among plant divisions to facilitate the expediting of orders.

Title: CELL-FEED-DEPARTMENT FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in concentrating, flaking, and drying magnesium chloride preparatory to obtaining magnesium by electrolysis. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: CURING-BIN OPERATOR
Definition: temper- bin man. Tends curing bins that spread moisture uniformly through Cooked grain before being shaped into breakfast cereal, such as flakes or shredded biscuits: Opens gate in conveyor duct to deflect incoming grain into first bin. Closes gate when bin is full, records time, and repeats filling operation with next bin. Pulls lever to dump grain onto conveyor as specified curing time is completed for each bin. Dislodges remaining grain from bin, using pole. May tend bins and cooling towers that cool toasted grain to sped fled temperature for packaging by starting fan and turning water valves as grain moves through equipment and moving lever to direct grain into chutes of filling machines. CURING FINISHER (auto, ser.) tee TIRE MOLDER.

Title: LAUNDRY FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in receiving, marking, washing, and ironing clothes or linen in laundry: Determines sequence which flatwork one- day service, and white and colored work are to be scheduled through laundry to provide quick and efficient service to customers and to regulate workloads. Inspects laundered articles. Investigates and resolves customer complaints of unsatisfactory work or bundle shortage. Studies literature of launderers and dry cleaners associations, and confers with salesmen to obtain information on new or improved work methods and equipment. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to activity supervised as FLATWORK FOREMAN; LAUNDRY-MARKER SUPERVISOR; RECEIVING, MARKING, AND WASHING FOREMAN; SHIRT-IRONER SUPERVISOR; SORTING-AND-FOLDING SUPERVISOR; WASHROOM FOREMAN.

Title: DAIRY TECHNOLOGIST
Definition: dairy scientist. Conducts research in selection, breeding, feeding, and management of dairy cattle: Studies feed requirements of dairy animals and nutritive value of feed materials. Carries out experiments to determine effects of different kinds of feed and environmental conditions on quantity, quality, and nutritive value of milk produced. Develops improved practices in care and management of dairy herds and use of improved buildings and equipment. Studies physiology of reproduction and lactation, and carries out breeding programs to improve dairy breeds [ANIMAL BREEDER]. May be designated according to specialty as DAIRY-MANAGEMENT SPECIALIST; DAIRY-NUTRITION SPECIALIST.

Title: CALENDER OPERATOR, INSULATION BOARD
Definition: Operates machines in tandem to press rough insulation board into specified caliper (thickness), calender (iron) it Into smooth finish, and paint and dry ft: Pumps paint from portable tank into machine well. Turns hand wheel to space paint rolls and control specified paint spread on board. Starts machines and turns valves to start flow of steam and regulate temperature in calender rolls and paint drying oven. Weighs sample boards, unpainted and painted, to calculate amount of paint adherence. Observes processing to insure that finished boards meet quality control specifications.

Title: CLASSIFIER MAN
Definition: Tends equipment that separates crushed ore into sands (coarse particles) and slimes (fine particles), preparatory to concentration of metal: Starts equipment, and regulates flow of crushed ore, water, and flotation reagent into classifiers which separate coarse particles by a raking mechanism or swirling action of water while fine particles are carried off in overflow. Observes meter indicating alkalinity of slime, and adds lime solution, as necessary. Removes sand to prevent clogging by flushing or pulling lever on classifier to dump it. May lubricate machines. May replace defective parts, using handtools. May be designated according to type of classifier used, as COKE MAN.

Title: PAPER-CUP-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that automatically forms flat- bottomed paper drinking cups: Loads rolls of bottom and side wall paper on machine. Threads ends of paper through rollers and forming guides, and starts machine that automatically forms paper into and glues seams to make paper cups. Periodically tests samples of cups for leaks. Places specified number of cups in tubes preparatory to packing.

Title: SHOP CLERK, GRAIN ELEVATORS
Definition: Records data pertaining to receiving, storing, and shipping grain at grain elevator: Prepares lists of grain shipped and received. Keeps charts indicating location and contents of storage tanks. Prepares list of empty storage tanks. Assigns workers to Jobs according to work schedule. Collects and reviews timecards. Collects grain samples according to sampling pattern. Orades and weighs grain, using hand graders and scales. Records grade and weight of grain. Turns selector knobs and reads thermometers on control panel to ascertain temperature of grain at various levels in storage tanks. Weighs loaded railroad cars, using beam scale.

Title: DRIER
Definition: Hangs washed garments, such as shirts and blouses, on racks in heated drying room or hangs garments on hooks suspended from chain conveyor that carries garments through drying room to dry them.

Title: LACE WINDER
Definition: Tends machine that winds lace on cards: Inserts card in machine holder with end of lace next to margin and manually turns card to start winding. Depresses pedal to start machine and control speed, guiding lace across card until specified number of layers are wound. Examines lace for defects during winding and rejects unsatisfactory material.

Title: COPY READER, BOOK
Definition: proofreader. Reads copy of manuscripts to be printed in book form and prepares copy for printing, indicating size and style of type to be used. May plan positioning of illustrations.

Title: HIGH-RIGGING MAN
Definition: high- ladder man; set-up man. Installs rigging to raise, lower, or support equipment, such as scenery, lamps, ladders, and nets for theatrical performances: Climbs ladders, poles, or scaffolding to determine position for rigging and connects, hangs, or attaches cables, ropes, and blocks (pulley) across loft area of stage. Tests rigging to insure that it is workable. Erects high ladders for acrobatic performances by connecting successive short lengths of ladder to top of erected portion, using clamps, wrenches, and hammers.

Title: DIGESTION OPERATOR
Definition: 19.885.Tends battery of digester vessels that dissolve bauxite in plant liquor: Turns valves on pumps to transfer liquor and bauxite slurry through heaters into digester vessels. Turns valves to inject milk of lime into vessels. Adjusts pumps and valves to circulate cleaning solution through process lines. Collects samples of slurry and alumina solution for laboratory analysis. Keeps log of operations.

Title: METAL HANGER
Definition: Installs sheet metal panels, molding, and exterior parts and accessories on mobile home and travel trailer frames and bodies, using hand tools and power tools: Positions and Hastens panels on body frame, using rule, chalk line, hammer, drill, rivet gun, and screwdriver. Trims panels to shape of coach with tin snips. Lays out window, door, and vent areas on panels, using pencil and ruler. Cuts opening, using electric router and tin snips. Nails and screws insulation to roof frame. Measures, cuts, and installs molding strips to corners, using rule, hammer, hacksaw, and screwdriver. Applies sealer compound around window edges, vent openings, and roof seams, using putty knife. Sets prefabricated window units, screens, and louvers in openings and fastens them in place with screws or rivets. Installs accessories, such as visors, lights, brackets, and railings. Fastens metal threshold and door casing on body frame, hangs door, and attaches weather stripping, doorstops, striker plate, and molding. May assemble window unit. May tend machines that cut or shape metal panels preparatory to hanging (SHEET- METAL- FAERICATING- MACHINE OPERATOR (any ind.)]. May be designated according to part installed as DOOR INSTALLER; ROOT-PANEL HANGER; SIDE-PANEL HANGER; WINDOW INSTALLER.

Title: IMPERSONATOR
Definition: imitator. Entertains by impersonating another person or type of person, animal, or some inanimate object, usually by copying mannerisms, form, expression, dress, voice, or sound of character or thing impersonated. May be designated according to character impersonated as ANIMAL IMPERSONATOR; FEMALE IMPERSONATOR; MALE IMPERSONATOR.

Title: ROLLER-UP
Definition: dry-room helper; finisher; yarn roller. Hangs specified number of yarn skeins on peg, yanks skeins, and twists them in middle to straighten threads. Twists yarn ends to form roll and stacks rolled skeins on table for wrapping and packing.

Title: POULTRY TECHNICIAN
Definition: poultry technician. Plans, directs, and coordinates operation of commercial poultry hatchery: Arranges with farmers for supply of eggs to hatchery, and arranges with purchasing agents to sell hatched chicks. Advises flock owners on feeding, artificial illumination for laying and breeding stock, brooding chicks, sanitary measures, marketing culled poultry, and preventing and treating diseases. Interprets breeding, egg hatch ability, and other records or reports to flock owners. Plans sales and advertising programs. Arranges for sales equipment and supplies, such as feeds, medicine, and brooders. Contacts farmers and commercial growing establishments to obtain number and variety of chicks desired in order to schedule hatching. Determines territory to be served by hatchery, varieties of chicks to be hatched, and selling price. May manage custom hatchery to hatch poultry eggs for flock owners and be designated HATCHERY MAN, POULTRY.

Title: SKIN-PEELING-MACHINE  OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that removes cellophane or plastic covering from smoked meat products, such as link-sausages, frankfurters, and wieners, to produce skinless variety: Turns setscrews to adjust skinning mechanism according to size of product. Starts machine and feeds strand of linked meat into machine. Peels remaining fragments of covering from product, using knife.

Title: STENCILER
Definition: Paints designs on rug surfaces, using spray gun and stencils: Positions specified stencil on rug and sprays paint of specified color into stencil opening. Changes stencil for each color used. May mix paints to obtain specified colors.

Title: DOCTOR, NATUROPATHIC
Definition: naturopathic physician. Diagnoses, treats, and cares for patients, using a system of practice that bases its treatment of all physiological functions and abnormal conditions on natural laws governing the body: Utilizes physiological, psychological, and mechanical methods, such as air, water, light, heat, earth, phytotherapy, food and herb therapy, psychotherapy, electrotherapy, physiotherapy, minor and edificial surgery, mechanotherapy, naturopathic corrections and manipulation, and all natural methods or modalities, together with natural medicines, natural processed foods, and herbs and nature's remedies. Excludes major surgery, therapeutic use of X-ray and radium, and use of drugs, except thoseassailable substances containing elements or compounds which are components of bodily tissues and are physiologically compatible to body processes for maintenance of life.

Title: MANAGER, PHOTOGAPHER GALLERY OR STUDIO
Definition: Maintains a studio in which he displays pictures and frames of various sizes and styles for sale.

Title: MAIN-BEARING BORER
Definition: Operates machine to bore new, reconditioned, or original main bearings in an internal combustion engine by one of the following methods: (1) Clamps engine block, bottom side up, on holding stand. Removes bearing caps and mills down attaching surfaces to make bearings undersize in diameter. Places boring bar in guides at each end of engine and adjusts guides to center boring bar in bearings, using dial center gages. Replaces and bolts down bearing caps, using torque wrench. Inserts and sets fly cutters in boring bar, using dial micrometer. Alines and connects electric motor with boring bar, using quick disconnect universal coupling. Starts motor and monitors operation of boring machine that cuts machined surface on inside of bearing to standard measurement. (2) Bolts engine block bottom side up on holding stand. Bolts line boring machine onto bottom side of block. Inserts boring bar through main bearings and clamps bar Into machine holders. Adjusts and centers boring bar according to readings on centering gageInserts and sets fly cutters in boring bar, using micrometers. Turns boring bar crank by hand to machine bearing surface. Verifies accuracy of machine with micrometer calipers and by fitting specific crankshaft into bearings and passing air or oil under pressure through lubricating holes. May cast babbitt bearings in engine block, using molds, preparatory to machining.

Title: HAIRSPRING ASSEMBLER
Definition: watch-hairspring assembler. Assembles, inspects, and adjusts watch hairspring and balance assemblies: Attaches hairspring to collet and stud [COLLETER; STUDDER HAIRSPRING], and puts together parts of hairspring and balance, using punch, staking tool, tweezers, and other watchmaker's tools. Over coils spring [OVERCOILER]]. and trues spring [HAIRSPRING TRUER]. Poises balance wheel [POSTER, BALANCE]. Locates vibrating point [HAIRSPRING VIBRATOR]. Inspects and adjusts hairspring and balance assembly [HAIRSPRING INSPECTOR I)

Title: CARDOX-PLANT OPERATOR
Definition: Recharges and tests Cardox shells (steel tubes filled with carbon dioxide under high pressure) used for blasting coal: Dismantles spent shells and inserts new electric firing element and metal shearing disk. Tests electric connections, using battery and buzzer or light bulb. Starts compressor to fill shell with carbon dioxide under specified pressure. Observes gage and adjusts feed valves to prevent explosion. Stacks charged shells for reuse, and keeps record of shells recharged, location in mine, and recharging date.

Title: CUTTER MAN
Definition: staple cotter. Tends cutter section of continuous machine that extrudes, washes, bleaches, dries, and cuts synthetic fiber filaments into staple lengths: Threads continuous filaments through guides and wheels that carry product Into cutter. Starts action of blades that automatically cut fibers into specified lengths, preparatory to baling. Starts conveyor carrying staple to baling machine. Changes dull or nicked cutter blades, using wrench. May perform duties of SPINNER or PROCESS MAN. May verify length of sample staple against specifications, using measured stick or rule.

Title: COIL BINDER
Definition: Binds coils of sheet aluminum from tandem mill after rolling: Binds sheet metal coils with steel bands, using band crimping tools. Pushes controls to tilt coil onto conveyor for removal from mill.

Title: TELEVISION-SCHEDULE COORDINATOR
Definition: program schedule clerk. Prepares daily operations schedules and advance program log for newspapers, magazines, and traffic department: Provides for clearance and rotation of spot-commercial films and slides for television programs, and performs related clerical duties for DIRECTOR, PROGRAM I. May compose courtesy, apology, and stay-tuned announcements.

Title: POWDER-FARM HELPER
Definition: Performs any combination of the following duties in moving gunpowder to and from powder magazine, and in maintaining grounds: Unloads containers of gun powder from freight cars and places them in truck. Unloads truck and places containers in magazine hut. Cuts and clears brush, climbs trees to saw off branches, rakes leaves, sweeps storage areas, and shovels snow from walks and roadways, using such tools as saws, axes, shovels, rakes, and brooms. Empties containers of waste powder into concrete troughs for burning.

Title: SALESMAN, CANVAS PRODUCTS
Definition: Sells canvas goods, such as awnings, tents, tarpaulins, covers, and bags, to retail outlets, industrial concerns, and homes, performing duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.). May rent tents for events, such as circus, conventions, or revival meetings. May measure area to be covered by canvas product. May deliver and install awnings [AWNING HANGER (canvas goods; const.; ret. tr.)].

Title: DECAL CUTTER
Definition: print catter. Cuts decal sheets along indicated lines with shears or paper cutter blade to obtain separate designs. Piles cut decals, and stores in stockroom, or delivers to DECAL APPLIER (any ind.).

Title: PHYSICIST, ELECTRONICS
Definition: Studies emission, effects, and characteristics of electrons and formulates theories on basis of observations: Measures charge, mass, and velocity of electrons and determines wave characteristics, using electronic equipment and instruments. Performs experiments to observe excitation of electrons in gases, liquids, and solids. Examines means of generating, amplifying, detecting, and transmitting microwave energy. Applies results of experimentation to solve problems in communications, automation, weapons systems, and other fields. May design and develop vacuum tubes for radio and television broadcasting, X-ray tubes, electron microscopes, and other electronic equipment and components.

Title: GAS SERVICEMAN
Definition: local representative. Tests, repairs, and installs industrial and commercial gas equipment [INDUSTRIAL-GAS 8ERVICEMAN], domestic gas appliances [GAS-APPLIANCE SERVICEMAN (any ind.)], and gamesters [GAS- METER REPAIRMAN].

Title: PRINTING-MACHINE OPERATOR, TAPE RULES
Definition: Sets up and operates battery of machines that print graduations and numerals on steel measuring tapes: Wraps strip of rubber ink-blanket on impression wheel and secures strip ends in slots. Mounts printing dies on type-holding wheel, and turns screw clamp to tighten wrap-around wires. Mounts wheel on machine, using electric hoist. Lifts reel of steel tape onto machine spindle and threads tape through machine. Starts machine and observes printing process. Examines tape rule for defects in printing and compares it with master rule to verify its length and accuracy of graduations. Adjusts cams, using handtools, to print tapes of various lengths. Stops machine and notifies supervisor of printing defects.

Title: AUDITOR, COUNTY OR CITY
Definition: .Directs activities of personnel engaged in recording deeds and similar legal instruments, keeping records of county or municipal accounts, compiling and transmitting fiscal records to appropriate State officials, preparing financial statements of county or municipal finances for publication in local newspaper, and auditing books of city or county offices and departments. May be designated according to jurisdiction as CITY AUDITOR; COUNTY AUDITOR. In smaller communities or counties, may personally discharge all duties of office.

Title: TACKER
Definition: Tends sewing machine that tacks lead wires, thermostats, and line cord onto fabric body of heating elements used in electric heating pads: Positions wire or thermostat on fabric and places them under hold down attachment. Starts machine that automatically stitches multi- strand loops of thread over wire or thermostat to secure them to fabric.

Title: INDUSTRIAL-DIAMOND POLISHER
Definition: diamond polisher. Cuts and polishes diamonds for industrial purposes: Holds diamond in fixture against horizontal diamond-charged lap, and appliesrequired pressure. Determines accuracy of angles, clearances, and cuts, using optical comparator and microscope.

Title: SOAP-DRIER OPERATOR
Definition: drier- machine hand; flake drier; roll-machine attendant. Tends equipment and machinery that converts viscous soap into flakes and removes excess moisture from flakes: Turns valves to admit refrigerated water into rollers to chill them to specified temperature to harden soap. Opens valve to allow viscous soap to flow from crutcher machine into chamber equipped with chilling rollers. Starts rollers to press soap into sheets. Adjusts flaking knives that cut sheets of soap into flakes. Turns valve to regulate flow of flakes into drier. Turns valves to admit steam to drying cylinders and oven jackets to heat drier to specified temperature. Removes sample of dried flakes and tests for moisture content, using moisture testing apparatus. Adjusts temperatures accordingly. Opens valve to discharge dried flakes into storage bins.

Title: TIRE LAYER AND EXTRACTOR
Definition: pot-heater man. Lays uncured pneumatic tires in molds and removes them after curing (vulcanising): Lifts top half of mold with chain hoist. Engages tire bead with hydraulis book to pull tire from mold. Blows out mold with airhose to remove foreign material, and places metal serial number and ply marker in mold. Lays tire in mold and lowers top half of mold. Pushes mold on roller conveyor to hydraulic ram that presses mold together. Pushes mold to POT-HEATER TENDER for curing. May convey uncured tires from storage area to TIRE-BAGGING-MACHINE TENDER, using handtruck. May remove air bags from cured tires [AIR-BAG EXTRACTOR], using stripper bar.

Title: STACKER, MACHINE
Definition: umber- paler operator; stacker; wood pillar. Tends machine that stacks or unstacks lumber to load or unload kiln car to level of lumber table. Starts conveyor that carries lumber onto kiln car in layers, drops stickers between layers, or removes dried lumber from car. Straightens lumber on conveyor for even flow onto stack, using handbook. May drive kiln car to transfer lumber car to kiln or storage [KILN-TRANSFER OPERATOR]. When concerned only with unloading kiln cars may be designated as UNSTACKED.

Title: SHUTTLER
Definition: Threads and replaces shuttles in shuttle rail of embroidery machine to maintain embroidery operation: Inserts thread, needles, cloth, and backing in machine. Inserts and threads prewound bobbins into empty shuttles. Places shuttles into slots of machine shuttle rail to maintain embroidery operation.

Title: TREATING-PLANT SUPERVISOR
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in treating wood products with preserving and fire proofing chemicals: Analyzes production charts, manuals, customer specifications, and examines types of wood to determine treatment of wood. Orders treating sequence, type of chemicals used for treatment, temperature, and pressure in retort, and length of time wood is to remain in retort. Observes gages and progression charts to detect malfunctioning equipment, and adjusts controls to regulate temperature, pressure or level of liquid in retort to correct malfunction. Tests wood borings, using laboratory equipment, to verify specified treating solution and moisture content, retention of preservative, and depth of penetration and concentration of salt. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (and ind.).

Title: BICYCLE STAND ATTENDANT
Definition: Rents bicycles to patrons at beach, resort, or similar recreational facility: Issues bicycle to customer and records time of transaction. Receives returned bicycles and examines them for abuse or breakage. Computes rental according to elapsed time and accepts payment, imposing specified fee for damage to bicycle. Records time bicycle was returned. Prepares cash report at end of shift. Tags bicycles needing repair or service.

Title: FOREMAN, MATTRESS AND BOX SPRINGS
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in padding and covering assembled spring units to make finished mattresses and boxsprings: Schedules flow of cotton and sisal through garneting machines for cleaning and felting. Directs workers in covering of spring unit with sisal pad and in box-filling and closing, tape and roll-edging, and tufting. May set up machines. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to department as FOREMAN, BORDER DEPARTMENT: FOREMAN, CUTTING AND 8EWINO ROOM: FOREMAN, FINISHING DEPARTMENT.

Title: SCALLOP CUTTER, MACHINE
Definition: Tends machine that cuts lengths cr belts of embroidered fabric into scalloped strips for use as decorative trimming: Inserts blade in machine head and turns setscrews to raise or lower blade, according to thickness of fabric. Places fabric on machine table, alines prestltched line on fabric with edge of blade, and sets machine guide according to fabric alinement. Starts machine and observes flow of fabric to detect damage and irregular scalloping as fabric passes under blade. Replaces blade or adjusts height of blade to restore scalloping to specifications. Positions fabric for subsequent runs through machine and repeats process until fabric has been cut into specified number of scalloped strips. Lubricates machine. May sharpen blades.

Title: ENGINE-GENERATOR-SET ASSEMBLER
Definition: Installs electric generators and attachments to internal combustion engine according to blueprints, using handtools, and tests engine operation: Bolts brackets, side panels, end panels, and doors to engine to form housing, using handtools and power wrenches. Connects attachments, such as power takeoff and electric generator, to flywheel or drive shaft of engine to form complete power unit. Starts engine and observes dials, meters, and gages of test equipment to compare readings with specifications.

Title: COMMISSION MAN, LIVESTOCK
Definition: commission agent, livestock; livestock broker. Sells livestock at stockyards as agent for owner : Receives livestock and sorts it according to factors, such as weight, sex, age, and appearance, to facilitate sale. Contacts purchasing agents, such as BUYER, LIVESTOCK (ret. tr slaught. & meat pack; whole, tr.) and informs them of livestock available for sale. Shows livestock to buyers and receives bids. Informs interested buyers of other bids received. Sells livestock to highest bidder. May purchase livestock as agent for farmer. May specialize in one species of livestock and be designated COMMISSION MAN, CATTLE; COMMISSION MAN, HOGS; COMMISSION MAN, SHEEP.

Title: PROCTOLOGIST
Definition: Diagnoses and treats diseases and disorders of anus, rectum, and colon.

Title: SNELLER, HAND
Definition: Attaches synthetic fiber line to fishhooks to facilitate attachment to line or lure. Threads precut length of line through eye of hook and ties it to hook shank. May tie overhand loop knot in opposite end of material. May tie a second hook above first to make special baiting hookups.

Title: ROTARY-HEAD-MILLING-MACHINE SET-UP OPERATOR
Definition: Sets up and operates vertical milling machine with spindle mounted within larger rotary head so that rotating cutter can move anywhere within given circle to mill complex shapes, such as arcs and tangents, without changing position of work piece on machine table. Computes dimensions of shapes to be milled and successive positions of cutter in relation to rotary head, using knowledge of trigonometry. Moves controls to position and move cutter in computed directions to mill specified shapes.

Title: LUMBER SCALER
Definition: Determines the board footage of lumber that is supplied to plant by measuring width of lumber of standard lengths and thicknesses with lumber scale. Records footage on tally sheet.

Title: SALESMAN, PLASTIC PRODUCTS
Definition: 268458.Sells fabricated plastic products, such as boxes, shipping containers, and refrigerator linings, performing duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.). Prepares sketches and spcifications for Items to meet specific needs of customer.

Title: ICER, HAND
Definition: decorator; finisher; froster; Icing man; icing spreader. Covers baked goods with icing or frosting by hand: Spreads icing evenly over surface of solid baked goods, using spatula. Builds up layer cakes by spreading icing or filling between layers and then icing outer surface. Applies glare or thin Icings to sweet rolls, fruitcake, specialty breads, and other items, using brush. Places small pieces of fruit on fruitcakes to form simple design. May mix icings. May pack iced products in cartons. May be designated according to product iced as BREAD ICER; CAKE ICER; DOUGHNUT ICER; PIE ICER; ROLL ICER.

Title: EMBOSSER
Definition: printer; stamper. Tends machine that imprints trade name on shoe parts: Obtains embossed plate specified on work ticket and positions it in heated upper stamping beam of machine. Positions spool of colored embossing ribbon on machine spindle and draws it through guides, under stamping beam, and between feed rollers. Positions shoe part on machine bed. Depresses pedal that lowers stamping beam and embossed plate, pressing colored ribbon against shoe part and imprinting trade name on part. May remove embossing ribbon from machine to imprint trade name without color. May be designated according to part stamped as BOTTOM STAMPER; SOCK-LINING AND HEEL-PAD EMBOSSER.

Title: BALANCE CLERK
Definition: balancing clerk. Calculates, verifies, and compares balances of one record book with prior balances of same or other record books: Adds debit and credit items on ledger and journal sheets, using adding machine. Compares totals and subtracts to obtain balance. Examines individual items for errors in computation or transposition of numerals. Corrects errors or lists those to be corrected. May operate key punch machine to post entries on tabulating cards. May be designated according to type of accounts balanced as ACCOUNTS-RECEIVABLE-BALANCING CLERK.

Title: SILK SPREADER
Definition: spreading-machine operator. Tends machine that fluffs and combines silk fibers: Weighs cleaned, raw silk to separate it into small bunches of specified weight. Starts machine and feeds bunches of silk between machine rollers that fluff and combine bunches.

Title: FOAM DISPENSER
Definition: pomp man. Sprays padding solution (liquid rubber foam) in formed skins (shaped plastic sheets) with hose to produce automotive padded products, such as dashboards and door panels: Positions cardboard inserts at defroster locations and ignition cluster to prevent buckling during cure. Positions metal reinforcement panels at clusters and edges of product to be cured into skin. Dispenses solution in specified areas of skin and pours solution from cardboard containers around clusters and metal panels to prevent overflow.

Title: FLAT KNITTER
Definition: Tends battery of flat-bed knitting machines, with needles arranged in straight line, that knit flat fabric or continuous strips of garment parts separated by thread. May be designated according to part knitted as BAND KNITTER; COLLAR KNITTER; RIB KNITTER; or according to article knitted as ANKLET KNITTER; MUFFLER KNITTER; TIE KNITTER.

Title: CYLINDER BATCHER
Definition: batcher. Tends machine that draws doth through softening solution and winds it onto perforated cylinder to prepare it for dyeing.

Title: CALIBRATOR
Definition: calibrator; speedometer tester. Calibrate speedometers, using handtools and test equipment Positions speedometer on test machine that indicates known speed, starts machine, and compares speedometer reading with machine reading. Adjusts speedometer to obtain correct reading by tightening or loosening indicator spring screw, weighting indicator with white lead paste, or increasing or decreasing magnetic qualities of speedometer magnet, using electric magnetizer.

Title: EMBOSSING- PRESS-OPERATOR APPRENTICE
Definition: Embossing-pressman apprentice. Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: SHRINK-PIT OPERATOR
Definition: pyrometer operator. Controls shrink-pit furnace to assemble hoops and liners to tubes to form cannon barrels: Positions steel blocks in shrink-pit to form angle for subsequent positioning of tube so that breech end of tube will be at floor level. Cleans and oils contact surfaces of parts with gasoline, oil, and graphite to facilitate assembly. Lowers hoops into furnace, using hoist. Moves furnace controls and observes thermocuple pyrometer and recording potentiometer to heat furnace to specified temperature. Guides cold tube, lowered by crane, through hot hoops in furnace.
