Definition: physician, general practice. Attends to variety of medical cases in general practice: Examines patients, utilizing stethoscope, sphygmomanometer, and other instruments. Orders or executes various tests, analyses, and X-rays to provide information on patient's condition. Analyzes reports and findings of tests and of examination, and diagnoses condition. Administers or prescribes treatments and drugs. Inoculates and vaccinates patients to immunize them from communicable diseases. Promotes health by advising patients concerning diet, hygiene, and methods for prevention of disease. Provides prenatal care to pregnant women, delivers babies, and provides postnatal care to mother and infant [OBSTETRICIAN]. Makes house and emergency calls to attend to patients unable to visit office or clinic. Reports births, deaths, and outbreak of contagious diseases to governmental authorities. May conduct physical examinations of insurance company applicants to determine health and risk involved in insuring applicant. May provide care for passengers and crew aboard ship and be designated SURGEON II.

Title: PHYSICIST, LIGHT
Definition: physicist, optics. Conducts research into sources, propagate.

Title: MACHINE TESTER
Definition: Tests machines, such as calculating or adding machines, manually or automatically to detect malfunctions: Sets machine on ball swivel mount to facilitate turning it in all directions when examining parts. Plugs cord of machine into electrical outlet. Presses keys on keyboard and moves levers in prescribed sequence to test alinement of printing, repeat latch, ribbon and paper feed, correction release, noise, and clearance of type bars, according to checklist. Test-runs battery of machines through fixed computation cycle automatically, using Auto Typist. Reads arithmetic results recorded on paper tapes of machines and compares them with test chart to verify accuracy. Indicates defects on inspection worksheet and gives it to repairman with machine. May be designated according to type of inspection done as CLEARING INSPECTOR; FINAL INSPECTOR; SAMPLING INSPECTOR; UTILITY INSPECTOR.

Title: HIGHWAY-MAINTENANCE MAN
Definition: highway patrolman. Maintains highways, municipal and rural roads, and rights of way, in safe condition, performing combination of the following duties: Erects and repairs guardrails, highway markers, and snow fences, using posthole digger, shovel, ax, saws, hammer and nails, and power tools. Dumps, spreads, and tamps asphalt, using pneumatic tamper to patch broken or eroded pavement. Drives truck (TRUCK DRIVER, HEAVY (any ind.)] to transport crew and equipment to worksite. May drive snow-removal equipment, consisting of truck or tractor equipped with adjustable snowplow and blower unit and be designated SNOW-PLOW OPERATOR, TRUCK; SNOW-PLOW TRACTOR OPERATOR.

Title: BONE-DRIER OPERATOR
Definition: 553-885.bone drier; dry-box operator; glue-bone drier. Empties bone cooking tanks and tends oven that dries bones from which glue has been extracted: Opens bottom of bone cooking tank. Starts feed mechanism and rotary paddles of oven, places rod into top of cooking tank and pushes bones through opening of tank bottom into feed mechanism of oven. When bones are dried, presses button to stop rotary action of paddle in oven. Moves lever and locking device to release oven door. Presses button to actuate paddles inside oven that push dried bones from oven into bags or onto cart. Loads filled bag onto handtruck and pushes truck or cart to storage area. May turn dials to regulate temperature of oven. May bag, weigh, and close bags containing dried bones.

Title: DIAL REFINISHER
Definition: watch, dial refinisher. Refinisher watch dials according to customer specifications or manufacturer's original: Removes numerals, calibrations, other markings, and original finish, using chemical solution and buffing wheel or wire brush. Cleans faceplate and applies desired type of finish by electroplating or dipping faceplate in plating solution. Embosses numerals and dial markings on faceplate by means of engraved dies and stamping equipment. Retouches faulty or faintly stamped markings, using brush and paint. Sprays dial with lacquer to preserve finish. May attach individually cut numerals to faceplate with small rivets. May apply radium on dial markings to make them luminous.

Title: GAS-CHECK-PAD MAKER
Definition: Makes gas check pads of plastic and wire screening to be used in breechblocks of bag-loading cannons: Mixes specified quantity of ingredients, such as Vaseline, powdered asbestos, and graphite, in agitator to form putty like substance. Presses specified amount of mixture between dies in hydrostatic press to form disk. Shapes brass wire screening into similar shape, using snips and soldering iron. Embeds wire in disk, using hydrostatic press. Coats pad with graphite paint and stencils identifying data on pad. Wraps pad in wax papa.

Title: CHEMIST, TEXTILE
Definition: Conducts research in chemistry of textiles and institutes methods to control processes for scouring, bleaching, mercerizing, sizing, and dyeing textiles: Prepares formulas for various phases of processing. Controls variables, such as temperatures, sequence of operations, and concentration of chemicals, for treatment of silk, cotton, wool, rayon, and other fabrics during processing. Experiments with synthetic and regenerated fibers, animal hair, feathers, cellulose products, and other materials to develop new textiles. Investigates problems relating to textile chemistry, such as treatment of fabrics to impart water, fire, mildew, or insect resistant qualities, to reduce fabric shrinkage, or to develop qualities of shape retention and abrasion resistance in textiles. May analyze dyes, alkalis, acids, bleaches, and finishes for conformance to specifications.

Title: CIGARETTE-LIGHTER REPAIRMAN
Definition: Repairs and cleans cigarette lighters, using hand tools: Disassembles lighter and adjusts or replaces parts, such as spark wheels, injector valves, and clutch gears, using hand tools. Removes cotton and defective wick from lighter, inserts new wick, and repacks cotton, using tweezers and picks. Immerses lighters in solution to clean them. Applies polish to lighters and refinishes surfaces, using hand polisher. Inserts flint and fills lighter with fluid or gas. May sell lighters to customers. May compute charges for repairs.

Title: ANIMAL MAN, HEAD
Definition: head, ring stock. Supervises and coordinates activities of KEEPERS in attending to animals in circus, based on knowledge of characteristics, living habits, and requirements of various animals. May coordinate training of animals for circus performances.

Title: CAGER
Definition: cageman; lander; skip tender. Pushes mine cars onto and off mine shaft cage and gives directions to workers when cage is used to carry mine personnel: Pushes or pulls loaded cars off cage at surface and replaces them with cars that are empty or loaded with supplies. Pulls empty cars from cage at bottom or intermediate levels of mine and moves them onto sidings for distribution and loading. Gives directions to workers in loading of cage to insure conformance to safety regulations. Signals HOISTMAN (any ind.) with bell or buzzer when cage is to be moved. May load cage with materials and equipment to be lowered into mine. May record number of containers and estimate production weights. May be designated according to level In mine shaft at which work is performed, such as BOTTOMER II; FOOTMAN; HEADMAN I; TOP CAGER. May tend automatic elevator.

Title: NEEDLE-CONTROL CHENILLER
Definition: Tends tufting machine equipped with pattern roller and solenoids that control machine needles to tuft intricate designs: Selects pattern according to specifications and positions pattern on machine, using hand took.

Title: BUFFING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Sets up and operates semiautomatic buffing machine to buff parts, such as automobile trim or hardware, to specified finish: Reads work order to determine parts to be buffed and setup procedure. Selects holding fixture and bolts it to feed arm. Slides spacers between buffs on spindle to set spacing. Measures and sets angle of feed arm to control position of workpiece against buff, according to specifications or using knowledge of machine operation. Sets length of traverse and stroke of feed arm by adjusting air cylinder and setting stop. starts buff revolving and clamps workpiece in fixture. Presses button to feed workpiece against buff. Removes buffed part from fixture and examines it to insure that surface coloration meets specifications. Adjusts angle, feed, or traverse of machine to achieve specified finish.

Title: ACCORDION MAKER
Definition: Makes accordions, applying knowledge of accordion construction using handtools, and operating a variety of woodworking and metal working machines: Studies sketch of accordion or customer's specifications to plan work. Measures and marks wood stock to lay oat wood parts. Operates woodworking machines, such as saw and sander, and uses carpenters' handtools to cut, shape, and finish wood parts of instrument. Measures, cuts, and pleats cardboard to form bellows. Covers bellows with sateen and cloth. Glues leather and places metal guards on comers of bellows. Applies celluloid to accordion parts, such as keys and box ends. Assembles wood and metal parts with screws, nails, or glue, using handtools. Examines fit and finish of instrument and plays notes and chords to inspect completed instrument. May tune accordion reeds and glue reeds in reed blocks [ACCORDION TUNER (any ind.)]. May fabricate metal parts, using shop machines and handtools. May repair used Instruments {ACCORDION REPAIRMAN (any ind.)]. May bedesignated according to part made as BASS-MECHANISM MAN; BELLOWS MAKER; OR BOX M AXER, or by operation performed as FINISHER, ACCORDION.

Title: SANDBLASTER, STONE
Definition: blast- man; rubber cutter and shape carver; sandblast operator. Operates sandblasting equipment to cut inscriptions and decorative designs on monumental stone: Dumps abrasive into mixing chamber of sandblasting equipment. Turns valve to admit compressed air into mixing chamber. Selects sandblasting nozzle according to size of lettering or intricacy of design and attaches nozzle to hose leading from mixing chamber. Moves lever or turns valve to Jet abrasive through nozzle.Guides nozzle back and forth over stone surface following stencil outline to cut Inscription or design in stone. Verifies work by measuring or estimating depth of cut as sandblasting progresses, using rule or employing experience in sandblasting progresses, using rule or employing experience in sandblasting. Removes porta of stencil or adds stencil during basting to create differences in depth of cuts and intricate designs. May sandblast stone without stencil to produce rough, pitted finish. May operate portable equipment to sandblast lettersand designs on stone at cemetery sites. May cut stencils preparatory to sandblasting.

Title: SERVICE-ESTABLISHMENT ATTENDENT
Definition: -Receives articles, such as shoes and clothing, to be repaired or cleaned, in personal-service establishment: Quotes prices and prepares work ticket. Sends articles to work department. Returns finished articles to customer and collects amount doe. May keep records of cash receipts and articles received and delivered. May sell articles, such as cleaner, polish, shoelaces, and accessories. Feminine title: Counter-GIRL.

Title: MEDICAL-RECORD CLERK
Definition: coding clerk. Classifies medical records of hospital patients and compiles statistics for use in reports and surveys: Keeps daily statistical record of information, such as admissions, discharges, deaths, births, and types of treatment rendered, using records, such as admission and discharge slips and medical charts.

Title: SUPERVISOR, CAPACITONRS
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in assembling, inspecting, and testing capacitors: Demonstrates methods and trains workers in setting up and operating various types of machines to produce units in accordance with specifications. Tests electrical testing instruments and equipment for accuracy. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: LOFTSMAN APPRENTICE
Definition: Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: LENS-BLANK GAGER
Definition: clocker; lens assorter; neutralizer; riser. Measures lens blanks for conformance to specified dimensions, using fixed curvature and thickness gages, dial indicator, rule, or eye wire. Verifies focal strength of blanks by matching blanks with standard lenses. Sorts blanks according to size, shape, or focal strength. May inspect blanks for defects in the optical glass [LENS EXAMINER].

Title: CAKE TESTER
Definition: Bakes samples of cake mix to test batch prior to packaging: Mixes ingredients and bakes in oven. Examines baked cake for color, texture, and density. Records findings on worksheet and determines if cake passes standards. Issues approval slip for batch meeting standards. Notifies plant chemist if batch does not meet standards. May test ingredients to determine cause of cake failure.

Title: SALESMAN, PRINTING
Definition: 3Visits business establishments to solicit business for printing firm: Interviews purchasing personnel and quotes prices on printed material from schedule or secures price from ESTIMATOR. Explains technical phases, such as type size and style, paper stock, binding materials, and various methods of reproduction. Contacts prospects following leads submitted by management, established customers, or developed through other sources. May prepare sales promotional letters to be sent to prospective customers. May submit formal bids on large orders of printed matter.

Title: ASSEMBLER, MECHANICAL PENCILS AND BALL-POINT PEN
Definition: air-hammer operator; bench-assembler operator; lead girl; small kick-press operator; small press operator; tip lightener. Assembles parts of ballpoint pens and mechanical pencils: Selects pen or pencil parts according to work ticket. Places parts together, guided by edges, holes, and slots, and fastens devices, such as clips or prongs, on parts. Performs any combination of the following tasks In Joining parts: (1) Positions parts in holding device under ram of press and depresses pedal that lowers ram, forcing interlocking parts together. (2) Positions parts in holding device of machine that clinches prongs or clips, joining parts. (3) Fits interlocking parts together, or screws threaded parts together by hand. May use pneumatic or screw clamps and other work aids that bold parts during assembly. May assemble parts of desk-pen sets [DESK-PEN-SET ASSEMBLER].

Title: SUGGESTION CLERK
Definition: Compiles, records, and reviews suggestions submitted to suggestion committee: Reads suggestions submitted by employees to become familiar with proposals and records them on follow-up cards. Writes memorandum to acknowledge receipt of suggestion. Reviews suggestions for clarity and readability before presenting copies to suggestion committee. Requisitions amount of cash award recommended for accepted suggestions. Schedules distribution of awards to winners. Writes letters to originators of rejected suggestions, explaining reasons for nonaccept- ance. Maintains record of suggestions received.

Title: FOREMAN, BOARD MILL
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in operating equipment to mix plaster slurry and to roll; perforate, mark, cut, and dry plaster wallboard and lath. Trains workers in operation of equipment. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: PAYMASTER
Definition: pay-roll master. Distributes paychecks or envelopes to employees or to department heads and settles payroll disputes. Compares payroll with time records to verify accuracy. May compile payroll records. May compute deductions. May write checks. May count out cash to employees.

Title: TIPPLE-MACHINE MAN
Definition: Tends a tipple to dump casings loaded with dried corn starch onto conveyor: Pulls rope to lower casing into tipple, using hoist. Turns handwheel to dump starch into hopper above moving conveyor, and opens hopper gate to deposit starch uniformly on conveyor.

Title: FOREST ENGINEER
Definition: Lays out and oversees construction, installation, and use of structures, equipment, and road or rail systems, and performs other engineering duties concerned with removal of logs from timber area: Surveys timber land and draws maps to show topographical features of area. Determines locations of loading points and storage areas and selects methods and equipment for handling logs. Lays out and oversees construction of roads or rail network used to transport logs from cutting areas to loading sites and storage areas. Designs and oversees construction of campsites, loading docks, bridges and culverts, equipment shelters, and water and sewage systems to maintain efficient and safe removal of logs from constantly shifting cutting areas.

Title: BLENDER-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends blending machine that mixes salt with coarse-grained margarine to produce finished product: Weighs specified amount of kneaded margarine and shovels it into open top of blender. Adds specified amount of salt. Starts paddle of blender to mix ingredients. Tips mixing bowl and shovels margarine into handtrucks.

Title: BARREL REAMER-RIFLER, SPECIAL
Definition: Sets up and operates variety of machines to ream, drill, rifle, and lap special gun barrels. Selects and installs specified reamers, drills, rifling tools, or hone in machine, using handtools. Clamps barrel in holding fixture and turns adjusting knobs to regulate depth and twist of cut and speed of machine. Feeds cutting or lapping tool into barrel to groove bore to specifications. Removes barrel and examines bore diameter for conformance to specifications, using gages.

Title: COPPERSMITH
Definition: Lays out, cuts, bends, and assembles pipe sections, pipefittings, and other parts from copper, brass, and other nonferrous metals: Lays out full-scale floor drawings or makes templates, following blueprints of pipe assemblies. Builds framework on bending slab to use as guide for bending, shaping, and Joining assemblies. Cuts pipe, using handtools or shop machinery, and packs it with sand, rosin, or other material to prevent flattening during bending. Heats bend area with gas torch to soften metal and bends pipe, allowing for stretch at outside radius and compression at inside radius, using plpe-bending machines. Reheats and hammers pipe to eliminate wrinkles resulting from bending. Solders or braces flanges on end of pipe. Flares or bells pipe mouths, using belling and flaring tools and mallet. Bends tubing to form colls for parts, such as feed water or oil heater. Lays out patterns and templates on sheet stock, using knowledge of geometry. Bends, hammers, bumps, raxes, and planishes sheet stock to fabricate such parts as expansion Joints, tanks, heads, cowls, and air chambers, using handtools, gas torches, and shop machinery. Sweats, rivets, solders, or brazes seams to finish part. Coats parts by dipping them in mixture of molten tin and lead to prevent erosion, and galvanic and electrolytic action. Conducts hydrostatic tests to detect leaks in fabricated pipe. May install piping aboard ship.

Title: DYE-TANK MAN
Definition: net finisher. Tends treating tank that shrinks, dyes, and resins nets: Mixes dyes and resins in tank according to standard formula or customer specifications, using wood paddle. Turns valves to fill tank with water and heat water to specified temperature. Immerses net in tank, using hoist or feed rollers. Observes net to ascertain amount of dye absorbed and measures mesh with ruler to determine degree of shrinkage. Removes net from tank and hangs in drying room or feeds it into automatic drier rollers. May dip netting in tar tank. May tie and pack nets in cartons for shipment [PACKAGER, HAND (any ind.)].

Title: FISHERMAN, POUND NET OR TRAP
Definition: fisherman, trap; netter. pound; netter, trap; trapper; trap tender. Constructs and sets stationary and floating traps to catch fish: Drives piles in predetermined arrangement for stationary trap, or bolts and braces logs together for floating trap. Attaches netting to piles or logs to form walls, top, and bottom of trap. May attach wings to-opening to deflect fish into trap. Fishing by this method is illegal in some states.

Title: SUPERCALENDER OPERATOR
Definition: Operates supercalender machine to impart specified gloss and finish to surface of paper: Positions roll of paper on machine reel stand, using hoist. Fastens collar and alinement guides on shaft to secure roll, using wrench. Threads paper around feed, calender, and tension rolls and wraps end around core shaft of re winder roll. Observes gage and turns valve to control temperature by regulating flow of steam to calender rolls. Turns handwheels to control tension of paper and pressure of rolls. Inspects paper for dirt, slime spots, wrinkles, and compactness of winding. Splices breaks in paper with glue or splicing paper and seals splices with heated flat iron. Tests paper samples for gloss said finish, using glarimeter. Holds sandpaper against revolving rolls to remove lint and dirt.

Title: JIGGER
Definition: Places pieces of Jewelry articles on pins of specially designed forms (jigs) to facilitate polishing operations.

Title: CLOTH-FINISHING-RANGE MIDDLEMAN
Definition: middleman; patroling operator; utility head. Tends intermediate units of doth desizing, bleaching, dyeing, or finishing ranges, such as wash- boxes, tenter frame, drying cans, and curing ovens: Turns valves to admit steam, water, and chemicals to washboxes and chemical troughs. Patrols area between entry and terminal units to detect faulty operation of equipment. Turns knobs to adjust temperature in drying and curing units and to regulate speed of motor- driven rollers, according to specifications. Reports grease spots, holes, and tears in doth to operator of range. Disentangles tear-outs, rethreads unit, and sews torn cloth, using portable sewing machine, to restore continuous process. Works as member of team to operate range. May mix chemicals or dyes. May test strength of chemical solutions by titration or with hydrometer. May be designated according to process, as CLOTH BLEACHING- RANGE MIDDLEMAN; CLOTH- DESIZING-RANGE MIDDLEMAN; CLOTH-DYKING-RANGE MIDDLEMAN.

Title: CD-REACTOR OPERATOR
Definition: Tends catalytic reactor that converts monovinylacetylene into unpolymerized constituent of neoprene rubber as directed by CD-REACTOR OPERATOR, HEAD: Moves equipment controls to start and shut down reactor components in sequence as directed. Gages catalyst level in reactors and patrols area to record instrument readings in operating log. Takes samples of catalyst and titrates to facilitate process adjustments and production of product meeting specified standards. Starts pumps to discharge and recharge catalyst in reactors and calcium chloride in driers and scrubber towers. Drains and flushes process lines and equipment, using water and steam hoses and nitrogen-sweeping equipment. Inventories supplies received and consumed.

Title: SEAMSTRESS, LINEN ROOM
Definition: sewing-room woman. Sews together pieces of material to make articles such as draperies, slipcovers, and table pads. Mends and hems articles, such as bed and table linen, towels, and uniforms, and sews new binding ribbon to edges of blankets. May receive and issue linens [LINEN-ROOM ATTENDANT (hotel & rest.; medical ser.)]. May make and repair curtains and drapes and be designated SEAMSTRESS, DRAPERY. May repair bed linen and be designated BED-LINEN SEAMSTRESS.

Title: TATTOO ARTIST
Definition: jogger; tattooer; tattooist. Pricks skin of patron, using needled electric tool that inserts indelible pigment into skin to form decorative or ornamental design: Presses charcoal- coated stencil, draws design, or traces pattern of design onto skin of patron to mark outline of design. Dips needles of tool into colored pigment solution and presses needles into skin to insert indelible pigment into skin following outline. Sterilizes needles in steam-heated cabinet (sterilizer). Mixes colored pigments according to formula. Adjusts and repairs needled electric tool, using handtools such as screwdrivers and pliers. May draw original designs on paper, trace designs onto plastic sheet, and cut out design to form pattern or stencil, using stylus and knife. TATTOOER (per. ser.) see

Title: SALESMAN, FOUNDRY AND MACHINE SHOP PRODUCTS
Definition: Calls on prospective customers to solicit Job contracts for manufacture of foundry or machine shop products, such as castings, machine parts, pipe fittings, Jigs and fixtures, and gears: Prepares price quotations or bids based on knowledge of material and labor costs, manufacturing schedules, and processes. Submits bid to customer for examination and approval. Prepares sales contract based on agreed terms of sale. Performs duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.).

Title: PLATING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: plater; plater man. Feeds sheets into plating machine that impresses weave or grain finish into paper: Stacks linen and paper sheets in alternate layers and feeds sheets into rolls of plating machine to impress weave of fabric onto paper.

Title: NURSE, STAFF, OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH NURSING
Definition: nurse, staff, industrial. Provides nursing service to employees or persons who become ill or suffer an accident on premises of department store, factory, or other establishment: Gives first aid to injured persons. Attends to subsequent dressings of employees' injuries. Keep record of persons treated, and prepares accident reports for compensation or other purposes. Gives information to employees inhealth education and illness prevention. Performs other duties, such as visiting employees' homes and attending to their medical needs, recommending competent physicians, and instituting correct health habits. Oversees preparation and handling of food in company cafeteria. Cooperates with department heads and employees to further accident prevention. Assists PHYSICIAN in health examination programs. May take and develop X-rays [RADIOLOGIC TECHNOLOGIST].

Title: BOW REPAIRMAN, PRODUCTION
Definition: Repairs flaws in bows damaged in production or defective in material, using handtools: Opens cracks and scratches in fiber glass and wood bows, using hand- tools or by heating in oven. Fills opened flaws with matching colored glue or wood filler. Sands filler material flush with surrounding area. Removes damaged fiber-glass nocks, using drawknife and sandpaper. Brushes bonding resin on bow tips and alines and presses nock blanks on tips. Shapes nock blank to bow tip with files and sandpaper. May replace damaged fiber glass on bow limbs.

Title: CANDY CUTTER, HAND
Definition: Cuts candy into squares, using knife consisting of series of disk blades evenly spaced on shaft with handle at each end. Dips knife in water periodically to prevent candy from adhering to knife. May separate pieces of candy and arrange them on trays. May be designated according to candy cut as CARAMEL CUTTER, HAND.

Title: COLOR CODER
Definition: Tends machine that prints color codes on electronic components, such as resistors, capacitors, and semiconductor diodes: Fills reservoirs of machine with specified ink. Positions components on jig and inserts jig in feeding mechanism of machine. Starts machine and observes components as they pass through machine to detect jamming of components and defective printing. Notifies maintenance personnel of equipment malfunction. Removes coded components from discharge tray. Cleans ink rollers after completion of ran, using doth and solvent.

Title: TREATING-ENGINEER HELPER
Definition: boring man; cylinder helper; doorman. Assists TREATING ENGINEER to impregnate wood products with preserving or fire proofing chemicals, performing any combination of following duties: Opens and closes retort door, using pneumatic wrench. Turns steam, compressed-air or solution valves In response to signals. Tends pumps to transfer chemicals from railroad cars, trucks, or boat tankers into storage tanks. Drills test- bores in treated or untreated wood, using hand drill. Moves trams loaded with products in and out of retort. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: ENCAPSULATOR
Definition: Sealer; tanker. Encapsulates electrical and electronic components, such as coil cases, transformers, capacitors, semiconductors and modules with material, such as tar, plastic, or epoxy to protect components from humidity and vibration by any of following methods: (1) Positions module or transformer case under outlet of tank containing encapsulating fluid. Moves controls to force preset amount of fluid through opening in module or transformer case. (2) Places components on rack, dips rack in encapsulating fluid, and hangs rack on drying frame or in oven to harden sealing compound. (3) Fills capacitor shells or semiconductor caps with encapsulating fluid or paste, using eye dropper or applicator. May heat components before encapsulating to remove moisture. May inspect encapsulation for defects, such as chips and pin holes. May stamp encapsulated components with color code or trademark. May be designated according to method used as DIPPER; FILLER. May weigh and mix materials, following formula, and be designated COMPOUND MIXER.

Title: ROLL COATER
Definition: Sets up and operates roll-coating machine to eke. paint, and bake continuous aluminum stripping for use exterior siding in housing construction: Inserts nyirc sling through center of coiled aluminum stripping attaches crane hook to sling. Hoists coil onto hub coating machine and tightens retaining arms and hub ratchet to lock coll in place, using wrench. Polls shipping from roll and secures to prethreaded trafier using stapling machine. Lights pilot of gas oven through which coated coil is conveyed to bake finish. PEs degreasing reservoir of machine with solvent that removes grease and other residue from coil before coating. Fills coating tank with paint and thinner in prescribed proportions, using viscometer, to verify need for (???) paint or thinner. Observes gages and moves controls regulate brake tension on coiler drive mechanism and temperature of oven and degreasing bath. Start machine. Examines coated stripping as it emirs from oven to detect flaws, such as paint blisters, runs, a presence of foreign matter in paint and to determine the coating thickness meets plant standard, using micrometer. Removes coil of painted siding, using hoist and tapes end to prevent unwinding. Applies identifying sheet to each coil, using tape.

Title: GROUP WORKER
Definition: sizes and leads groups in activities that meet interests of individual members : Develops recreational physical education, and cultural programs for various age groups. Demonstrates and instructs participants in activities, such as active sports, group dances and games, arts, crafts, and dramatics. Organizes current-events discussion groups, conducts consumer problem surveys, and performs similar activities to stimulate interest in civic responsibility. Consults with other community resources regarding specific individuals, and when in casted makes referral. Keeps records. May recruit, train, and supervise paid staff and volunteers. Employed in settings such as community center, neighborhood or settlement house, youth-serving organization, hospital, and Institution for children or aged.

Title: BRICKLAYER
Definition: Lays building materials, such as brick, structural tile, and concrete cinder, glass, gypsum, and terra cotta block (except stone) to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures: Measures distance from reference points and marks guidelines on working surface to lay out work. Spreads soft bed (layer) of mortar that serves as base and binder for block, using trowel. Applies mortar to end of block and positions block In mortar bed. Taps block with trowel to level, aline, and embed it in mortar, allowing specified thickness of joint. Removes excess mortar from face of block, using trowel. Finishes mortar between brick with pointing tool or trowel. Breaks bricks to fit spaces too small for whole brick, using edge of trowel or brick hammer. Determines vertical and horizontal alinement of courses, using plumb bob, gageline (tightly stretched cord), and level. Fastens brick or terra cotta veneer to face of structures, with tie wires embedded in mortar between bricks, or in anchor holes in veneer brick. May weld metal parts to steel structural members. May be designated according to material used as BLOCK SETTER, GYPSUM; CINDER-BLOCK MASON; CONCRETE- BLOCK MASON; HOLLOW-TILE-PARTITION ERECTOR; PLASTER-BLOCK LATER; TERRA-COTTA MASON, or work performed as BRICKLAYER, MAINTENANCE (any ind.).

Title: GEOLOGIST
Definition: Studies composition, structure, and history of earths crust: Examines rocks, minerals, and fossil remains to identify and determine sequence of processes affecting development of earth. Applies knowledge of chemistry, physics, biology, and mathematics to explain these phenomena and to help locate mineral and petroleum deposits and underground water resources. Studies ocean bottom. Applies geological knowledge to engineering problems encountered in construction projects, such as dams, tunnels, and large buildings. Studies fossil plants and animals to determine their evolutionary sequence and age. Prepares geologic reports and maps, interprets research data, and recommends further study or action. May specialize in area of study and be designated GEOLOGIST, ENGINEERING; GEOLOGIST, GROUND WATER; GEOLOGIST, MINING.

Title: COUNTRY-COLLECTION CLERK
Definition: Acts as agent for all straight collections payable in United States and possessions: Liquidates outstanding straight collections by debiting bank's account and crediting customer's account. Verifies interest on bills of exchange and uses adding machine to list debits and credits on liability sheet to show customer's outstanding balance. Inspects, prepares receipts for, endorses, calculates interest on. records, and mails outgoing straight collections for payment. Traces unpaid items to determine reasons for nonpayment and notifies customer of disposition.

Title: BOX-SPRING TOPPER
Definition: see BOX-SPRING TOPPER.

Title: CLARIFIER-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: Assists CLARIFIER OPERATOR in separating mud from alumina liquor and in recovering soda from mud: Turns valves to flush lines. Tunis valves to divert flow of alumina liquor through standby equipment as directed by CLARIFIER OPERATOR. Reads tank gage and records sludge levels of mud settlers and washers. Takes sample of mud sediments and weighs it to determine density. Lubricates valves and adjusts packing glands to prevent leaks, using grease gun and wrench. Cleans screen boxes. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: INJECTION-MOLDING-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: machine tender. Tends injection-molding machines that form plastic products, such as typewriter keys, phonograph records, and luggage handles: Dumps plastic powder or preformed plastic pellets into hopper of molding machine. Starts machine that automatically liquefies pellets or powder in heating chamber, injects liquefied material into mold, and ejects molded product. Observes gages to insure specified molding temperatures and pressure are maintained. Examines molded product for surface defects, such as dents and cracks. May beat plastic material over steam table or in oven to prepare material for molding. May remove product from mold, using handtools. May trim flash from product, using shears or knife. May place product in cold water or position it on cooling fixture to prevent distortion.

Title: CRUSHER TENDER
Definition: frame asd scrap crasher;crusher scrap vinyl, asphalt, and asbestos preparatory to reprocessing into floor tile: Starts continuous flow of scrap material from calender and punch press onto conveyors into crusher. Observes flow of material and regulates speed of feed conveyor. Removes foreign material from conveyor and dislodges jammed material.

Title: FRAME TRIMMER
Definition: shader and toner. Paints contrasting color of paint on mirror-or picture- frame molding: Compares color or mixed paint with sample and adds paint to mixture to match sample. Lays strip of molding face up on table. Dips cloth pad, steel wool, or sponge in paint and rubs pad over surface, or applies paint to portions of molding with brush or roller.

Title: SHIPPER
Definition: Sorts boxes of processed color film for shipment: Places boxes in bins according to delivery route and name and address of customer on label. Verifies shipment against invoice and packs boxes in plastic bags or cartons. Stamps postage on containers, using postal meter. Arranges for shipment by truck, railroad, or air.

Title: FERTTED-INSTRUMENT INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects stringed instruments, such as banjos and guitars, for tone, finish, and mechanical action: Tightens strings of instrument by hand. Plucks and adjusts strings to test tonal quality and intonation. Examines instrument for flaws in construction and finish. Adjusts alinement of parts, using handtools. Files and sands rough areas and applies lacquer over areas with brush. Buffs lacquered areas, using power- buffing wheel.

Title: ICER
Definition: 921887.top icer. Deposits layer of crushed ice on fresh food products packed in barrels, boxes, or crates, to refrigerate them during shipment: Scrapes off surplus ice and passes crate along conveyor system or slides it to LIDDER (any ind.). May be designated according to container in which product is packed as Box ICER (can. & preserv.); CRATE ICER (can. & preserv.); or according to product iced as OYSTER ICER (can. & preserv.).

Title: OFFICE-LAY-OUT-SERVICE MAN
Definition: Prepares office floor plans showing disposition of furniture, equipment, and movable partitions: Plans office layout according to customer's description or sketches. Devises plan to provide efficient use ofspace and desired decor. Draws sketches showing location and type of furniture, equipment, and movable partitions.

Title: STEWARD, SECOND
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in providing accommodation services to first class passengers: Assigns personnel to work stations in passenger areas, such as staterooms, lounges, deck, and smokeroom and informs them of duties and responsibilities to passengers. Inspects work areas with STEWARD, CHIEF, PASSENGER SHIP to ascertain that service given passengers is in accordance with company standards. Coordinates work assignments so that additional help is available for recreational activities. May be designated according to shift worked as SECOND STEWARD, NIGHT; or according to class of passengers served as STEWARD. ECONOMY CLASS; STEWARD, SECOND CLASS; STEWARD, THIRD CLASS; STEWARD, TOURIST CLASS.

Title: MOLD MAKER
Definition: 76S.781.carpenter, mold; mold-forms builder; pattern maker. Constructs and repairs wooden brick-and-tile molds or constructs wooden forms for molding concrete mixtures in the manufacture of concrete products and performs general maintenance carpentry about plant: Constructs new molds by laying out and marking measurements on board from blueprints or drawings, cutting board to size with handsaw or powersaw, fitting mold sections with hand plane and chisel or with jointer, and by Joining sections with wood screws. Repairs molds by removing damaged and worn parts, fashioning new ones, and screwing them in place. Performs general maintenance carpentry about plant, such as repairing wooden doors, sills, floors, and stairways [CARPENTER, MAINTENANCE (any ind.)]. May cut sheet-metal mold linings and edge coverings to size, using chisel, hacksaw, and shears, and screw them in place. May make molds of rubber when irregular surfaces (undercuts) of product require flexible molds. May make plastic molds by applying successive layers of liquid plastic and fiberglass cloth around model.

Title: TUBE REPAIRMAN
Definition: Repairs defects in cured tubes: Cuts out defective areas, such as buckles, cracks, and thin spots, with scissors. Buffs cut edge, washes with solvent, and brushes cement on area to be repaired. Applies uncured gum patch and bonds with hand roller. Removes defective valve, washes area, and applies new valve. Spot-cures repairs on automatic or manually operated air-ram press (hot plate). Buffs repaired areas to smooth finish with hand buffing machine.

Title: CONCRETE-GUN OPERATOR
Definition: concrete-placer operator. Operates pneumatic concrete gun to force concrete through pipeline to concrete molding forms: Opens hopper to allow concrete to enter charging tank. Opens compressed-air valves to force concrete through pipeline to form [CONCRETE-PUMP OPERATOR].

Title: SAMPLE MENDER
Definition: Operates single-needle embroidery machine to prepare samples for customer: Embroiders sample fabric section, upon which design has been drawn in charcoal, using stitches and yarn colors as specified.

Title: MANAGER, TECHNICAL-AND-SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS
Definition: Directs editorial and publishing policies of technical and scientific publications and supervises staff engaged in preparation, editing, and production: Analyzes industrial, technological, and other developments and problems to determine suitable subject material for writing technical handbooks, manuals, pamphlets, and magazine articles. Engages services of specialists in such fields as chemistry, electronics, and industry, to write authoritative articles and books on proposed subjects. Reviews final draft of manuscripts preparatory to printing to ascertain that most effective presentation has been made, using knowledge of industrial, trade, and management problems to emphasize and develop special points of reading interest. In smaller establishments may direct distribution of printed materials to available markets. May coordinate activities of staff engaged in research programs and publish research findings and results.

Title: LABORER, ADJUSTABLE STEEL JOIST
Definition: Unloads adjustable steel joists and carries them to worksite. Assists JOIST SETTER, ADJUSTABLE, STEEL to position joists which support portable steel forms for concrete floors.

Title: AUTOMOBILE-DOOR-PANEL ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembles precut automobile door panels performing any combination of the following duties: Places foundation boards on conveyor line. Sprays cement on foundation boards, using spray gun. Places riser on cemented side of board and smooths by hand. Places boards in automatic machine that embosses design on panel. Cuts excess material from edges Of panel, using shears. Places panels on conveyor leading to sprayers and driers. Turns edges of panel, pulls and smooths material, and staples material to foundation board, using stapling gun. Cuts holes in panel for door handle and window lift, using hammer and punch. Examines panel for wrinkles. Applies steam and smooths material, to remove wrinkles. Attaches metal trim to panel, using hammer. Cleans panels, using chemical solution.

Title: OUTSOLE FLEXER
Definition: knock - block (lexer. Feeds leather out-soles through machine equipped with series of powered rollers that bend out-soles to make them more flexible. Catches out-solescoming from machine and stacks them on handtruck for further processing. May feed knee blocks through machine.

Title: DAMPENING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: dampener. Tends machine that dampens articles, such as handkerchiefs and shirts, prior to boarding or ironing: Places articles on conveyor belt that carries them through machine and under water spray. Starts conveyor and turns valve to start water spray.

Title: HOT-HOUSE WORKER
Definition: Replaces burner tips, gas pipe, and carbon- collecting channels (flat surfaces) in hot houses (burner enclosures) used to produce carbon black by channel process, using wrenches and pipe-fitting tools. Cleans carbon dust from equipment and work area, brooms and brushes.

Title: PRESERVATION INSPECTOR, MARINE EQUIPMENT
Definition: equipment processor, storage. Directs or participates in preparation of equipment, such as naval guns and other ordnance materiel for mothballing (storage): Inspects materiel for condition to determine feasibility of storage, type of preservative application required, and degree of dismantling necessary. Identifies materiel and parts according to knowledge of equipment function and comparison with catalog specifications to select preservative treatment best suited to each piece of equipment. Ascertains condition to determine need for scraping, washing, brushing, or other treatment preparatory to storage. Directs or assists in moisture-proofing of material, using agents such as cosmoline or paraffin applied by brushing, spraying, or dipping.

Title: APPRAISER
Definition: Appraises merchandise, fixtures, machines, and equipment of business firms to ascertain values for such purposes as approval of loans, issuance of insurance policies, disposition of estates, and liquidation of asset of bankrupt firms: Examines items, and estimates their wholesale or auction-sale values, basing estimate on knowledge of equipment or goods, current market values, and industrial and economic trends. Prepares and submits reports of estimates to clients, such as insurance firms, lending agencies, government offices, creditors, courts, or attorneys.

Title: DYNAMOMETR TESTER, MOTOR
Definition: motor tester. Tests completed automobile motors before they are mounted in chassis, using dynamometer, and adjusts and repairs motors to insure that performance conforms to specifications: Lifts motor onto stand with hoist and alines and bolts it in place. Bolts coupling to dynamometer and motor shaft and attaches fuel and coolant lines, using handtools. Starts motor to drive dynamometer. Reads gages on instrument panel to determine that power developed at specified speeds, timing, and other motor specifications meet standards. Screws gage into spark plug opening of successive cylinders while motor is running to verify compression ratios. Reverses drive by cutting off motor and moving switches causing dynamometer to drive motor. Reads gages to determine power necessary to turn motor. Adjusts carburetor, sets clearances between tappets and valves, and regulates timing, using feeler gage, timing light, and handtools. Listens for internal noise, such as piston slap, knocks, taps, and gear noises, that indicate irregularities in motor operation, using stethoscope-like instrument and determines location and cause of malfunctions. Repairs or replaces carburetor, spark plugs, and fuel pump or fills out report for repairs involving disassembly of engine. May test motor mounted on chassis and be designated DYNAMOMETER TESTER, CHASSIS.

Title: CUPPER AND TINNER
Definition: tinner and capper. Inserts gutters (V-shaped tin pieces) into sifts of trees and nails or wires clay or galvanized iron cups under them to direct flow of and catch resins for making turpentine.

Title: MANAGER, CREDIT AND COLLECTION
Definition: accounts supervisor; credit man; manager, credit investigations. Manages credit and collection department of commercial house, department store, hotel, or similar establishment: Investigates financial standing and reputation of prospective customers applying for credit. Reviews and evaluates results of investigations to reject credit application or to establish credit limitations on customer accounts Supervises collection of bad accounts and worthless checks. Makes up collection notes to customers. Keeps records of collections. May submit delinquent accounts to agency or attorney for collection.

Title: SUGAR BOILER
Definition: Controls vacuum pan sugar boilers to concentrate sugar liquor and grow sugar crystals to specified size: Starts vacuum pump, and opens valves to admit specified amounts of liquor and steam into vacuum pan, and water into condenser unit. Observes boiling of liquor through sight glasses. Adjusts valves to maintain specified temperatures and pressures and obtain supersaturated solution without carmelizing sugar. Opens valve to "shock" solution with panseed (powdered sugar) and start formation of sugar crystals. Obtains samples of solution, using proof- stick, and observes grain size under microscope to determine when crystals have grown to specified size. Opens pan-feed valve to control growth of crystals. Samples solution to insure that sugar crystals remain at specified sizes as pan fills. Closes pan-feed valve when pan is filled, and continues boiling until solution reaches specified concentration of sugar-crystals and massecuite. Turns valves to stop boiling and to break vacuum seal on pan. Turns valve to dump sugar into mixing tank or crystallizer. Washes and steams pan after dumping strike to remove sugar remaining on coils or calandria. Records strike on station log. May be designated by type of liquor boiled as SOFT-SUGAR BOILER; WHITE- SUGAR BOILER; or by state in process as HIGH-RAW- SUGAR BOILER; REMELT-SUGAR BOILER.

Title: ODD-SHOE GIRL
Definition: odd-shoe girl. Cuts or pulls defective leather or fabric parts from shoe uppers and cements replacement parts: Outs stitching with knife or scissors and pulls defective part, such as vamp, box-toe, or lining, from upper. Tags and routes defective parts to CRIPPLE CUTTER to obtain replacement parts. Cements replacement parts* to upper. May cut and pull defective stitching from upper to permit restitching.

Title: PIANO TECHNICAIN
Definition: Repairs, refinishes, and tunes pianos, using specialized tools and gages: Tests components, such as keyboard, pedals, and action assembly, using special tools and gages. Levels keys by inserting paper shims. Detaches action mechanism and replaces faulty, worn, or broken parts, such as hammers, shanks, and joint connections. Alines hammers and turns screws to adjust striking action of keys [PIANO-ACTION REGULATOR (musical inst.)]. Replaces broken or missing strings [PIANO STRINGER (musical test.)]. Tunes strings, using tuning hammer and fork [PIANO TUNES]. Examines wooden parts for splits, warps, and other defects. Repairs, replaces, resurfaces, and refinishes wooden parts [FURNITURE FINISHER].

Title: BARKER
Definition: ballyhoo man; carney; contact spieler. Attempts to attract patrons to entertainment by exhorting passing public, describing attractions of show and emphasizing variety, novelty, beauty, or some other feature he believes will influence listeners to attend entertainment. May conduct brief free show, introducing performers and describing their acts to be given at feature performance.

Title: TRACER
Definition: decorator. Lays out or traces lettering and designs on surface of marble and granite to prepare stone for cutting: Positions stone on bench, stool, or floor with aid of other workers, hoist, or crane. (1) Lays paper bearing lettering and design on stone, centers it, and traces outline with stylus. (2) Lays out lettering with drafting instruments and sketches designs freehand, working to specifications. (3) Centers and pastes paper bearing lettering and design on face of stone. May cut out lettering and design with hand and pneumatic tools.

Title: DUSTLESS OPERATOR
Definition: header tender; pelletizer tender. Tends machine that mixes powdered carbon black with water or binding agents in rotating drum to form pellets: Starts machine and turns valves to admit and regulate flow of water or binding agents into mixing drum. Examines and feels samples of product to verify that pellet sice and moisture content meet specified standards. Opens inspection ports and observes conveyor system to detect

Title: SOCIAL PATHOLOGIST
Definition: Specializes in research on social problems arising from individual or group deviation from commonly accepted standards of conduct, such as crime and delinquency, or social problems rooted in the failure of a society to achieve its collective purposes, such as poverty and racial discrimination.

Title: CORD-IMPREGNATING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that impregnates tirecord with rubber compound: Places spools of cord machine creels and ties end of cord on to cord in machine. Turns valve to admit softening agent and rubberizing compound into machine pads or pours solutions into pads. Turns thermostat indicator to set temperature of curing oven according to specifications. Starts machine and observes flow of cord through tension compensator, softening bath, rubberizing pad, and curing oven, and around takeup spool to detect breaks and tangles in cord. Cuts out tangled cord with knife. Ties ends of broken cord to wire loops to convey broken ends through machine. Removes wire after broken ends emerge from curing oven and ties broken ends to cord on takeup spools. Doffs full spools of rubberized cord and replaces them with empty spools. Records yardage and style of cord processed on work ticket.

Title: DOOR-CLOSER MECHANIC
Definition: Repairs, services, and installs hydraulic door closers, using machines and handtools: Disassembles closers, using handtools and vise. Immerses parts in solution of caustic soda and water to dean them. Removes encrusted dirt and rust, using electric rotary wire brush and grinding wheel. Replaces worn or broken parts. Fabricates parts, using lathes, drill presses, shaping and milling machines, and precision measuring instruments, such as micrometers, calipers, and scales. Welds cracked closer casings, using acetylene torch. Fills oil chamber and packs spindle with leather washers. Paints finished door closer.

Title: DUST-MILL OPERATOR
Definition: Feeds feathers, used in staffing mattresses, pillows, and cushions, into beating machine that removes dust and dirt from feathers and discharges them into bag. Removes filled bag from machine outlet pipe and replaces it with empty bag.

Title: STRANDING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: cable-machine operator; cabling-machine operator; strander operator; strand-machine operator. Sets up and operates rotating cylindrical-shaped stranding machine to fabricate wire rope or electric cable: Places spools of wire of specified gages into cradles, using electric hoist, and bolts them in place. Positions takeup spool onto shaft, and adjusts travel of distributor to width of spool. Threads wires through holes on inside edge of machine and through twisting head, and coils it around capstan, using blueprints or stranded wire as guide. Nails or hooks stranded wire onto takeup spool. Adjusts gears for specified direction of twist and speed of capstan, using wrenches. Starts machine. Pours grease into grease pot, and opens valve to lubricate strands. Adjusts clutch to regulate speed of takeup spool shaft. Observes machine to detect malfunctioning. Cuts wire when specified footage has been wound and wraps end with wire, by hand or using mechanical wrapping tool. May butt-weld ends of disjointed wires [WELDER, BUTT I (welding)]. When operating stranding machine, equipped with closing (finishing) attachments to prevent unraveling when rope is cut, is known as CLOSER (wirework). May work fine wire to produce twisted electric-light cord and be designated STRAND BUNCHER, FINE WIRE (elec. equip.).

Title: CUT-LACE-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: cotter, machine; leather-atripptag-maculate operator; tanned-hide-cutter, machine; width stripper.Tends machine that cuts leather into strips (lace) for power-transmission belting, dress belts, or boot laces: 8crlbes line along edge of tanned bide, using ruler, chalk, or pencil. Cuts leather along ruled line to square edge, using knife. Turns screws to adjust machine guide to specified width. Starts machine and inserts leather between feed rollers, against machine guide, and under circular knife that cuts leather into strips. Ties strips into bundles for further processing or shipment. May be designated according to product as BELTING CUTTER; BOOT-LACE CUTTER, MACHINE; SOLE-STOCK CUTTER.

Title: SAMPLE-BODY BUILDER APPRENTICE
Definition: miniature-model-maker apprentice; model-maker apprentice. Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: PHOTOGRAPHER, PHOTOENGRAVING
Definition: cameraman; engraving photographer. Sets up and operates camera to photograph drawings, sketches, or other material to produce negatives for transfer to printing plates or rollers: Mounts copy on holder, alining center line on copy with center line on holder. Studies copy and order sheet to determine photographic techniques required to transfer desired effect onto film, according to plate or roller dimensions, type of design, colors in design, and engraving requirements. Computes camera settings required to reproduce sketch to specified scale according to dimensions of printing plates or rollers. Focuses camera, compensating for differences in size and distortions in copy. Measures opening in back of camera to verify settings, using steel tape. Positions film on vacuum board, closes board against back of camera, and locks board in position. Arranges arc lamps for even distribution of light and exposes film for specified length of time. Removes exposed film from camera and develops film in series of developing,rinsing, and fixing baths. Compares developed film with design to determine whether desired effect has been reproduced. Hangs film on line to dry. When producing negatives for half-tone printing, inserts screen in front of film to reduce copy to dots for reproduction. May process sensitized metal plates for subsequent etching [PHOTOENGRAVING PRINTER].

Title: FOREMAN, FEED MILL
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in grinding, screening, and mixing stock and poultry feed from grain and other ingredients according to specifications: Directs grinding of such feed materials as grain, alfalfa and corn cobs in hammer or attrition mills or roll grinders, and mixing of ground feed with malt, mash, molasses, salt, soda, vitamins, and other ingredients according to formula. Oversees cooking, cooling, and pelletizing of feed. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May supervise packing of feed, and storage and shipment of feed products. May be designated according to type of feed as POULTRY FEED FOREMAN (grain & feed mill.).

Title: POLITICAL SCIENTIST
Definition: Conducts research into origin, development, operation, and interrelationships of political institutions, studies phenomena of political behavior, and develops political theory: Conducts research into political philosophy and systematic theory, governmental institutions, public laws and administration, political party systems, creation of public opinion through media of communications, relations of government and business, international laws and relations, and other aspects of politics. Consults with government officials, civic bodies, research agencies, and political parties. Analyses, synthesizes, and interprets results of studies and recommends programs and policies to institutions and organisations. May organize and conduct public opinion surveys and interpret results. May specialize in such areas as public administration, American government, international law and relations, public law, political philosophy, political parties, public opinion, and relations of government with business.

Title: POULTRY HUSBANDMAN
Definition: poultry scientist. Conducts research in breeding, feeding, and management of poultry: Examines selection and breeding practices to increase efficiency of production and improve quality of poultry products [ANIMAL BREEDER]. Studies nutritional requirements of various classes of poultry. Develops improved practices in incubation, brooding, feeding, rearing, housing, and disease and parasite prevention and control. Studies effects of management practices and processing methods on quality of eggs and other poultry products.

Title: DRIER ATTENDANT
Definition: dehydrator; mill-drier man; steam drier. Tends rotary driers that remove moisture from materials, such as corn germs, alfalfa, and shredded sweet potatoes. Turns valves to admit steam through lines or fuel to furnace to heat drier. Observes gages to verify drier temperature. Turns valves to regulate steam pressure or starts blower of furnace to regulate temperature of drier. Examines and feels discharged material or observes gages to determine that moisture content of material conforms to standard. Turns hand wheel or valve to control rate of speed and amount of material conveyed into drier. Starts blower to remove material from drier. May direct workers engaged in shredding potatoes and sacking dried material. May be designated according to material dried as GERM DRIER (corn prod.); or method of heating drier as FIRE DRIER (corn prod.).

Title: SPEEDOMETER ASSEMBLER
Definition: parts assembler. Assembles speed measuring devices by performing any combination of tasks: Alines and fastens parts, such as gears, shafts, washers, number wheels, springs, magnets, and balance wheels, to prefabricated housing, using bolts, screws, handtools and tweezers, and following diagrams. Smears lubricant on moving parts. Turns gear shaft to verify meshing of gears with rotation of number wheels. Presses dial indicator needle onto prong of dial face. Positions lens, gasket, retaining ring, and backing plate on assembly and bolts or crimps parts to assembly. May be designated according to product assembled as ODOMETER ASSEMBLER; PEDOMETER ASSEMBLER.

Title: FOREMAN, MELT HOUSE
Definition: melt house foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in washing, centrifuging, and melting bulk raw sugar: Reads production schedule and consults with FOREMAN, FILTRATION to ascertain quantity of liquor required. Calculates melting rates of raw sugar, using standard formula. Moves controls to set timing cycles on centrifuges and start machinery, such as elevators, scrolls, and pumps. Inspects process stations to verify that equipment and machinery are operating as specified. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May supervise workers engaged in reclaiming contaminated sugars and sirups and be designated FOREMAN, REMELT.

Title: ROLL TENDER
Definition: Controls equipment to mill flaked adhesive from slurry of flour and water: Turns valves or moves levers or side gates to admit steam into pressure cooker to cook milk (slurry of flour and water). Opens discharge line after specified period, and signals ROLL-TENDER HELPER to pump milk paste onto heated rollers that dry paste. Adjusts distance between rollers to maintain specified thickness of paste and turns on knives that cut paste into flakes. Opens hopper chutes to dump flakes into rotating screen cylinder that sifts flakes and transfers them to storage bins. Measures temperature of milk at specified intervals, using thermometer, and tests viscosity of milk by use of viscometer. Determines moisture content of flakes by feeling them or by using moisture meter. Weighs standard cupful of paste to determine its density and adjusts water and steam valves to regulate density. Inspects equipment to detect malfunctions.

Title: TUNNEL-HEADING INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects construction of tunnels to insure conformance to specifications: Interprets blueprints and specifications for SUPERINTENDENT, CONSTRUCTION. Verifies alinement and grade of tunnel excavations, using surveying instruments. Inspects installation of tunnel shield segments, elevators, gates, and tunnel lining forms for conformity to specifications, using rule or tape to verify layout dimensions. May set grade stakes to guide construction and run cross-sections to compute volume of excavation, using surveyor's instruments.

Title: MAINSPRING-BARREL-ASSEMBLY CLEANER
Definition: Cleans mainspring barrel assemblies: Places assemblies in ten-station lucite holding bar, wipes surface with buff (cleaning) stick dipped in naphtha, and turns assemblies over into identical holder to expose and clean underside.

Title: COTTON-ROLL PACKER
Definition: Tends machine that packs absorbent surgical cotton rolls in cardboard cartons for shipment: Places empty shipping cartons on conveyor rollers. Pushes button to start automatic cotton layer machine that rolls absorbent cotton between paper. Inserts rolled cotton in cardboard containers. Fills shipping cartons with containers and places glued paper tape on tops to seal cartons.

Title: PROTECTIVE-SIGNAL-INSTALLER HELPER
Definition: Assists PROTECTIVE-SIGNAL INSTALLER to install protective signaling systems by erecting conduits, pulling wires, fastening pipe straps, and making soldered connections. Makes small installations independently. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.). Usually is required to possess identification card issued by local authorities.

Title: INTERNAL - COMBUSTION - ENGINE INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspector; inspector and teeter. Inspects internal combustion engines after test for conformance to blueprints and specifications, using measuring instruments and handtools: Reviews performance test report and compares log data, such as temperature, lubrication compression, horsepower, fuel consumption, and manifold pressure, with specifications Signs inspection tag to release engines from test floor or analyses data to locate assemblies and parts not functioning according to specifications. Measures dimen- slons of dissssembled parts and assemblies, such as pistons, cylinder liners, valves, bearings, shafts, governor, injectors, or carburetor, and clearances between moving and stationary parts, using scale, micrometers, special tools, and gaging setups. Compares measurements with specifications to locate faulty parts. Records findings and notifies supervisor of results of inspection. May inspect incoming materials for conformance with specifications. May disassemble engines in inspection process. May supervise crating and shipping of engines to consignees. May be designated according to type of engine inspected as DIESEL-ENGINE INSPECTOR; GASOLINE- ENGINE INSPECTOR.

Title: BALANCE TRUER
Definition: Taste and adjusts watch balance wheels to insure that rim is concentric with staff axis: Mounts balance wheel and staff on test stand or between Jaws of truing calipers, using tweezers, and twirls wheel by hand. Determines that dial gage readings are within acceptable limits as rim of revolving wheel brushes against gage arm on test stand or determines, with aid of a loupe, that there is no clearance variation between rim of wheel and caliper index pointer placed above rim. Bends rim to eliminate distortions, using tweeters or rim trench.

Title: BOWLING-ALLEY-INSTALLATION FOREMAN
Definition: bowling-alley mechanic; carpenter foreman, bowling alley. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in the installation and repair of bowling alleys and related equipment: Analyzes blueprints to lay out work. Directs workers in laying alleys on wood foundations set in concrete. Oversees leveling, scraping, sanding, and finishing of alley surfaces [FLOOR-SANDING-MACHINE OPERATOR; FLOOR FINISHER]. Directs workers in installing gutters, alley approaches, ball racks, pit racks, and seats. Verifies levelness of alleys, using carpenters level and rules, to insure conformity to specifications. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: FOREMAN, SANITATION
Definition: see FOREMAN, SANITATION.

Title: FUEL ATTENDANT
Definition: Controls equipment to regulate flow and pressure of gas from mains to fuel feed lines of gas-fired boilers, furnaces, kilns, soaking pits, smelters, and related steam-generating or heating equipment in such establishments as power plants, steel mills, pottery works, chemical plants, and petroleum refining facilities: Opens valve on feed lines to supply adequate gas for fuel when boilers are to be put In operation and to maintain standard pressure on gaslines. Closes valve to reduce gas pressure when increase in gas consumption by boilers causes pressure to rise. Observes, records, and reports flow and pressure gage readings on gas mains and fuel feed lines.

Title: SHELL-SIEVE OPERATOR
Definition: chip separator. Tends rotary and shaker screens that tumble primed rim-fire cartridge cases to shake out loose particles of priming mixture, sawdust, dirt, and chips and to screen out oversize and malformed cases. Records volume of production.

Title: RIDE ATTENDANT
Definition: starter. Directs patrons of amusement park in getting on and off riding device: Erects barrier in front of ride, admitting only as many persons to loading platform as can be seated on ride. Keeps order among patrons waiting to ride device. Fastens patrons' safety belts or bars to prevent injuries during ride. Assists children and elderly patrons from ride. Directs patrons from unloading platform to park grounds. May space rides operated in cars or sections to avoid danger of collisions. May collect tickets or cash fares. May clean and polish equipment and perform other minor maintenance work, such as replacing light bulbs.

Title: FOREMAN, CLAY PREPARATION
Definition: foreman, mad room. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in production of casting slip and plastic clay, used in forming pottery and porcelain ware: Directs in blending, mixing, filtering, and pugging clay. Inspects slip and plastic clay for specified composition, weight, specific gravity, and plasticity. Sets up and adjusts mixing and screen machines, filter presses, pug mills, pumps, and storage tanks. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: PLANT DIGG ER
Definition: Digs strawberry plants from ground, using fork and hoe. Grades, counts, and ties plants and packs them in crates, containing damp moss, for shipment or sale.

Title: INCOMING-FREIGHT CLERK
Definition: storage-wharfage clerk. Compiles documents on incoming cargo shipments to expedite removal of cargo from dock and prepares bill for shipping charges: Examines ship's manifest and bills of lading to determine work procedures for releasing cargo. Contacts terminal employees by telephone to determine when cargo will be available for removal from dock. Notifies consignee or his agent by telephone or letter of arrival dates of shipment, customs clearance requirements, and tonnage of shipment. Stamps bill of lading so that cargo can be removed from dock. Computes from bills of lading, shipping, storage, and demurrage charges, using calculator. Prepares bill for charges and submits it to accounting department for collection.

Title: TOBACCO GROWER
Definition: tobacco farmer; tobacco planter; tobacco raiser. Plants, cultivates, harvests, and cures tobacco: Operates farm machinery to break, smooth, and fertilize soil in seedbeds and fields, using tractor- or animal-drawn implements, such as plows, harrows, and cultivators [FARM-EQUIPMENT OPERATOR]. Plants seed in bed and covers bed with cloth or glass to protect seedlings from weather. Transplants tobacco plants in rows, using hand or machine transplanter. Breaks tops and suckers from plants to prevent seed development and encourage nutrition of leaves. Cuts tobacco plant (burley, broadleaf, havans seed), using knife or hatchet, or primed individual leaves (bright leaf, shade). Hangs plants or leaves on suspended sticks in curing sheds or bams. Directs workers engaged in planting, cultivating, and harvesting tobacco. Arranges with buyers for sale of crop. When processing burley tobacco, strips cured leaves from stalk, grades leaves, ties leaves into hands and packs each grade in baskets for marketing. Recordsoperaing expenses and profits, such as materials used, labor costs, machinery repairs, equipment purchased, and sale of crops. In some areas, particularly Connecticut valley, covers fields with muslin, supported by wires and posts, to grow cigar-wrapping leaves under artificial shade and humid conditions.

Title: SUPERINTENDENT, CONCRETE-MIXING PLANT
Definition: Manages a ready-mix concrete plant: Determines work procedure and assigns duties to personnel concerned with mixing and dispatching concrete and maintenance of plant and equipment. Inspects personnel performance for quality and quantity. Prepares reports on cost of plant operation and maintains personnel records. Hires, trains, and discharges workers. Coordinates activities of sales personnel.

Title: POWER BARKER OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine to remove bark and dirt from logs by one of the following methods: (1) Starts conveyor to move logs from pond to drum of barking machine. Moves lever to activate chains or start drum revolving to tumble logs and knock off bark. Turns valve to regulate water spray that removes adhering chips and dirt from log. Breaks up log jams in drum, using pike pole and chain hoist. (2) Moves lever to activate kicker arms that kick log into machine cradle. Turns controls that start log rotating and to regulate and direct pressurized water jet to remove bark and dirt. (8) Turns levers to control movement and centering of log in jet ring and to regulate pressure of water jets. Starts conveyors that carry logs from barking machine to saw deck. May be designated according to machine operated as DRUM-BARKER OPERATOR (paper & pulp); HYDRAULIC-BARKER OPERATOR; RING-BARKER OPERATOR (sawmill).

Title: MAGNET-VALVE ASSEMBLER
Definition: Fits together bushings, needle valves, springs, washers, and coils into housings to assemble electromagnet valves used to control flow of liquids or gases in diesel equipment: Presses washer-type ring over needle stem to assemble valve stem. Slides collar over stem and turns one-fourth turn to seat ring. Clamps valve stem in fixture and inserts needle valve and spring. Ad- Justs setscrew to hold needle valve in specified position shown on dial indicator. Inserts assembled valve stem into housing and plugs with bottle cap to hold in position temporarily. Clamps housing in holding fixture, removes bottle cap, and seats brass bushing in opening in valve housing around valve stem, using special tool and hammer. Dips plastic washer and bottom of magnet coil into varnish to form insulation between coll and housing. Wraps coil in fish paper and bolts and screws coil, springs, and washers to inside of housing, using ratchet wrench and screwdriver.

Title: REELER
Definition: Tends machine that rolls printed wallpaper into reels for further processing: Slides cardboard cylinder over wind up shaft and locks shaft in machine, using wrench. Threads wallpaper through machine and onto cardboard cylinder. Starts machine and observes winding until wind up shaft is loaded. Rolls completed reel of wallpaper to storage area. May tend coating machine that coats wallpaper with water-resistant solution [RECOATING- MACHINE OPERATOR]. May be designated according to type of machine operated as DUTCH REELER.

Title: ADVERTISING ASSISTANT
Definition: advertising man. Plans, or assists in planning, advertising program to promote sale of company's products: Consults with company officials, sales department, and advertising agency to develop promotional plans. Prepares advertising brochures and manuals for publication. Reviews and proofreads layout and copy before advertisement or brochure is printed. May write copy, do layout work, prepare sales kits, set up displays, and write sales outline for use by sales staff, or direct other workers performing these duties.

Title: UMBRELLA TIPPER, MACHINE
Definition: Attaches metal or plastic tips to corners of pre -stitched umbrella covers, using machine: Positions tips in machine fixture and holds corner of cover in position to receive tips. Presses pedal of machine to release tips and secures tips to corners of cover. May sew tips in place with needle and thread [UMBRELLA TIPPER, HAND[.

Title: CORN GRINDER
Definition: Tends grinding machine that hulls cooked corn and grinds it into masa (cornmeal dough) for use in production of products such as tortillas and corn chips: Scoops cooked corn into hopper of grinding machine and starts machine. Feels masa to determine consistency of grind, and adjusts grinding stones when necessary.

Title: GARMENT-TAG STRINGER
Definition: Strings garment tags with needle and string, cuts string between each tag with scissors, and ties string ends of individual tags in knot to form loop for tag.

Title: BESSEMER-CONVERTER BLOWER
Definition: bessemer-converter man; converter; converter man, steel converter. Operates bessemer converter from control board to oxidize elements, such as carbon, manganese, and silicon, from molten pig iron: Directs workers to charge converter with molten pig iron. Moves controls to raise converter to blowing position and to start blower that blasts air through tuyeres in bottom of converter. Observes color and intensity of flame at mouth of converter to determine progress of oxidation. Moves controls to regulate volume and pressure of air blast or to dump cold pig iron into converter to control temperature and rate of oxidation. Moves controls to lower converter and shut off air that terminates blow when metal has oxidized to specified composition, as indicated by characteristics of flame. Adds specified amounts of elements, such as carbon, manganese, and silicon, to recarbonize and deoxidize metal to form steel of known composition. Moves controls to tilt converter to pour steel into ladles for further processing.

Title: SHEET-METAL-LAY-OUT MAN
Definition: Lays out reference points on sheet metal for fabricating and assembling into sheet metal products: Traces layout marks from templates and applies knowledge of trigonometry and sheet metal design to project designs, including curved shapes, from blueprints. Designs and makes templates. May fabricate and assemble sheet metal parts to evaluate accuracy of layout.

Title: FOREMAN, CONCRETE-STONE FINISHING
Definition: finishing foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in repairing, etching, and polishing ornamental stone-faced or plain surfaced concrete products. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: LOADING-SHOVEL OILER
Definition: henchman; oiler. Lubricates loading shovel at strip mine. Shovels dirt and coal to keep bench (top of exposed coal seam) clear, and keeps power cable clear of treads as shovel moves into position. Guides trucks into loading position.

Title: CUSHION MAN
Definition: cushion maker; cushion staffer; machine staffer, automatic; upholstery helper. Fills cushion covers with moss, hair, kapok, down, foam cushions, or spring units by any of the following methods: (1) Stuffs loose fibers, layers of material, or foam cushions into cover with hands. Beats cushion with hands to smooth out lumps. (2) Places layers of cotton wadding or foam cushions in forming box of stuffing machine or tears and cuts wadding, covers cushion- spring assembly, and places wrapped spring assembly in box. Lowers top of forming box and pushes lever or turns hand wheel to close side panels and compress cushioning material. Slips cover over open end of forming box and depresses pedal to eject cushioning material into cover. (3) Dumps down, kapok, or other fibers into hopper of blower. Holds end of cushion cover over spout of blower and starts blower to fill cover. Weighs cushion and adds or removes material to obtain cushion of specified weight. May sew ends of cushion covers after filling with needle and thread or with power sewing machine.
