Title: UNDERGROUND FOREMNA
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of CABLE SPLICER (const.; light, heat, & power) and CABLE PULLER (const.; light, heat, & power) engaged in installing and repairing underground electric power cables and equipment: Requisitions cable and equipment. Throws switches to de-energize cable requiring repairs. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: ASSEMBLER, STEAM-AND-GAS TURBINE
Definition: lead man, turbine assembly. Fits machined parts and castings to erect steam and gas turbines according to drawings and specifications, using machine tools, power tools, handtools, and measuring instruments: Erects, levels, and alines vertical supports for bedplates of steam turbines, using levels, transit, and master straightedge. Lays out work for other assemblers on thrust end, oil tank, and cylinder assemblies. Chips, grinds, bores, and drills machined parts and casings, using portable grinders, boring bar, and lapping disk. Levels and alines high and low pressure cylinders, oil tank, thrust end assembly, and exhaust assembly, using pin gages. Scribes foundation holes, lays out offset marks, and directs machine operator to drill foundation boles. Shrink-fits spindle blade rings, diaphragm rings, dummy rings, ring gears, sleeves, couplings, and bushings on shafts to build turbine spindles, using portable gas beating unit. Measures clearance and alinement of spindle to cylinder, using micrometers and calipers. Adjusts spindle bearing pad or moves blade rings to obtain specified clearances. Starts auxiliary oil pump to flush oil piping and bearings. Starts turbine and measures balance of spindle, using vibroscope. Repairs worn and damaged turbines.

Title: SUPERVISOR OF SALES
Definition: Coordinates and publicizes tobacco marketing activities within specified area: Visits tobacco growers, buyers, and auction warehouses to cultivate interest and good will. Develops publicity for tobacco industry. Investigates and confirms eligibility of buyers. Collects membership dues for tobacco Board of Trade. Schedules tobacco auction dates. Records quantity and purchase price of tobacco sold daily, and prepares reports specified by Board. May prepare report of marketing activities for State and Federal agencies. May review and verify reports for individual warehouses. May examine quality and growth of tobacco in fields of individual growers and inform buyers of results.

Title: RECOVERY MAN
Definition: Ducon operator. Tends equipment such as scrubbing towers and centrifugal pumps, that recover powder from spray-tower exhaust gas and prevent air pollution: Starts fan to draw air and accumulated dust from spray tower into scrubbing tower. Starts steam pump to wet powder causing it to flow down baffle plates to bottom of tower. Opens valve to permit recovered powder to flow into storage tank for reuse.

Title: COIN-MACHINE ASSEMBLER
Definition: switchpanel mounter. Mounts and connects switch panels to control boxes of electric pinball machines. Attaches switch panels to control boxes, using screws and screwdriver, and solders switch panel wires to electric plugs of control boxes, using soldering iron.

Title: FIELDMAN, CHRISTMAS TREES
Definition: Negotiates with farmers and woodlot owners to purchase Christmas trees for resale. Explains contract features, such as price and condition of trees on delivery. Explains or demonstrates to sellers accepted techniques of cutting, baling, and loading of trees.

Title: DIE-CUTTING-MACHINE OPERATOR, AUTOMATIC
Definition: die cutter. Operates automatic die-cutting machine to cut various specified shapes from roll of felt: Positions dies into machine, and alines upper cutting die with surfaces of bed. Inserts shims between die and bed to set specified gap, and locks dies with wrenches. Places rolls of felt in feed holders, turns knobs to synchronize action of feed rolls with ram, and threads end of felt through feed rolls and die bed to takeoff conveyor. Starts machine and inspects sample cuts to determine conformity to specifications. May sew or glue together ends of rolls to form continuous feed.

Title: FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in producing and packaging chocolate and cocoa products: Designates quantities and types of beans to clean, roast, blend, alkalize, and grind to- make chocolate liquor. Indicates time sequence, quantity, type of chocolate liquor, and formulas to use to make cocoa and coatings. Trains workers in setting up and adjusting machines and equipment to achieve standards and overcome malfunctions. Reviews laboratory reports on quality control of products in process, such as shell content of nibs, fat content of cocoa powder, viscosity of coatings, and moisture content of alkalized beans. Reads thermometers and pressure gages on storage tanks and pipelines to verify specified temperature of liquids to prevent solidification. Oversees roasting of cocoa beans for adherence to flavor, taste, moisture content, and color standards. Inspects nibs for shell content and fineness of cracking. Inspects grinding of nibs for specified fineness of chocolate liquor. Tests liquor for fineness. Directs mixing, refining, tempering, conching, and molding operations to make sweet chocolate and coatings. Inspects products for specified viscosity, texture, color, and taste. Directs workers engaged in insect and rodent control and in cleaning production and storage areas. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: RAW-BAR MAN
Definition: Cleans and prepares shellfish for serving to customers Washes shellfish in water. Opens bivalves by Inserting blunt- edge knife between halves, forcing them apart, and cuts out inedible parts. Returns oysters and clams to half shell and arranges them on ice filled dishes or places them in Cold storage. Removes shells from shrimp and meat from crab and lobster shells, and arranges it In special glasses for serving as cocktails. Mixes meat with other ingredients and arranges mixture on plates for salads. Serves customers at bar. May place silverware, napkins, potato chips, and condiments on bar. May mix ketchup, horseradish, lemon juice, and other ingredients to make cocktail sauces. When preparing only oysters for use as food, may be known as OYSTERMAN.

Title: NAPPER TENDER
Definition: brushing operator; brash-machine operator; fleecing-machine operator; napper; napper operator; napping-machine operator; preparer. Tends machine that raises fibers on surface of cloth to give cloth soft, fluffy texture: Positions truck of folded cloth at entry end of machine or mounts roll of cloth on machine brackets. Sews cloth to lead cloth in napper with surface to be napped contacting napping cylinder. Feeds each lot of doth through machine for specified number of nappings. Examines and feels cloth to determine that finish conforms to standards. Ravels seams between cloth lots and doffs machine. May mark lot numbers on cloth with crayon. May turn handwheels to change machine speed and adjust cloth tension according to texture of cloth. May be designated according to type of material napped as SILK BRUSHER (textile).

Title: RADIOTELEPHONE OPERATOR
Definition: phone-circuit operator; radioman; radiophone operator; radiotelephone-technical operator. Operates and keeps in repair radiotelephone transmitter and receiving equipment for commercial communication: Throws switches to cut in power to stages of transmitter. Cuts in antennas and connects transmitting and receiving equipment into telephone system. Turns controls to adjust voice volume and modulation, and to set transmitter on specified frequency. Conducts routine tests and repairs transmitting equipment, using electronic testing equipment, and hand and power tools, to maintain communication system in operative condition. Must hold Radiotelephone Operator's License issued by Federal Communications Commission.

Title: FINAL INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects defective glass or mirrors to determine salvage ability: Examines glass or mirrors to determine extent of defect and routes them for repair, cutting to smaller size, or stripping of silver and paint. Writes replacement tickets for glass or mirror to be cut down or stripped. Marks area of mirror to be salvaged, using crayon or wax pencil. Measures mirror or glass todetermine footage loss, using ruler. Records number of glass or mirror pieces replaced, type of glass, and defect, site, and footage loss.

Title: MECHANIC, FIELD AND SERVICE
Definition: engine service man. Inspects and adjusts jet, prop jet, and propeller driven airplanes during and between test flights, following specifications: Opens engine throttle to full power and examines powerplant to detect excess vibration and leaks in engine parts, such as tubing connections and carburetors. Observes instruments to determine that factors, such as fuel and oil pressures, acceleration, and temperatures, meet specifications. Performs functional test of systems, such as landing gear and doors, rigging and controls, fuel, heating, ventilating, and pressurization, for conformance to specifications. Calibrates compasses and other directional equipment. Accompanies airplane on test and acceptance flights to make in-flight adjustments to controls. Records in log, during flights, work to be performed in shop or field to prepare airplane for delivery. Replaces malfunctioning parts, using hand- tools, portable power tools, precision measuring instruments, and testing equipment.

Title: DUMPER-BAILER OPERATOR
Definition: Dumps sand and cement over shot of nitroglycerine in oil or gas wells to provide tamp and bridge over area to be shot, using special bailer and hoist: Determines amount and consistency of tamping materials and cement, according to size, depth, and similar characteristic of borehole. Selects tools, such as packers, for use in borehole. Assembles and attaches tools and bailer to hoist line. Loads sand or other tamping materials into bailer and lowers bailer and tamping tools into borehole, using hoist. Mixes cement to specified consistency, using portable mixer. Loads cement in in bailer, using bucket. Lowers and dumps cement in borehole, using hoist. Cleans and repairs equipment.

Title: EDITOR, FINANCIAL
Definition: business -and- financial editor. Directs newspaper or magasine department dealing with financial and business news: Assigns REPORTERS to cover business or financial news stories or to prepare feature articles. Reviews copy for publication in accordance with accepted rules of style and format. Attends corporation press conferences, dedications of new plant sites and business structures, and business conventions or other meetings. Interviews business, Government and industrial leaders to secure information for news and feature articles. Reviews press dispatches from wire services to determine use and placement of story in financial section of newspaper, basing determination on relative significance of news item. Edits news releases submitted by business firms. Addresses civic groups and similar organizations on business subjects as newspaper's representative. May an, from experience, financial and stock- market transactions or project business trends for articles. In smaller establishments may edit copy, write headlines, and plan layout of news items in financial section of newspaper.

Title: HAT-FORMING-MACHINE FEEDER
Definition: cone-machine feeder; feeder; for feeder; fur weigher. Weighs out fur fibers for use in making bats, and spreads them on conveyor leading to hat-forming machine: Weighs out specified quantity of fur required to orm each hat, using scale. Spreads fibers on belt conveyor leading to feed gate of hat-forming machine, and moves lever to raise gate and dump fibers into machine. Stops conveyor after fur is dumped into machine.

Title: OVERLAY CUTTER
Definition: 651481.Builds up sections of base proofsheet to provide different pressure areas on press roller and reproduce various shades or tones of halftone cut: Examines proofsheet to determine which sections must be built up. Cuts identical sections from proofeheets, using knife, starting with those sections of proofsheet that are to reproduce lighter shades. Applies paste to cutout sections and presses them one on top of another, over identical area on base proofsheet.

Title: MECHANIC AIRCRAFT ACCESSORIES
Definition: mechanic, accessory rework-and- repair. Repairs, assembles, and tests aircraft accessories, such as power brake units, auxiliary electric motors, carburetors, spark igniters, valves, and hydromantic and vacuum pumps, using handtools and testing devices, and following shop orders and manufacturer's specifications: Disassembles unit, using hand or power wrenches and screwdrivers. Cleans parts by hand, using cleaning solutions, and polishing and lapping compounds. Measures parts to determine wear, using micrometers and dial indicators. Replaces defective parts and reassembles units. Tests units for conformance to specifications under simulated operating conditions, using equipment, such as voltage testers and hydraulic testing equipment.

Title: TIRE PROCESSOR
Definition: Removes brand name from cured, repaired tires that have not passed inspection as first tires, using portable buffer. Bands grade classification on tire according to specifications, using electric branding iron.

Title: MOLD CLEANER
Definition: Heats metallic bowling ball mold parts on electric plate and scrapes and buffo them to remove residue, using scraper and power-driven rotary *ire brush. May spray mold components with parting material to prevent corrosion and to prepare them for assembly.

Title: JOCKEY-ROOM CUSTODIAN
Definition: Insures that JOCKEYS scheduled to ride are present in jockey room at racetrack and that their dress and riding equipment meet track specifications: Notifies JOCKEYS when to dress. Inspects dressed JOCKEYS to insure that they have correct colors (silks), saddle numbers, and riding equipment. Informs STEWARD, RACETRACK of JOCKEYS not reporting to prepare for race. Maintains order in jockey room. Examines lead pads to determine that they meet track specifications. Gives directions to workers to clean jockey room.

Title: TOOL-MAKER APPRENTICE
Definition: Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: SUPERVISOR, CREDIT UNION
Definition: Manages credit union to maintain control and accountability of company credit union resources: Disburses funds and signs checks, notes, and other obligations in name of credit union. Reviews credit applications and makes loan recommendations to credit committee. Initiates payroll deductions authorized by employees, collects funds due, and makes bank deposits. Supervises workers engaged in collection of delinquent loan payments and possession of property pledged by borrowers as security, and directs preparation of periodic financial statements. Assists government representatives In regular audit of credit union records.

Title: DUMP-TRUCK DRIVER, OFF-HIGHWAY
Definition: Drives back or bottom dump truck especially constructed to haul earth, coal, ore, rock, or fill material over off-highway projects, such as underground or surface mines, construction projects, or industrial yards. Maneuvers truck having capacity of 20 to 50 tons over unpaved roads or open terrain to spot cargo hopper under loading chute, conveyor, or ramp, or under bucket of power shovel, and to transport contents to dumping area. Moves control handle to discharge contents.

Title: SORTER
Definition: Prepares reels of motion picture film for shipment, according to shipping order: Obtains reels of film from stock. Wraps paper band bearing film identification, around each reel, ties reels with string, and sets them aside for shipment.

Title: DIRECTOR, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION
Definition: community planning director; director, federated funds director, united fund; executive, community planning. Directs activities of organization, such as local community chest or council of social agencies, to coordinate functions of various community health and welfare programs: Organizes and develops planning program to ascertain community requirements and problems in specific fields of welfare work, and to determine which agencies can deal with them. Surreys functions of member agencies to avoid duplication of efforts and recommends curtailment, extension, modification, or initiation of services. Advises health and welfare agencies in planning and providing services baaed on community surveys and analyses. Reviews estimated budgets submitted by member agencies. Prepares and releases reports, studies, and publications to promote public understanding of and support for appropriate legislation. May recruit and train volunteer workers. May organize and direct campaign for solicitation of funds [DIRECTOR, JOINT FINANCING].

Title: SUPERINTENDENT, SCHOOLS
Definition: Administers affairs of city, county, or other school system under direction of board of education: Formulates plans and policies for educational program and submits them to school board for approval. Administers program for selection of school sites, construction of buildings, and provision of equipment and supplies. Directs preparation and presentation of school budget and determines amount of school bond issues required to finance educational program. Addresses community and civic groups to enlist their support. Interprets program and policies of school system to school personnel, to individuals and community groups, and to governmental agencies. Coordinates work of school system with related activities of other school districts and agencies. May Insure that laws applying to attendance of children at school are enforced. May supervise examining, appointing, training, and promotion of teaching personnel.

Title: FRONT-SIGHT ATTACHER
Definition: Attaches front sights to shotgun barrels: Secures barrel in rise and screws threaded shank of sight into hole near muzzle. Shears off excess shank extending into bore, using hammer and chisel. Feels sheared joint and sights through bore to verify smoothness.

Title: SCRAPER LOADER OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: mocker lender. Assists SCRAPER-LOADER OPERATOR in loading coal, ore, earth, or rock into cars, trucks, or onto conveyor for removal from underground mine or tunnel heading: Moves hose supplying air to pneumatic-powered loading machine to permit movement of machine and prevent damage to hose. Assists In setting up snatch blocks that anchor scraper-loader machine to posts or walls. May carry timbers and other materials and supplies. May shovel coal, ore, or muck (refuse) into cars or onto conveyor to clear work area. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: MANAGER, STAGE
Definition: Supervises activities of stage crew and coordinates production plans. Confers with DIRECTOR, STAGE concerning production plans. Arranges conference times for cast, crew, and DIRECTOR, STAGE, and disseminates general information about production. Calls performers at specified intervals before curtain time. Reads script during each performance and gives cues for curtain, lights, sound effects, and prompting performers. Interprets stage-set diagrams determine stage layout. Supervises stage crew engaged in placing scenery and properties. Devises emergency substitutes for stage equipment or properties. Supervises activities of one or more assistants.

Title: BRINE-WELL OPERATOR
Definition: pumpman, brine well. Tends pumps to maintain brine wells at specified levels to insure adequate salt supply for chemical processes: Turns valves and monitors gages and water-pressure recorders to maintain level and brine strength of wells within prescribed limits, and to reverse flow of flush wells as directed. Determines specific gravity of salt water in wells, using hydrometer. Determines iodine content of brine, using standard titration test. Monitors automatic pump operation and inspects water supply system to detect broken or frozen lines, stoppages, and leaks. Records brine strength and pressure in system for operating log.

Title: PATTERNMAKER, PLASTER
Definition: medel maker; plaster-pattern caster. Builds plaster and clay patterns used for making sand molds from which tools and parts used in aircraft manufacturing are cast, using any of the following methods: (1) Assembles metal and wood templates, using hand tools and power tools to form mockup frame of pattern. Tacks or wires mesh screen or wire to frame and spreads elay or plaster over mesh. Smooths clay or plaster to specified dimensions to form pattern, using hand- tools and measuring devices, such as surface gages, calipers, and protractors. (2) Brushes surface of die or other object with ant is ticking compound and spreads mixture of plaster and fiber or clay over surface to form cast. (3) Assembles metal or wood form around pattern and fills cracks and openings with clay. Brushes surfaces of pattern with antisticking compound to prevent adherence of plaster or elay and pours plaster or clay into enclosure. Reinforces plaster or clay with fiber, small steel rods, or heavy wire. (4) Lays out cross section ofpoduct on sheet metal or wood, following blueprints, work orders, or drawings, to form pattern for sweep. Cuts out drag and constructs swivel sweep, using hand or shop machine tools. Pours plaster or clay into modeling box and draws sweep across plaster or clay, forming pattern or mold. Patches broken edges and fractures of patterns and molds, using plaster or clay. Scrapes and shapes surfaces to specified finish, using scrapers and abrasives, and verifies dimensions, using gages, calipers, and protractors. Marks identifying information on patterns and molds, using crayon, paint, rubber stamp, or pointed tool. Brushes protective liquid on finished surfaces to harden and smooth them. May make patterns and molds of wax, rubber, and plastic materials. May cut templates for mockup frames, using handtools and power tools.

Title: ROUTER
Definition: dispatcher; marker, delivery; routing clerk. Stamps, stencils, letters, or tags packages, boxes, or lots of merchandise to indicate delivery routes. Reads addresses on articles and determines route, using standard charts.

Title: COIL TAPER, HAND
Definition: insulation wrapper; taper, hand; taping assembler. Winds asbestos, cotton, glass, mica, or varnished cambric wrappers or tape around coils to insulate and reinforce pre wound rotor and stator coils for electric motors and generators, using scissors, tape hook, mallet, and pliers: Secures coil in vise, straightens leads, and fastens terminals, using pliers and hammers. Cuts and scrapes temporary binding from coll, using pick and scissors. Brushes glue to end of tape and winds tape in specified number of layers tightly to coil nose or wraps sheet fiber insulation around coil and secures, using adhesive tape. May brush varnish between layers of tape. May cut sheet insulation to size, using scissors or knife. May dip coil leads into molten solder to insure secure connections. May be designated according to type of coil taped as ARMATURE-COIL TAPER; FIELD-COIL TAPER; ROTOR- COIL TAPER; STATOR-COIL TAPER.

Title: GYMANSTICATOR OPERATOR
Definition: Tests recoil mechanisms of antiaircraft guns for proper functioning, using special testing machine (gymnasti-cator): Positions gun in holding fixture, using wrenches. Sets electrical timing device that governs travel of counterrecoll. Turns valves on. compressed air cylinders of test machine to slide gun into and out of firing position (battery). Observes action of gun, and records time required for gun to return from battery to end of recoil travel.

Title: PROPERTY MANAGER
Definition: Coordinates activities of State land acquisition and disposal authority and negotiates purchase, rental, and sale of land on most favorable terms consistent with public policy. Negotiates or approves purchase or rental agreements for improved or unimproved land required by State. Directs disposal of unneeded land and structures by negotiated sale or auction. Directs collection and auditing of funds from sale or rental of property. May Inspect lands and recommend purchase, rental, or disposal. May be designated DIRECTOR, LAND BOARD in States investing responsibility for real estate transactions in elected or appointed board..Supervises and coordinates activities of personnel engaged in obtaining, moving, and fabricating props used in motion pictures: Reads script and confers with DIRECTOR (motion pic.; radio & tv broad.) to determine prop requirements for designated scenes. Assigns personnel to fabricate props, to obtain them from inventory, or to buy or rent from outside sources. Assumes responsibility for safekeeping and placement of props on sets during shooting of scenes. Instructs PROPERTY MEN to remove and store props at completion of shooting. May decorate sets.

Title: PLUMBER APPRENTICE
Definition: Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: HEAT-TREAT FOREMAN
Definition: foreman, hardening; foreman, heat treating; heat treater, head. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in hardening, tempering, annealing, and other heat-treating processes to condition metal work pieces and products, applying knowledge of heat- treating processes and properties and structure of metals. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (anyind.).

Title: PISTON MAKER
Definition: Finishes brasswind instrument pistons, and assembles piston parts, using handtools: Inserts crooks (curved tubes) through precut holes in piston blank, and cuts them to length, using sheet-metal snippers or table saw. Holds crooks over revolving balled-end mandrel and works balled-end handtool through crooks to expand them to limits of holes into which they are inserted. Solders bottom plate onto piston [SOLDERER-ASSEMBLER (welding)], and removes excess solder, using scraping tool. Operates turning lathe to face and bevel piston ends, and to shape and smooth external surface of piston. Operates drill press to tap threads into piston [DRILL- PRESS SET-UP OPERATOR, SINGLE SPINDLE (mach. shop)]. Solders crooks to piston blank, using silver solder and gas torch. Inspects finished pistons for defects, such as holes and dents.

Title: MUCKING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: mucker operator. Operates powered shovel or scraper loader (mucking machine) to hoist earth and rock, excavated from tunnel headings, onto cars or trucks. Moves levers to control movement of machine on narrow gage track and activate buckets or scrapers that scoop up materials and deposit them into dinkey cars, sweep materials from sides and bottom of tunnel heading in radial movement and deposit them on machine mounted conveyor, or dig into materials and drag them along platform to drop them through hole in platform into dinkey cars.

Title: REAGENT MAN
Definition: Tends mechanical agitator that mixes chemicals for use in separating metallic particles from ore gangue: Turns valves to pour specified amounts of chemical solutions from storage tanks into mixing tank. Weighs chemical compounds on scales and dumps chemicals into mixing tanks, using fork-lift truck. Starts agitator to blend mixture. Turns valves on pumps to transfer mixture to storage tank. May weigh steel rods and balls and transport them to mills, using air-powered dinkey engine. May open chute door of storage tank to charge ball mills.

Title: TUBE BUILDER, AIRPLANE
Definition: Cuts and cements rubber stock to build airplane tire tubes: Places templates on calendered gum stock, traces patterns, and cuts stock with scissors, holding edges at angle to obtain beveled cut. Washes edges with solvent and brushes on cement. Joins stock together to form tube by lapping and bonding edges with hand roller. Marks valve location with template and inserts valve in tube.

Title: WAIST PLEATER
Definition: Forms and tapes impressed pleats around waist of unfinished skirts: Lays material on pleat pattern and folds in pleats. Presses pattern with steam iron to retain pleats. Removes material and tapes waistline with masking tape to keep pleats in place.

Title: ROCK SPLITTER
Definition: block maker; driller; rabble-man. Splits rough dimension stone into smaller units, such as paving blocks, ashlar, or rubble, using air hammer, wedges, and feathers: Scans stone to determine rift and grain lines of splitting, usually at right angles to each other. Chips rough edges from stone, using chipping hammer. May be designated according to product made as PAVING-BLOCK CUTTER.

Title: SORTER OPERATOR
Definition: jumber sorter, machine. Grades green lumber as it passes on conveyor and starts sorting mechanism of machine that conveys lumber to designated racks: Determines length and thickness of board by comparing it with gaged marks on machine table. Lifts end of board and feels wood to estimate moisture content of board. Routes board to appropriate holding rack by pressing specified button on control panel.

Title: LOCKER-ROOM ATTENDANT
Definition: cage clerk; dressing-room attendant; floor nun; locker attendant; locker-room clerk; personal attendant; suit attendant. Assigns dressing room facilities, locker space or clothing containers, and supplies to patrons of athletic or bathing establishment: Issues dressing room or locker key. Receives patron's clothing-filled container, furnishes claim check, places container on storage shelf or rack, and returns container upon receipt of claim check. Issues athletic equipment, bathing suit, or supplies, such as soap and towels. May arrange for valet services, such as clothes pressing and shoe shining. May collect soiled linen and perform cleaning tasks, such as mopping dressing room floors and washing shower room walls [PORTER I (any ind.)]. May collect fees for use of facilities, equipment, or supplies.

Title: ENAMELER
Definition: Applies decorative enamel to Jewelry articles, such as pins, earrings, Insignia, and award medals, using handtools and electric oven: Cleans jewelry in baths of add and water, and scrubs surfaces with brush. Mixes ground colored enamel and distilled water, according to specifications. Applies enamel of various colors to designated areas of jewelry to form specified design, using spatula or pick. Places metal tray containing jewelry in electric oven to melt and fuse enamel to jewelry. Immerses jewelry in baths of add and water to remove oxide scale. Rubs enameled surfaces with abrasive stone to smooth and remove excess enamel. Reheats enamel in oven to produce luster.

Title: DRAWING-KILN OPERATOR
Definition: drawing-machine operator; kiln operator. Operates drawing kiln to process molten glass into continuous sheet of flat glass: Adjusts rheostat to control speed of rolls on kiln that draw glass sheet of specified thickness. Regulates gas-firing to edges of glass sheet to prevent slippage of sheet from knurl guide wheels. Inspects glass sheet through kiln peephole for defects, such as stones and blisters, as sheet is drawn vertically by rolls. Signals BALCONY MAN to open rolls and allow passage of defective area to prevent break in sheet. Receives gage readings and positions asbestos pads on sides of cooling jacket in kiln with iron rod to correct irregular thickness in glass sheet. Closes lower roll of drawing kiln to prevent broken sheets of glass from collapsing into kiln. Lights auxiliary gas jets in kiln to heat glass sheet below break and stop run of break.

Title: REFRIGERATION ENGINEER
Definition: Specializes in refrigeration engineering, usually in packing plants or iceplants, or may be engaged in manufacture and Installation of refrigeration plants or units.

Title: CONVEYOR-LINE WORKER, TELEVISION PICTURE TUBES
Definition: television -picturetube processor. Performs any combination of the following tasks in manufacture of television picture tubes: Inserts hoses into bulb neck and fills bulb to specified level with distilled water. Presses button to dispense measured amounts of chemical solutions into bulb to settle and form fluorescent screen on interior of bulb face. Cleans exterior of bulb face with sponge or cloth. Examines screen for defects, such as vibration and chatter marks, water and acid spots, and uneven distribution of screen coating. Marks defect on bulb and records defects on shrinkage sheet. Inserts hoses into bulb, sprays interior with cleaning solutions and water, and cleans interior of bulb, using brush. Places aluminum pellet in coil of aluminizing dolly. Positions bulb on dolly that carries bulb through series of coating and cooling chambers that vaporize pellet to form aluminum coating on bulb interior. Examines bulb for defects, such as blistered lacquer or aluminum coatings, pinholes in screen, and lacquer in cone. Examines inside dag coating for defects, such as peeling, thin dag, and blisters. Places tube base in preheater and positions jig on base. Straightens lead wires of tube mount and threads them through base. Clamps jig to tube mount, pulls lead wires taut through base, and cuts excess wire. Inserts anode lead into anode button to assemble base and mount. Applies flux to base pins and moves controls of soldering device to solder mount wires to base pins. Examines wires and pins for defective soldering, using mirror. Places ion trap around tube mount. Starts coiler unit that scrubs tube mount with high-voltage current to burn away impurities and prevent arcing. May be known according to specific tasks performed as ALUMINIZING INSPECTOR; BASER; BASE SOLDERER; DAO INSPECTOR; MOUNT SCRUBBER; SCREENER; SCREEN INSPECTOR.

Title: CUFF CUTTER
Definition: knit wrist cutter. Tends battery of machines that cut and fold knit tubing for use as cuffs on gloves or garments: Pushes box of knit tubing from storage to machine, using handtruck. Turns screws on cams that control speed and motion of cutting blade and feeding mechanism to cut tubing to specified length, using handtools. Threads end of tubing through guides and feeder rollers, over spreader arms, and under cutting blade. Starts machine that automatically cuts and folds cuffs. Removes tray or box of cut and folded cuffs from delivery end of machine. Replaces dull cutting blades, using handtools.

Title: STREETCAR-REPAIRMAN HELPER
Definition: car-body-inspector helper. Performs any combination of tasks to assist STREETCAR REPAIRMAN in repairing streetcar bodies: Tightens loose bolts and screws and replaces worn or broken stirrups, using handtools. Replaces or tightens worn or loose weather stripping on windows. Repairs torn upholstery, using needle and thread. Lubricates car. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: BOX PRINTER
Definition: box- press man; box-printing-machine operator; printer man; printing- machine operator; wood printer. Sets up and operates machine that prints trademarks, designs, or identifying data on cardboard or wooden boxes, using one of the following methods: Selects printing plate or type slug, or sets type, according to oral instructions or written job order. Fastens type or printing plate in holding mechanism of machine, using handtools. Fills fountains with ink of required color or colors and adjusts rate of flow of ink with finger screws. (1) Stacks boxes or box pieces in feed hopper of automatic printing machine and removes them from discharge hopper, or feeds boxes or box pieces into machine, one at a time, and removes them after printing. (2) Places box ends on holding plate and depresses pedal that lowers printing plate onto box end. Observes edges of wooden box parts for imperfections, such as split, ragged, or uneven edges, and sets them aside. Removes type or plate and ink rollers and cleans them with chemical solution. May brand wooden boxes [BOX-BRANDING-MACHINE OPERATOR].

Title: BINDING-END STITCHER
Definition: Operates sewing machine to stitch binding to unfinished corners of woven fiber rugs to prevent raveling. Cuts thread, using scissors.

Title: GOLF-CLUB REPAIRMAN
Definition: Repairs worn or damaged golf clubs or customizes golf clubs according to customer specifications, using handtools: Dismantles golf clubs and replaces worn or damaged parts or parts specified by customer, such as head, shaft, sole plates, and composition inlays in faces of woods, using screws, rivets, epoxies, files, sandpaper, drills, hammers, heating torch, and vise. Wraps shanks of clubs with cord or cements on plastic sleeves to prevent shanks from splitting. Removes old grips. Attaches new grips by applying listing materials to build up handle area and by wrapping leather strip over listing materials, or brushes on adhesive and slips molded rubber grips onto shaft. Reweights clubs by adding or subtracting lead or brass weights to achieve swing weight specified. Sands and files faces of woods or hammers heads of irons to change loft or lie of clubs or to open or dose faces of clubs. Stains, shellacs, or oils wooden heads and shafts and polishes steel heads on buffing wheel to finish clubs. May make clubs to customer specifications, using ready-made shafts and club heads and be designated GOLF-CLUB MAKER.

Title: INTERLACER
Definition: hand lacer; weaver. Weaves decorative designs in shoe uppers: Draws strips of material, such as fabric or leather, between slits in shoe upper to weave decorative design. May cut slits in upper to accomodate weaving, using knife.

Title: SHEET-METAL-FABRICATING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Sets up and operates machines such as forming, slitting, riveting, and spot-welding machines to shear, slit, saw, bend, form, and Join together sheet metal, and automatic or multipurpose machines which burr, trim, bead, groove, and crimp sheet metal in one continuous operation. Operates machines, such as brakes, nibbles, rolls, and shears, to produce sheet metal parts. Does not allow for thickness of metal to develop layouts or set up machines. Does not operate machines used only for heavy metal fabrication, such as heavy duty presses or vertical rolls. Does not perform multiple pass operations or preheat metal.

Title: DIRECTOR, SPECIAL EDUCATION
Definition: Formulates programs and policies for public schools, public agencies, and state institutions, relating to education and training of mentally and physically handicapped children: Reviews existing programs with personnel concerned. Revises and formulates policies and programs pertaining to activities, such as screening, placement, education, and training of children. Organises and conducts conferences to interpret policies and programs, train and prepare teachers, instructors, and other personnel.

Title: FOREMAN, CHANNEL PROCESS
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in producing carbon black by channel process [partial combustion of natural gas in burner buildings (hothouses)], palletizing carbon black in rotating drums, and bagging and shipping carbon black. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: DIRECTOR, PROGRAM
Definition: Gives directions to members of cast and technical crew during rehearsals and filming of motion pictures or broadcasting of radio and television programs: Distributes parts to cast and explains desired interpretation. Criticizes acting and suggests changes as necessary. Informs technicians of scenery, lights, properties, and other equipment required. Gives directions to cast and technicians from control room during telecast to keep them informed of effects desired. May operate controls to switch cameras in and out. May hire stage crew and property men. Is usually designated according to type of production as DIRECTOR, MOTION PICTURE (motion pic.); DIRECTOR, RADIO (radio & tv broad.); DIRECTOR, TELEVISION (radio & tv broad.).

Title: PHOTOCOMPOSING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: typesetter. Sets up and operates photocomposing machine to transfer data from perforated tape into print on film or photographic paper: Loads roll of film or paper in machine magazine. Secures roll of perforated tape on machine reel and threads end of tape through machine feed rollers. Selects type font according to size and face of type specified and positions it on photographic unit. Turns dials to adjust line spacing and light intensity according to size and face of type. Starts machine that automatically prints type onto film or paper according to coded signal on tape. Removes finished copy from magazine for development.

Title: SPOTTER
Definition: Identifies stains in washable cotton and synthetic garments or household linens and applies chemicals until stain dissolves, using brush, sponge, or bone spatula to rub chemicals into garment: Positions article on worktable. Spots articles stained with oil, grease, blood, or other stains before they are laundered and removes spots from other stained articles after they have been washed, using chemicals. Places spotted articles in net bags and return them to washroom. Bleaches and washes some articles in small washing machine.

Title: CLAIM ADJUSTER
Definition: field-claims representative; insurance adjuster; investigator. Investigates claims for loss or damages filed in conjunction with insurance policy and tries to effect settlement out of court: Examines claim form and other records to determine insurance coverage. Interviews or corresponds with claimant and witnesses, consults police and hospital records, and inspects property damage to determine extent of company's liability, varying method of investigation according to type of insurance. Prepares report of findings and negotiates settlement with claimant. When settlement cannot be negotiated, recommends litigation by legal department. May attend litigation hearings. Does not settle life accident-and-sickness claims. May be designated according to type of claim adjusted as ADJUSTER, CASUALTY INSURANCE; ADJUSTER, FIDELITY AND SURETY BONDS; ADJUSTER, FIRE INSURANCE; ADJUSTER, MARINE INSURANCE.

Title: HANGER
Definition: bandies hanger; hands hanger. Hangs bundles of tobacco on sticks moving on chain conveyor to redrying machine: Removes bundles from table and observes color shade. Spreads leaves of bundle to form opening and hang bundle on stick conveying bundles of similar color shade. May shake bundles that have been packed in hogsheads to loosen leaves prior to hanging bundles on stick [SHAKER].

Title: FINISHING FOREMAN
Definition: finishing foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in finishing, packaging, shipping, and inspecting fiber carpets, rugs, and samples. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR
Definition: powerhouse attendant Controls powerhouse equipment, such as converters, rectifiers, transformers, and generators, to direct, distribute, and maintain power to chemical processing equipment, according to demand: Moves switches on central control panel to regulate converters and rectifiers to convert alternating current or direct current and transmit it to electrolytic cell department, according to production demand. Observes demand meters, gages, and recording instruments and moves controls to insure efficient power utilization, equipment operation, and maintain power distribution, according to departmental demands. Monitors gages, alarms, and oscilloscopes to detect and prevent damage to equipment and disruption of power. Records operational data, such as chart and meter readings, power demand and usage, malfunctions and repairs, and operating time. Cleans, lubricates, repairs, and adjusts equipment, using hand tools, May turn valves to regulate pressure on lines drawing chlorine to electrolytic cells. When controlling specific equipment only, may be designated by unit as MOTOR-GENERATOR-SET OPERATOR; RECTIFIER OPERATOR.

Title: TURBINE INSPECTOR
Definition: Inspects valves, control settings, alinement, and clearance of moving parts, and operation of steam and gas turbines under simulated load conditions to detect defects of materials or workmanship, using micrometers, calipers, and transit: Examines turbine, generator, and exciter bedplate to detect faulty alinement and centering, using straightedge, levels, and transit. Centers leveling bar in turbine cylinder and measures from bar to blade shroud to verify blade ring alinement, using micrometers. Measures clearance between blade and cylinder, using micrometer. Runs turbine at critical speed and tests balanceof rotating parts, using vibroscope. Records relay, bearing oil pressure, vacuum, and oil temperature during test.

Title: DYE WEIGHER
Definition: drag-room man; dye- chemist assistant; dye maker; dyer assistant; dyer, second; dyestuff weigher; laboratory-man assistant: second hand, dye house. Mixes dyes and chemicals for use in dyeing products, such as furs and textile yarns and fabrics: Weighs out quantities of powdered or liquid dyes and chemicals, following formula sheet. Pours dyes and chemicals Into pail or mixing tank and turns valve to admit water into tank or pail up to mark on container wall. Stirs ingredients with paddle and injects steam into solution to dissolve dye. Dumps contents of pail into supply tank or turns valves to transfer dye solution from miring tank to supply tanks in dye room as notified by light or speaker system. Inventories dyes and chemicals and notifies DYER, MASTER as supplies are needed. May dye sample swatch, compare dyed swatch with standard swatch, and inform DYER, MASTER when dyed swatch varies from standard. May be designated according to dye mixed as INDIGO MIXER (textile).

Title: LIP-OF-SHANK CUTTER
Definition: Tends machine that cuts lip (inside edge) of shank on insole of shoe to make it more flexible: Adjusts screw to set gage for size of cut determined on basis of size of insole. Sets insole, inner up, on machine bed with lip of shank against gage stop. Depresses lever to operate vertical plunger which makes cuts on insole at lip of shank.

Title: SALVAGE ENGINEER
Definition: Plans and oversees salvaging of parts and materials, such as metals, oils, packing, and mechanical equipment: Oversees operations of a salvaging plant applying wide knowledge of the use and properties of metals and materials used in manufacturing, or salvaging processes, and of the operation and maintenance of equipment, such as straightening and threading machinery, power hammers, punches, shears, presses, grinders, centrifuges, and melting tanks, used in salvaging processes. Analyzes rejected items, applying principles of structure, mechanics, and design to determine causes of rejection arising from fabrication, machining, welding, processing, assembly, and related. Plans measures to prevent similar rejections. Prepares sketches and instructions for repair and disposition of rejected stock. Investigates defective purchased articles.

Title: NURSE, GENERAL DUTY
Definition: nurse, staff. Renders general nursing care to patients in hospital, infirmary, sanitarium, or similar institution: Administers prescribed medications and treatments in accordance with approved nursing techniques. Prepares equipment and aids PHYSICIAN during treatments and examinations of patients. Observes, records, and reports to supervisor or PHYSICIAN patient's condition and reaction to drugs, treatments, and significant incidents. Rotates among various clinical services of institution, such as obstetrics, surgery, orthopedics, out- patient and admitting, pediatrics, psychiatry, and tuberculosis. May assist with operations and deliveries by preparing rooms, sterile instruments, equipment, and supplies, and handing, in order of use, to SURGEON I or OBSTETRICIAN. May make beds, bathe and feed patients, and assist in their rehabilitation. May serve as leader for group of personnel rendering nursing care, to number of patients.

Title: FIRE EATER
Definition: Pretends to eat fire to entertain audience at carnival or sideshow: Dips cotton ball on end of stick into bowl of alcohol or other combustible liquid. Ingites cotton and inserts blazing ball into mouth while exhaling air that extinguishes flame.

Title: BILLING CLERK
Definition: .bill-preparation clerk; charge clerk. Prepares invoices and bills of lading: Computes amounts due from records, such as purchase orders, sales tickets, and charge slips, using adding or calculating machine. Types invoices, listing items sold, amounts due, credit terms, and date of shipment. Types bills of lading and lists weight and serial number of items sold, using specifications book. May type shipping labels. May type credit memorandums to indicate returned or incorrectly billed merchandise. May type credit forms for customers or finance companies. May be designated according to type of billing done as Bill-OF- LADING CLERK; INVOICE CLERK I; MAIL-ORDER BILLER (ret. tr.; whole, tr.); TOLL- BILLING CLERK (tel. & tel.).

Title: BELTMAN
Definition: Moves levers to release and regulate flow of coal through gate onto conveyor used to load coal into seagoing vessels. Turns water valve to spray coal. Pushes switch to stop conveyor when overloaded.

Title: HARVEST HAND, FRUIT
Definition: Harvests fruit, including berries, citrus fruit, or nuts, working as crew member: Spreads canvas to catch fruit knocked from tree, and shakes tree, using rubber mallet or hooked pole, or observes tree being shaken by SHAKING- MACHINE OPERATOR. Carries canvas to truck or gondola and empties fruit. Picks fruit from tree by twisting and pulling fruit, or cuts fruit from tree, using knife or shears. Stands on ladder or elevated platform to reach fruit in upper part of tree. Picks fruit according to size, using sizing ring to gage fruit, and places fruit in containers. Pulls or cuts bunches of grapes from vines and picks berries by hand or by raking them from bushes or vines. Strips cranberries from vines, using pronged scoop or snapper, and drops them into containers. Pours cranberries through screen to remove vines and grass. Dumps containers of fruit onto conveyor belts or loads them onto trucks. May be designated according to fruit harvested as HARVEST HAND, BERRY; HARVEST HAND, CITRUS FRUIT; HARVEST HAND, CRANBERRY BOG; or according to work performed as APPLE PICKER; CRANBERRY SCREENER; WALNUT KNOCKER. See volume II for additional titles.

Title: TUMBLER OPERATOR
Definition: drier operator; drying-machine operator; drying-tumbler operator; tumbler-drier operator; tumbler man. Tends machines that fluff-dry laundered articles or dry and deodorize dry cleaned items Transfers partially dried articles from extractor by hand or by use of hand truck and places them in drum of tumbler. Turns pointer on dial of machine timer for drying cycle, according to type of fabric and weight of items being dried. Starts drum and blower. May hang delicate fabrics in heated cabinets to dry. May tend extractor (EXTRACTOR OPERATOR (any ind.)]. May fold finished articles and stack them into bundle.

Title: ENGRAVER, PICTURE
Definition: Engraves steel dies to represent portraits, landscapes, figures, and ornamental engravings for making plates to print bonds, stamps, currency, and other paper securities, following models and oral instructions: Traces model of drawing freehand on gelatin sheet, using magnifying glasses and graver. Makes wax impression of tracing, transfers tracing to polished steel die, and stains design with weak acid solution. Engraves or etches lines, dots, and dashes in various depths, widths, spacing^ and directions to portray features, such as drapery, foliage, or flesh by either one or combination of following methods: (1) Draws design through transparent, add resistant background on steel plate, using tempered steel point, and washes design with add that etches lines and other markings in steel surface to reproduce wood, stone, foliage, and sky. (2) Cuts or carves lines of design in surface of steel die, using graver, repeating cuts to obtain required depth for portrayal of flesh, hair, drapery, and clothing. Makes proofs of engraved design as work progresses and reworks engraving to obtain exact duplicate of model.

Title: TRANSIT OPERATOR
Definition: Operates diesel or electric powered transit bus to transport passengers over established city route according to set time schedule: Gives information to customers as to routes, transfer points, and street locations. May assist driving instructor to determine acceptability of new drivers. May be designated according to type of bus operated, as MOTOR-COACH DRIVER; TROLLEY-COACH DRIVER.

Title: HAY FARMER
Definition: Raises crops, such as timothy, clover, and alfalfa, to be used as hay: Determines kind and amount of hay to be grown depending on market conditions and location of farm. Selects and purchases seed, fertilizer, and farm machinery, and hires and directs farm workers engaged in planting, cultivating, and harvesting crop. Performs various duties of farm workers, depending on size of farm, including setting up and operating farm machinery [FARM HAND]. Arranges with buyers for sale of crop.

Title: SUPERVISOR, HISTORIC SITES
Definition: Directs and coordinates activities of personnel engaged in investigating, acquiring, marking, improving, and preserving historic sites and natural phenomena in conformity with State policy: Authorizes acquisition and improvement of sites, such as historic homes and battlefields, within allocated budget. Recommends appropriation of additional funds where necessary to purchase or restore landmarks. Negotiates with representatives of local governments, philanthropic organizations, and other interested groups to acquire properties. Provides information and encouragement to private Individuals or civic groups attempting to acquire and maintain landmarks not considered feasible for State acquisition. Directs or participates in archeological research efforts in State parks. Directs workers engaged in preparation of brochures, exhibits, maps, photographs, and similar materials to stimulate public interest in visiting sites. Serves as custodian of historic documents acquired during research efforts.

Title: PUFFING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: puffer. Operates puffing machine to raise (puff) designs and produce embossed effect on articles, such as leather pocketbooks, shoes, gloves, draperies, and bathrobes: Threads hollow needle of machine with cotton or silk thread. Inserts needle into previously formed pockets (stitched grooves) on underside of material.Depresses pedal to release compressed air that blows thread through needle and into pockets to create embossed pattern.

Title: CLEANER AND PREPARER
Definition: Cleans and applies paint and masking materials on motor and generator subassemblies to preserve surface for further processing: Brushes solvents onto parts or dips them into caustic solutions to loosen paint, grease, dirt, and other foreign substances. Rinses parts with hot water. Removes loosened paint, using scraper, wire brush, or portable buffer. Brushes grease and masking compound on subassemblies, inserts cork-plugs into holes, and tightens screws to keep insulating material or paint from specified areas. Coats parts with paint or insulating material, using spray gun or dipping tank.

Title: HEATER TENDER
Definition: cure man; heater roan; heater steam-tender; rubber carer; vulcanizer operator. Tends horizontal pot heaters or cylindrical ovens that cure rubber goods: Places or directs other workers in placing trays or mandrels of rubber goods, such as hose, airplane deicers, footwear, and weather stripping, onto truck manually or with hoist. Pushes loaded truck into heater and bolts or turns capstan wheel to lock heater door. Notes time or sets automatic timer for specified curing time and turns valves to admit steam and regulate temperature, and to admit ammonia when specified. Turns valve to release steam from heater. Pulls .truck from heater, using metal hook. Directs other workers and participates in unloading trucks. Twists tubular rubber goods onto mandrels with aid of air hose to maintain shape during cure. May couple rubber hose to water or air pressure lines to maintain shape of hose during cure. May unwind fabric wrappers from cured hose. May tape rubberized vacuum blanket over deicers to facilitate curing. May be designated according to product cured as FABRIC- FLAP-HEATER TENDER (rubber tire & tube); INNER- TUBE CURER (rubber tire & tube).

Title: COAL SAMPLER
Definition: Collects coal samples from hopper cars or coal bunkers for testing by FUELS ANALYST (profess. & kin.): Drives required size of pipe into coal at intermittent points in car or bunker to gather sample of contents, using sledge hammer. Withdraws pipe and contents and dumps sample into container. Collects samples from designated cars in shipment or bunkers to obtain representative sample. Records source of sample and delivers sample to coal-testing laboratory.

Title: FIXED-CAPITAL CLERK
Definition: Keeps records of fixed-capital accounts: Posts completed gas or electric work orders to respective accounts in plant ledgers. Appraises retirement values of equipment, such as gas mains, regulators, meters, and transformers, and posts retirements to fixed-capital record books. Balances fixed-capital record books with respective control accounts in general ledger. Prepares journal vouchers, makes trial balances, and compiles reports of money charged to fixed-capital accounts.

Title: ASSOCIATION EXECUTIVE
Definition: executive, trade-or-professional organization. Coordinates any combination of following activities of professional or trade association and negotiates with leaders of government, business, and other interested groups to implement policy of association and achieve objectives of members: Directs, through subordinates, conduct of surveys and compilation of statistics on members, such as average annual income, production output, or reaction to common problems. Prepares or directs workers engaged in preparation of educational materials, such as newsletters, magazines, charts, news releases, radio scripts, and special research studies for information of membership or public. Provides information and technical assistance to members, customers of members, or public relating to business operations or product represented by association. Conducts or participates in news conferences, delivers speeches, and negotiates with representatives of government, business, labor, and other organizations to encourage acceptance of membership viewpoints. Plans and coordinates membership conventions, trade exhibits, and local or regional workshops to improve communication and facilitate membership objectives. Assigns or recommends members to committee positions as needed. Recommends changes in policy, acceptance or expulsion of members, and levying of special assessments to appropriate committees. Directs workers engaged in maintenance of membership records, processing of applications, and collection of dues. May conduct investigations into professional conduct, competence, or financial responsibility of members to enforce quasi-legal standards for membership. May be designated according to area of responsibility as DIRECTOR or PUBLICATIONS; EXECUTIVE SECRETARY; MEMBERSHIP SECRETARY; REPRESENTATIVE, GOVERNMENT RELATIONS; RESEARCH DIRECTOR.

Title: GLUTEN-SETTLING MAN
Definition: Tends settling tanks that separate gluten from water:Turns valves to discharge gluten and water from starch tables into tank. Turns and adjusts inlet and outlet valves to maintain constant level in tank until water has drained from settled grain. Starts pump that transfers gluten to plate press. Pushes remaining gluten from tank with squeegee and cleans tank with hose.

Title: GOLF-BALL TRIMMER
Definition: Shaves flash from molded golf balls, using trimming machine: Positions golf ball in locating cup. Depresses pedal to move golf ball against driver cup. Presses degrooving knife against rotating golf ball to shave flash. Releases pedal to drop golf ball in chute. Keeps production records.

Title: DYE-REEL-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: dye-room helper; laborer, wash- and- dye house. Assists DYE-REEL OPERATOR (knit goods; textile) to bleach or dye knit tubing by performing any combination of following tasks: Mounts cloth rolls on brackets and feeds end of cloth through swing-folding attachment of machine that unwinds cloth into hand truck. Hangs end of tubing over winding reel in dye beck (tub) and sews ends together to make continuous loop, using needle and thread. Ravels connecting seams after rinsing and guides cloth over doffing reel into hand truck. Turns valves to drain, rinse, and fill tanks with water. Carries chemicals, such as dyes, bleaches, and scouring agents, from mixing room to dye house and pours chemicals into beck. Conveys knit tubing between departments, using hand truck. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: FOREMAN, WIRE-COIL COMPONENTS
Definition: foreman, assembly. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in soldering coils to terminals and plugs, and installing colls in brackets and cases to form electronic components, such as transformers, resistors, and chokes: Sets up and adjusts coil-winding machines and arbor presses for winding and assembly operations. Examines assemblies for defects and tests .assemblies for electrical characteristics, such as specified inductance, impedance, resistance, voltage, and current, using Q meter, Wheatstone Bridge, oscilloscope, voltmeter, and ohmmeter. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: HEADWAITER
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of dining room personnel to serve food aboard ship: Assigns duties, work stations, and responsibilities to personnel and directs their performances. Inspects dining tables and work areas for cleanliness. Greets patrons and shows them to dining tables. Requisitions supplies, such as glassware, china, and silverware. Authorizes personnel to work overtime. May suggest entrees, dinner courses, and wines to guests. May serve wine (STEWARD, WINE].

Title: SUPERVISOR, MOBILIZATION PLANNING
Definition: Formulates plans for rapidly increasing company production during national emergency: Determines preparedness measures which would be most effective. Estimates costs of mobilization, considering such factors as manpower, machine tool, and facilities requirements and subcontracting plans. Analyses most critical factors of data submitted by each plant department, and determines best use of funds and maximum production levels. Resolves disagreements between departmental reports of company's ability to accelerate. Recommends changes in operating methods to increase efficiency. Compiles reports encompassing all phases of preparedness within company.

Title: INSPECTOR, CHIEF
Definition: see WAX PATTERN REPAIRER.

Title: BENCH MECHANIC, STEEL WELD
Definition: bench assembler, machined parts, detail man: fitting man; metal fitter; subassembly assembler; weld-set-up mechanic. Bolts, rivets, or tack-welds together parts of airplanes, such as motor mounts, cockpit cowlings, and cockpit enclosures, to temporarily or permanently unite them: Ascertains from blueprints the most advantageous system of assembly. Examines supplementary parts for defects, using squares, micrometers, and rules to test measurements. Places parts in Jig or fixture to insure proper relative fit of piece at all points. Makes adjustments, using mallets and files, to improve the juxtaposition of parts. Secures pieces together with bolts, rivets, or temporary spring fasteners, or temporarily welds them. Reshapes and straightens fittings warped by heat of welding process by measuring amount of deformation, using micrometers, calipers, squares, and rules, and hammering and bending parts to desired shape. May fit and assemble parts without aid of jigs or fixtures when building equipment for new aircraft types. May use common metal working machines, such as drill presses and honing machines.

Title: HEEL SPRAYER, MACHINE
Definition: prayer. Tends machine that sprays wood or plastic heels with lacquer for preservative and decorative effect: Pours lacquer into dispenser. Turns valve to adjust spray mechanism and seats heel on spindle. Activates revolving spindle and spray mechanism to spray lacquer on heel. Examines heel to determine coverage. Adds thinning solution to lacquer as needed. Loads finished heels on rack to dry. May spray leather heels with wax.

Title: MOLDER, WAX
Definition: Tends equipment that molds wax, recovered from processed petroleum, into cakes: Turns valves to fill molds with hot wax. Moves controls to circulate chilling fluid through molds, solidifying wax. Removes wax cakes from molds.

Title: HIDE SPREADER
Definition: Salts (cures) and stacks animal hides to prepare them for storage: Transports hides from killing department to storage room or receives them from conveyor chute. Stacks hides for curing by laying hides, flesh side up, in layers. Shovels salt between each layer. May remove hides from cured stack, place them on table, and shake out salt. May trim hides with knife and record weight and grade on production sheet. May roll and tie hides to form compact bundle.

Title: SEISMOLOGIST
Definition: Works at fixed locations throughout globe and studies courses and phenomena of earthquakes, using special devices and machines, including seismograph. Establishes existence of active fault lines or areas where earthquakes have occurred and near which it would be hazardous to build cities, dams, or lofty structures.

Title: KNURLING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends band-seating machine that roughens the grooves (band seats) of artillery shells so that brass or copper bands affixed by BANDING-MACHINE OPERATOR will secure shell and rotate it when fired: Positions shell in chuck of lathe, using wrench to tighten chuck. Moves lever, causing the shell to rotate. Presses and releases pedal when band seat is sufficiently scored and removes processed shell from chuck.

Title: FILAMENT MAKER
Definition: heater maker; sleeve-filament former; spade-winding-machine operator. Tends machine that cleans, winds, and cuts wire to form filaments used to heat cathodes of electron tubes: Places spool of wire on spindle, threads wire around tension pulleys and through guide, and starts machine. Removes formed filaments and examines them for defects, such as bent wire and chipped coating, and for specified length. Places filaments in trays. May place filled trays in cartons and record spool and lot number on label.

Title: STAGE-SCENERY DESIGNER
Definition: scenic designer; theatrical-scenic designer. Designs sets for theatrical productions: Studies period of architecture and decoration which represents time of play. Sketches and paints plans. Presents plans to DIRECTOR, STAGE and PRODUCER for approval. Builds miniature sets in cardboard, plaster, or sponge. Prepares working drawings shoving elevation and plan of stage in detail for scene builders. May designate size and oversee building of furniture and setting according to miniature set. May create special stage lighting to achieve dramatic or decorative effects. In experimental theaters, plans stage sets for mobility, Interchange- ability, and economy in accord with budget limitations.

Title: LABORER, PIE BAKERY
Definition: Performs any combination of duties involved in preprocessing fruit to be used in making pies and other bakery products: Feeds automatic machine that peels, cores, and slices fruit. Fills containers with sliced fruit from discharge conveyor or bin. Examines fruit and discards spoiled or damaged pieces. Loads and unloads trucks by hand and transports material to and from storage areas, using handtruck. Cleans machines and work areas, using broom, mop, brush, scraper, and rags.

Title: CIGAR MAKER
Definition: finished -cigar maker; out-and-out cigar maker, hand; stogie maker, hand. Rolls cigars by hand: Rolls filler, wraps filler with binder [BUNCH MAKER, HAND], and wraps bunch with wrapper leaf [ROLLER HAND I]. Presses cigars In molds to obtain finished shape [MOLD PRESSMAN]. May be designated by type of cigar rolled as TOBY MAKER.

Title: STRIKER
Definition: driver. Rows out to sea in boat from mother ship, in advance of FISHERMAN, PURSE SEINE to locate school of fish sighted by another fisherman: Stands on platform in bottom of boat, rows toward school of fish, and signals to net boats with oar to indicate direction of movement of school. Splashes water with oar, on opposite side of school from net boats, to prevent fish from escaping as they are encircled by purse seine (net).

Title: HARNESS MAN, PLACING-IN
Definition: harness tier: warp hanger; warp-tie-in man. Places new harness assembly and loom beam in loom to prepare loom to weave different pattern: Unbolts reed and drop wires, and unhooks pattern control cords from harness frames to release harness assembly in loom. Removes harness assembly and loom beam from loom using hoist. Bolts or screws new reed and drop wires in place on loom. Positions harness frames in loom and connects pattern control cords to frames. Positions loom beam on brackets, using hoist. May level harness frames. May place pattern chain on loom.

Title: BRICKLAYER APPRETICE
Definition: Performs duties as described under APPRENTICE (any ind.).

Title: PRODUCTION CLERK
Definition: Individual-production clerk; material-order clerk; process accounting clerk; production checker; production controller; schedule derk; scheduling supervisor; shop checker. Compiles data from customer orders, production estimates, and perpetual' inventory to prepare production schedules: Compiles production records from work tickets. Computes total number of units shipped to customers or other departments from work tickets to keep perpetual inventory. Estimates production rate of department, using production records of workers and machines. Integrates specifications of customer orders with production estimates and inventory to determine production schedule, indicating such factors as style, size, quantity, end priority. Informs customer and department supervisors of proposed shipping or transfer date. May record amount of material used [MATERIAL CLERK]. May prepare reports of production. May keep records of specific items produced and be designated accordingly as GREY-STOCK RECORDER (hosiery); HOSE COLLECTOR (hosiery); SARDINE CHECKER (can. & preserv.); SMOKE- MEAT PROCESSING CLERK (slaught. & meat pack.); STOCKING COUNTER (hosiery).

Title: CLAMPMAN
Definition: Moves and positions external clamp to assist in alining sections of oil and gas pipelines preparatory to welding: Lifts and carries external clamps from one joint to another. Lifts and slips clamp over end of last laid pipe, holding clamp in position while other workers insert end of new section into clamp. Moves lever to activate hydraulic mechanism to tighten clamp after alinement.

Title: JOUNIOR EXECUTIVE
Definition: Junior executive trainee. Acts in Junior supervisory capacities, such as that of assistant department manager of organization, to learn company policies, departmental functions, Jobs, and personnel functions with a view toward gaining knowledge of all phases of business. Participates in on- the job training and classroom discussions. This Job is definitely promotional with unlimited possibilities, principal requirements being based on personality, ambition, and Initiative, rather than knowledge and experience in particular business.

Title: TUBE-PROCESSING-EQUIPMENT TENDER
Definition: Adjusts and maintains tube processing equipment on tube conveyor: Follows Job order specifications to set transmission levers that synchronize automatic devices that cut tubed stock to length, imprint identifying information, punch valve holes, press valves, and apply soaps tone to stock as it moves on conveyor. Washes valve base with solvent and lays valve after hole is punched. Observes stock for defects, and does not apply valves if defective. Changes imprinting dies, cleans devices, and replenishes supply of paint and soap stone.

Title: SEAL-EXTRUSION OPERATOR
Definition: seal pressman. Tends extrusion press to fill grooves of storage battery covers with sealing compound: Attaches cylinder of sealing compound to press. Depresses pedal to extrude sealing compound. Holds and moves inverted cover under vent of press to fill grooves to specified level. Places filled covers on truck. Cleans press with brush and water.

Title: LEAD-BURNER HELPER
Definition: Assists LEAD BURNER I in preparing storage battery parts for fusing (lead burning): Position specified number of positive and negative plates in burning rack to ready equipment for fusing lugs to connecting straps. Places intercell connectors on assembled batteries. Places post builders (templates) over posts to aid LEAD BURNER I in adding lead to build up posts to specified levels. Removes post builders from posts after burning, using tongs. Places positive and negative post builders in separate containers. Selects burning racks according to size of plates grouped. May stamp polarity symbols on posts, using hand marking dies. May haul plates from storage to burning area, using handtruck. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.). May be known according to task performed as INTER- CELL-CONNECTOR PLACER; POST-FORM REMOVER; RACK LOADER.

Title: SCOOPING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: adzing -machine operator; sanddie -seat machine operator; scraper operator; sest scooper, machine. Tends machine to chip out saddle forms in wooden chair seats: Installs cams and cutter heads according to seat contour specified on work ticket. Turns handwheels to set cutter heads for depth of cut. Places chair seat on feed belt that pulls it under cutter heads. Removes chair seat at discharge end of machine.

Title: HAZER
Definition: Rides horse beside bucking horse being broken by COWPUNCHER to prevent bucking horse or COWPUNCHER from being injured. Works in cooperation with another HAZER.

Title: LOAD TESTER
Definition: Tends load-testing machine to test coiled or leaf springs for conformance with load requirements: Positions spring on bed of machine. Turns hand gages or positions block gages to regulate travel of flattening ram. Pulls lever to lower ram and compress spring under specified load. Measures contraction of spring, using gages. Rejects springs which do not contract specified distance. May measure spring dimensions, using micrometers, calipers, protractor, plug gages, and comparator machine [COMPARATOR OPERATOR (any ind.)].

Title: LINESMAN
Definition: laborer, marine terminal;wharf man. Secures and removes ship's docking lines to and from dock: Catches lines heaved from ship attempting to dock. Drags lines to bitts on dock and slips eyes of docking lines over bitts. Removes lines from bitts when ships depart. May drive jitney to pull in docking lines.

Title: FREQUENCY CHECKER
Definition: end counter; frame-winning observer. Records number and cause of stops and ends down (yarn breaks) on textile machines, such as looms and spinning frames, for work assignment and quality control purposes: Observes machine and questions worker to determine reason for machine stoppages. Records information on special forms for analysis by management. When working in weave room may be known as LOOM-STOP CHECKER (textile). When observing spinning or roving frames may be known as ENDS-DOWN CHECKER (textile).

Title: GUM OPENER
Definition: plug chert handler. Unpacks pressed plugs of tobacco from gums (press boxes): Removes metal rods from sides and top of gum, using hammer. Removes top, positions gum on post, and pushes sides down over post away from plugs of tobacco, or removes corner pins and disassembles sides, top, and ends. Places plugs of tobacco on truck and pushes truck to wrapping department.

Title: MAP-AND-CHART MOUNTER
Definition: giver; pester. Glues muslin backing or backboard to paper maps and charts for reinforcement: Unrolls and spreads muslin on table and cuts it to specified dimensions, using scissors. Applies glue to back of maps and charts with brash or by inserting them between rollers of gluing machine. Places glued side of sheet onto muslin strip or precut backboard and smooths surface with stiff brush and flat piece of bone. Glues paper mounting strip to top edge and oilcloth reinforcing strip to bottom edge of roll type maps and charts, and hangs them on drying rack. Cuts maps into sections with knife and glues them to muslin strip, spacing sections specified distance apart to allow for folding. Assembles frames from finished wood strips by screwing angle brackets to corners. Mounts and fastens map or chart in frame, using plaster's points, screws, or tape.

Title: MANAGER, DEPARATMENT, CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
Definition: Directs and administers activities of department of chamber of commerce, such as domestic trade, construction industries, and aviation and space departments: Analyzes market trends and economic conditions to forecast potential sales of products or services in area. Assists business and industrial organizations on such problems as expansions, cost reductions, and community development. Advises business organizations and industrial groups on tax problems and legislation. Studies agricultural economy for exploitation of rural resources, production and marketing of farm products, improving farm income, and effecting favorable agricultural legislation. Suggests civic improvements, such as community zoning, planning, public housing programs, and airport expansions, based on surveys of community needs. Plans and directs educational campaigns to promote public support of such community programs as housing, transportation, and hospital facilities. Stimulates civic and economic growth of community by promoting tourist travel, soliciting convention business, and inducing labor and industry to immigrate into area. May be designated according to field of specialization or department managed as MANAGER, DOMESTIC TRADE; MANAGER, CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRIES; MANAGER, AVIATION AND SPACE.

Title: SHELLFISH GROWER
Definition: oyster culturist. Cultivates and harvests beds of shellfish, such as clams and oysters: Lays out and stakes tide flats (ground beneath shallow water near shoreline). Piles up stone, poles, and mud, using farm tractor and hand implements to make dikes to control water drainage at low tide. Removes debris by hand and levels soil with tractor and harrow. Sows spat (baby shellfish) by hand or with shovel. Covers seeded area with mixture of sand and broken shells of shellfish, using shovel. Rigs net or star mop (mop of heavy rope yam) and drags it over bed behind power boat to ontangle and remove shellfish predators, such as crabs and starfish. Pours oil around bed and spreads oil-treated sand over bed with shovel to form chemical barrier to shellfish predators. Walks about bed at low tide, and scoops or digs shellfish and piles them onto barge or mud sled, using pitchfork or shovel. Packs shellfish, according to market specifications, in containers and returns small ones to bed. Poles barge to wharf at high tide or pulls it, using boat. Drags mud sled from bed by use of tractor. May supervise workers who cultivate and harvest bed. May negotiate with buyers for sale of crop. May be designated according to type of shellfish grown as CLAM GROWER; OYSTER GROWER.

Title: EDITOR, NEWSPAPER
Definition: editor-in-chief, newspaper.
