Studies standard design to determine type of stitch and thread color needed. Removes defective stitching, using scissors. Operates machine to produce required embroidery. Applies patches to damaged applique designs to cover defects.

Title: FRAMER
Definition: body-maker helper; pegger. Dips sheets of muslin in shellac, tacks sheets in layers on stretcher frame to dry and cuts dried fabric, using shears, into squares of specified size for use in making top-hat or opera-hat brims and crowns.

Title: ENGINEERING CLERK
Definition: Prepares operations manuals and compiles airplane parts lists following company and government standards: Examines parts records to verify that detail drawings have been made for specified parts. Writes description of parts and assigns code numbers, titles, and drawing references. Keeps record of assembly revisions and engineering modifications to keep parts lists up-to-date. Compiles operation and maintenance manuals describing maintenance procedures, such as lubrication of parts and charging of batteries. Compiles specifications for all components of airplanes, transcribing blueprint data into compact paragraphs.

Title: HYDRAULIC-PRESS OPERATOR
Definition: hogshead-press operator; press man; prize jacker; transfer man. Tends hydraulic press that packs tobacco into hogsheads for storage or sflip- ment: Reads scales to determine whether specified amount of tobacco has been packed in hogshead and charger. Pulls hogshead and charger from chute or packing line, using metal hook, and positions hogshead under ram of press. Pushes lever to lower ram or to raise hogshead against ram to press tobacco into hogshead. Removes hogshead from press and pulls charger from hogshead onto rack, using hook, or raises charger from hogshead, using electric hoist. May place corset (metal reinforcement) around hogshead to prevent staves from bursting under pressure.

Title: STERILIZER OPERATOR
Definition: Tends conveyor line enclosed in series of circular chambers to cook canned milk to sterilize and change viscosity and color of milk: Turns steam, water, and hot air valves and observes gages to adjust temperature of beating, cooking, cooling, and drying chambers. Observes panel lights for machine failure and stops conveyor to remove jammed cans. Observes filled sealed cans moving through chambers and removes dented cans or sample test cans. Opens sample can and dips spoon into sterilized milk to observe grain (texture), viscosity, and color. May alter cooking temperature or add measured amount of calcium or phosphate to milk batch to obtain specified grain and viscosity.

Title: CRESTER
Definition: Decorates (crests) archery arrow shafts, using lacquer and hand brushes: inserts shafts of arrows in cresting machine which automatically rotates arrows as they come into position for decoration. Applies bands of colors to rotating shafts, following color guide. Depresses pedal to bring each succeeding arrow into proper position. May mix paints.

Title: FORM BUILDER
Definition: carpenter form; wood-form builder. Constructs built-in-place or prefabricated wooden forms for molding concrete structures, following blueprints: Determines type and dimension of concrete forms from blueprints, diagrams, or oral instructions. Saws lumber to blueprint dimensions, using handsaw or powersaw. Nails lumber together to make form panels. Erects built-in-place form on construction site according to blueprints. Inserts wooden or metal spreaders between opposite faces of form to maintain specified dimensions. Inserts metal tie rods to hold opposite faces of form panels to specified dimensions. Anchors and braces forms to fixed objects, using nails, bolts, anchor rods, steel cables, planks, and timbers.

Title: SALESMAN, TELEVISION CABLE SERVICE
Definition: contact man. Contacts homeowners, apartment managers, and other prospects to sell community television antenna service or service from cable.

Title: SAND MIXER, MACHINE
Definition: sand conditioner, machine; sand-control man; sand-mill operator; sand - system operator. Operates machine to mix or recondition molding sand: Weighs out specified amounts of ingredients, such as sand, sea coal, and bonding agents, and shovels them into machine or automatic hopper. Sets dials for specified amounts of water, core oil, and other ingredients that are automatically measured and fed into machine. Turns dials to time mixing cycle of machine. Removes sample of sand and feels it for consistency. Adjusts controls and adds ingredients to vary mixture according to sampling. May be designated according to purpose for which sand is to be used, as CORE-SAND MAN; FACING-SAND MAN; MOLDING-SAND MAN.

Title: BINDER TECHNICIAN
Definition: Tends mixing machine to mix binder fluid used in production of fiber glass sliver or mats: Weighs and measures ingredients according to formula and pours or dumps ingredients into mixing vats. Turns valve to start flow of water and steam into vats and starts portable or power mixer to agitate ingredients for specified time. Observes temperature charts and thermometers to determine if specified temperature is maintained. Turn; valve to increase flow of steam or water to regulate temperature of mixture or notifies supervisor of excessive temperatures. Dips beaker into vat to obtain sample of binder fluid and delivers sample to testing room Obtains test results and adds ingredients according to instructions or turns valve to start flow of binder fluid into specified circulatory tank. Cleans mixing vats, mixers, and other equipment, using water and cloths. Records number of batches mixed, ingredients used, gallons mixed, gallons lost, and net gallons mixed for inventory and production records.

Title: DIETETIC INTERN
Definition: Performs duties in planning and directing food service programs for specified length of time to gain practical experience, immediately following graduation from a university, as an additional qualification for employment as a DIETITIAN.

Title: PONDMAN
Definition: boos man; chute faster; bolsters jacker feeder; log-chain feeder; polar; sinker man; sinker poller; slip feeder; awing man. Feeds logs onto conveyor that moves logs from pond to saw or barker deck: Stands on catwalk, flatboat, raft, or floating logs and guides logs onto conveyor, using pike pole. Raises sunken logs, using hoist. May operate powered winch to raise sunken logs. May be designated according to work station as BOATMAN (sawmill); Loo RIDER (sawmill).

Title: MUD-MILL MAN
Definition: pug-mill man. Tends mill that mixes flue dust with water to settle it for shipment: Opens bin outlet allowing dust to fall into mixing mill, dislodging banked dust in bin by hammering sides. Starts mill and opens valve of water spray. Opens door of mill allowing moistened dust to fall onto conveyor belt leading to railroad car. Distributes mixture evenly ln car with shovel.

Title: DOCTOR, HERB
Definition: herbalist. Treats diseases and disorders of human body by applying herbs and medicinal plants.

Title: MILLER
Definition: Operates mixing, screening, and milling machines to process salt preparatory to making table salt, blocks, tablets, or other Salt products: Reviews production schedule to ascertain quantity and size of salt crystals, and type and quantity of fortifiers, such as potassium iodide, specified for product. Weighs out and dumps ingredients into mixing machine [MIXER OPERATOR]. Installs specified size screens and rollers in milling machine, using hand tools to obtain salt crystals of designated sizes. Opens chute to admit fortified salt into milling machine and starts machine. Brushes oversized salt from vibrating screen to prevent clogging. May be designated according to salt product being milled as MILLER, KILN-DRIED SALT.

Title: DRY-WHITE-LEAD GRINDER
Definition: grinder, lead; mill man, dry grinder; mill man, white lead; white-lead grinder. Operates machine to grind chipped lead carbonate into powder for use in compounding paint pigments: Moves controls of conveyor which carries chipped lead to grinding-machine feed hopper and starts machine that reduces chips to powder. Starts suction fan which draws lead powder into filling hopper. Positions nozzle from filling hopper in bunghole of barrel or in bag and opens hopper gate to admit ground white lead into container. Drags or rolls containers to storage area.

Title: FUR CUTTER
Definition: Selects and cuts pelts to make, alter, or repair garments or other fur articles: Selects required number of fur pelts and matches them for size, color, texture, and quality. Arranges pelts on pattern according to design and color, placing finest pelts where they will show to best advantage and give garment symmetrical appearance. Numbers pelts to indicate their pattern location. Cuts off inferior or unusable parts, such as heads, necks, sides, rumps, and tails. Slits skin of furs into diagonal strips, leaving uncut margin at edge, to obtain specified length and shape of pelt, using furrier's knife. Cuts pelts to shape them to garment pattern.

Title: DETECTIVE
Definition: RIGHT-OF-WAY INSPECTOR; STATION PATROLMAN; YARD PATROLMAN.

Title: MILLER
Definition: grinder operator. Tends machines that mix, grind, or pulverize materials used in making cement, such as coal, stone, shale, clay, oyster shells, gypsum, and cement clinker: Starts mill and conveyors. Observes conveyor system to insure continuous flow of material. Stops conveyor and removes clogged material, using bar. Opens chute over conveyor to add materials, such as iron, silica, or gypsum, according to specifications. Observes operation of auxiliary equipment, such as cement pumps, air or screen separators, air slides, cement coolers, and dust collectors. Turns valves to regulate water, air, and oil lines on machine, according to laboratory specifications. May regulate feeder mechanism on machines not equipped with automatic regulators. May add moisture to materials to facilitate flow into machine. May be designated according to type of mill tended as BALL-MILL OPERATOR; FINISH-MILL OPERATOR; HAMMER-MILL OPERATOR; PUG-ILL OPERATOR; RAW-FINISH-MILL OPERATOR; Ron-MRU. MAN. See Volume II for additional titles.

Title: MANAGER, BOARDING HOUSE
Definition: manager, guest house. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers in a boarding house engaged in providing meals and lodging accommodations for transients and permanent guests: Advertises vacancies and shows and rents rooms. Supervises household employees engaged in tasks such as cleaning rooms, issuing linens, and cooking and serving meals. Plans menus and purchases supplies. Collects rents, pays bills, and posts information in records. May participate in cleaning and cooking activities. May make minor repairs to building and furnishings. When meal service is not provided, is designated MANAGER, ROOMING HOUSE.

Title: RECEIVING-AND-SHIPPING FOREMAN
Definition: chief clerk; shipping- and- receiving foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in receiving, storing, issuing, and shipping materials and products, and in keeping inventories and stock records. Performs duties as described under FOREMAN. May prepare bills of lading. May compile reports on utilization of workers' time. May inspect incoming and outgoing items. May be designated according to function supervised as RECEIVING FOREMAN; SHIPPING FOREMAN.

Title: SLIPCOVER CUTTER
Definition: Cuts material for slipcovers according to size and shape of furniture to match patterns and insure economical use of material: Reads order to determine type and amount of material required, and obtains materials from stock room. Determines from experience and knowledge of materials approximate yardage necessary to cover furniture, allowing for shrinkage and stitching. Measures, drapes, and smooths material, wrong side out, over sections of furniture to Insure most economical use and to serve as guide in matching shades, colors, and designs in cloth. Determines cutting lines by pinning or marking fabric, using shape of furniture as outline. Cuts fabric along marked lines. Pins cut pieces together and fits assembled unit over furniture, making adjustments with pins to attain required fitting. Wraps fitted pieces together and delivers to shop for sewing. Records amount of time for each assignment. May visit customer's home to cut material for slipcovers. May cut material for draperies.

Title: CAPACITOR WINDER
Definition: con- denser winder; paper-condenser winder; winding-ma- chine operator, automatic. Winds alternating layers of conductive and dielectric tape, such as metal foil and paper, to form capacitors, using capacitor-winding machine: Positions and alines rolls of specified conductive and dielectric tape on in-line machine spindles. Installs winding arbor in chuck of machine, using wrench. Alines edges of conductive tape with edges of dielectric tape and threads tape ends through guide rollers and around arbor. Starts machine to wind tape into coil of specified length. Cuts tape with scissors and glues ends to coil. Places coiled tape in bin. May operate machine equipped with automatic measuring device and brake mechanism that stops machine after material has been wound to specified length. May insert tabs (leads) at specified points during winding. May insert anodes (strips of oxidized aluminum) in winding of electrolytic capacitors. May be designated according to type of capacitor wound as CAPACITOR WINDER, ELECTROLYTIC.

Title: LEAK HUNTER
Definition: cooper; leakman; patch man; repairman. Repairs leaks in barrels filled with whisky: Walks between rows of stacked barrels and examines each barrel for leaks. Repairs leaks by calking hole with wicklng (twisted cotton), driving wooden plug into hole, or applying strip of adhesive canvas over hole. Records aerial number of barrel repaired and date.

Title: POTTERY-DECORATION DESIGNER
Definition: Originates drawings of patterns In decorating pottery and porcelain ware: Makes preliminary pencil sketch of customary designs and motifs used in industry and of period styles. Transfers design to finished drawing and applies water colors, arranging shades and colors harmoniously. Paints design on bisque ware and applies underglaze, using brushes, sponges, and banding wheel. Revises and adapts sample design to production requirements, applying knowledge of glazes, firing, and decorating processes.

Title: ENGINEER, CONTROLS
Definition: Conducts feasibility studies to develop spcifications for rocket engine control systems required to maintain in-flight control of missile in relation to mission objectives and intrinsic or extrinsic factors affecting missile control: Analyses alternate guidance and engine control systems including gyroscopic, electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical subsystems and components in relation to missile control problems, such as irreversibility, electrical interference, ballistics factors, heat, weight, and vibration. Applies computer analysis and other techniques to establish detailed specifications for developmental and final control systems designs. Advises engineering personnel concerning problems related to missile control systems design.

Title: FOREMAN, GREASE REFINING
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in extracting and refining grease produced by cooking glue stock and in converting tankage to fertiliser : Estimates weight and type of tankage or grease in process and specifies amount of acid to be used. Examines refined grease to insure specified level of clarity. Directs blending of grease according to formula and loading of grease into tank cars. Records amounts of grease refined, blended, and shipped, amounts of add used, and moisture content of each batch of fertilizer. Trains workers in operation of cookers. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: HOSTLER, OUTSIDE
Definition: Drives electric, diesel-electric, steam, or gas-turbine-electric locomotive in railroad yard and delivers it to engine crew: Receives locomotive from HOSTLER, INSIDE after locomotive has been cleaned, serviced, or repaired. Observes air, oil, and steam pressure gages and water level to insure that locomotive is operating efficiently. Pushes or pulls levers to control movement of locomotive. Drives locomotive to switching area and delivers it to engine crew. Receives locomotive from LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER at termination of run and delivers it to HOSTLER, INSIDE.

Title: DISBURSEMENT CLERK
Definition: Verifies accuracy of loan applications and prepares file for each loan transaction: Compares original application with credit report. Approves loan and prepares check. Delivers cheek to branch office. Prepares loan worksheet, insurance record, credit report, and application copy for each loan. Compiles daily report of loan transactions. Prepares payment book and mails to customer.

Title: SALESMAN, AMUSEMENT AND SPORTING GOODS
Definition: Sells amusement and sporting goods, such as photographic equipment and supplies, hunting and fishing equipment, camping equipment, athletic equipment, playground equipment, toys, and games, performing duties as described under SALESMAN (ret. tr.; whole, tr.).

Title: CENTRIFUGE OPERATOR
Definition: separator, flab oil Tends centrifuge machines to remove solid impurities and water from fish oil: Turns valves to admit steam to jackets of machines. Starts pumps and opens valves to feed fish liquor or oil to machines and to transfer oil to receiving tanks. Observes gages on machines to determine when temperature is within prescribed range. May rub oil between fingers to detect grit and reprocess oil that does not meet company standards. May open valves to pump oil through one or more settling tank to separate water from oil. May steam-clean centrifuge and settling tanks.

Title: BRIGHT CUTTER
Definition: Cuts layer of metal from walls of settings and other surfaces of jewelry articles to reveal bright inner metals: Clamps article in chuck preparatory to cutting. Lubricates cutting tool and pushes it over surface to remove specified layer of metal.

Title: ENGINEERING DESIGNER, AIRCRAFT STRUCTURES
Definition: designer; draftsman; engineering designer; engineer, lay out; engineer structures. Develops designs and modifies complex aircraft and missile systems and structural assemblies or subassemblies to meet strength-weight and aerodynamic efficiency requirements, using engineering data and knowledge of fundamental principles of aerodynamics: Analyzes comprehensive or incomplete engineering sketches, drawings, and notes to evaluate manufacturing and functional practicability of design proposal. Draws preliminary sketches and applies mathematical formulas, physical laws, and fundamental aerodynamics theory to develop detailed drawings and specifications of structures or systems, such as rib assemblies, struts, and landing gear consistent with size, weight, and strength requirements. Designs components to be cast or machined from metal stock. Selects standard components, such as gears, motors, relays, and potentiometers, for incorporation in design. Drafts complete layout drawings. Compiles stress analysis data resulting from testing of experimental components and prepares reports, charts, and graphs for use by engineering personnel in making design decisions.

Title: BOTTOM-HOLE-PRESSURE-RECORDING-OPERATOR HELPER
Definition: Sets up recording equipment at well site for use in determining pressure in oil or gas wells: Unloads equipment from truck. Attaches conductor cable to instrument and tightens clamps, fittings, and electrical connections, using wrenches and screwdrivers. Observes coiling of conductor cable on hoist drum to prevent damage to cable. Dismantles equipment after use.

Title: TIN-CASE-METER REPAIRMAN
Definition: Repairs gasmeters by replacing defective parts and soldering sheet metal seams with hand iron: Draws soldering iron along top plate and panel seams to melt solder and removes plate and panels to gain access to internal parts of meter. Inspects, cleans, repairs, and replaces internal parts. Replaces panels and top plate and solders all seams. Connects meter to air supply and submerges meter in water to insure that all seams are gastight.

Title: STULL MAN
Definition: Installs stulls (wooden cross-brace supports) inside partially cured concrete pipe: Feeds boards into table saw to cut them into specified lengths. Nails crosspiece to end of each board. Inserts first stull at one end of pipe to span diameter and wedges stull ends tightly into place, using wedges and hammer. Wedges additional stulls at angles to first stull to provide supporting surfaces along full length of pipe, and nails stulls together at intersection. Repeats operation at center and other end of pipe.

Title: THIRD DRY-CELL-ASSEMBLING-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: Removes dry cells from trough of dry-cell-assembling machine and places them right side up in wooden trays, preparatory to sealing with wax by other workers.

Title: OUTSIDE-CONTACT CLERK
Definition: Visits users of gas and electric power to Investigate bill complaints and conditions preventing completion of service connections and to obtain contract and deposit: Investigates returned bills and locked premises. Obtains keys from owner, disconnects meter, and secures customer's forwarding address. Interviews customer using service without contract to obtain contract and deposit. Determines amount of deposit required from previous billings at same location and from load estimates based on number, size, and type of meters. Determines amount of bill for service used and collects amount of bill. Evaluates customer's reliability and accepts partial or delayed payments or discontinues service until payments are made. Investigates and resolves complaints regarding bills. Orders investigation of meters and service to trace trouble in service lines. Interviews applicants and completes forms for gas and electric service. (light, beat, & power; tel. & tel.)see CONTRACT CLERK under NEW-ACCOUNT CLERK (clerical).

Title: CUTTING-MACHINE TENDER
Definition: Tends power shear that cuts sheets of material, such as paper, press board, foil, cardboard, cork, or plastic material, to sped fled dimension for items, such as cartons, wrappers, labels, business forms, or gaskets: Adjusts guides on machine to regulate width of cut, using ruler or by following calibrated scale on machine bed. Positions and alines sheets against guides and presses lever to damp sheets to bed of machine. Moves controls to force shear blade through sheets. Adjusts guides and repositions material to trim or square edges to specifications. May change shear blade, using hand tools. May be designated according to type of material cut as CARD- ROARD CUTTER; CUTTER, PLASTICS SHEETS (fabric, plastics prod.; plastics mat.); PAPER CUTTER. May cut material manually, using hand-powered shear, and be designated PAPER CUTTER, HAND.

Title: BOX REPAIRER
Definition: box repairman; box shook patcher; patcher. Examines box shook and blanks for cracks, knots, holes, and loose binding wire. Fills defects with cement and wood and staples loose binding wires to sides of boxes.

Title: BRIDGE OPERATOR
Definition: bridgeman; drawbridge operator. Controls railroad or highway drawbridge over waterways to permit passage of vessels: Observes approaching vessels and listens for whistle signal from vessel indicating desire to pass. Moves levers that activate traffic signals and alarms, lower gates to halt street traffic, or activate interlocking railroad signals to warn oncoming railroad trains. Starts motors of drawbridge and moves levers to raise or turn drawbridge, giving vessels passage. Signals vessels to pass through opening. Inspects drawbridge and auxiliary equipment and makes repairs and adjustments. Cleans, oils, and greases machinery. Prepares reports of accidents occurring on or to bridge. Relays messages to vessels in waterway. Records name of vessels passing and number of trains or vehicles crossing bridge. May be required to hold Railway Signalman Certificate.

Title: WATCHMAN
Definition: barn hand; feed- man; feed mixer; groom; hostler; livery man; stable boys trackman; team tender. Cares for horses or mules while animals are in stables to protect their health and improve their appearance: Changes or replenishes drinking water for animals. Selects, measures, and mixes feed, such as oats, barley, corn, and vitamins, and rations feed to animals according to past consumption of animal and instructions from owner or BARN BOSS. Washes, brushes, and curries animals and trims their manes and tails. Inspects animals to detect evidence of disease or injury, and informs supervisor of findings. Treats sick or injured animal according to instructions from VETERINARIAN (medical ser.). Shovels and sweeps refuse and old bedding from stalls and spreads fresh bedding straw for animals. Cleans feed troughs. Unloads straw, grain, and supplies from trucks and transfers material to storage. Exercises animals at regular intervals. May harness or saddle animals. May shoe animals [HORSE- SHORE]. May whitewash stabls, using brush. May be designated according to animal cared for as HORSE TENDER; MULE TENDER; STALLION KEEPER (agric.).

Title: SUPERVISOR, EDUCATION
Definition: Develops and directs teaching personnel in application of curriculum program of school system: Confers with teaching and administrative staff to plan and develop curriculum designed to meet needs of students. Visits classrooms to observe effectiveness of instructional methods and material. Evaluates teaching techniques and recommends changes for improving them. Provides teachers with supplies, equipment, and visual and other instructional aids. Conducts workshops and conferences for teachers to study new classroom procedures, new instructional materials, and other aids to teaching. Assists in recruitment and in-service training of teachers. May be designated according to subject matter field or department administered as SUPERVISOR, ADULT EDUCATION; SUPERVISOR, AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION; SUPERVISOR, ELEMENTARY EDUCATION; SUPERVISOR, HOME ECONOMICS; SUPERVISOR, INDUSTRIAL ARTS EDUCATION; SUPERVISOR, MODERN LANGUAGES; SUPERVISOR, TRADE AND INDUSTRIAL EDUCATION.

Title: METAL-RELEASE MAN
Definition: Approves or rejects cast aluminum alloy ingots: Reviews reports of chemical analysis of batch. Determines that composition of alloy is within standard limits, using charts. Marks ingots to denote acceptance or rejection. May calculate furnace charges.

Title: RAVELER
Definition: Unravels rows of excess fabrics along looped seams of knitted garments by cutting several stitches with scissors and pulling out yarn by hand.

Title: TICKET GIRL
Definition: pricer; pricing clerk. Computes cost of customers' laundry by pricing each item on customers lists, using adding machine, calculating machine, or comptometer. May keep inventory of customers laundered articles. May prepare statements to be sent to customers [BILLING CLERK II (clerical)].

Title: ANIMAL KEEPER, HEAD
Definition: keeper, head; superintendent, menagerie. Supervises and coordinates activities of ANIMAL KEEPERS engaged in care and exhibition of birds and animals at zoo: Examines animals to determine need for medical care. Supervises ANIMAL KEEPERS in preparation of food to insure adequate diet for each type of animal. Inspects cages for cleanliness and issues instructions for repair or construction of cages. Specifies type of animal to exhibit and location of exhibition according to weather conditions, behavior characteristics of animal, and its physical condition. May employ, train, and discharge ANIMAL KEEPERS. May keep time records, and prepare supply requisitions and other clerical reports.

Title: LABORER, RAGS
Definition: apnea operator. Performs any combination of the following tasks involved in preparing rags for use in making paper: Cuts material, such as clips, buttons, and elastic, from rags, using hand shears or automatic circular knife. Removes dusted rags from conveyor of thrasher (dusting machine), weighs and records weight of rags, and trucks them to cutting machine. Removes cover from bleach boiler allowing rags to fall into stock cars. Marks cars according to grade and type of rags and pushes cars to washing machines. Removes washed rags from drainer (seasoning bin), places them in stock cars, and pushes cars to beater room. May be designated according to task performed as BLEACH-BOILER PULLER; CUTTER; STOCK PITCHER.

Title: BROKE MAN
Definition: Removes broke (waste paper and pulp) from paper and pulp making machines and loads it onto handtruck. Pushes truck to beater machine and throws broke into machine tank for reprocessing. Washes pits under machines with hose and blows dirt and dust from drier rolls, using airhose. May bale waste paper (BALING-MACHINE OPERATOR (any ind.)].

Title: CHAUFFEUR
Definition: driver. Drives private car as ordered by owner or other passenger and performs other miscellaneous duties: Assists passengers to enter and leave car and holds umbrellas in wet weather. Keeps car clean, polished, and in operating condition. making minor repairs, such as fixing punctures, cleaning spark plugs, or adjusting carburetor. Frequently assists MAN-OP-ALL-WORK with heavy work. May groom and exercise pets.

Title: FLEX-O-LATOR-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that automatically weaves wire and cord or burlap to provide firmness between padding and coil springs of mattresses and upholstered furniture: Mounts roll of burlap on machine rack and threads end between machine rollers. Places cone of wire and spools of twisted paper cord on reds, and inserts wire and cord ends into machine. Starts machine that automatically makes mats. Spreads emerging fabric over table and cuts it into mats of specified length, using cutting pliers.

Title: KEY RINGER
Definition: Places lettered, rubber key covers on metal rings to make rubber cushions for typewriter keys: Heats key cover to make it pliable and presses it onto metal ring in correct letter or symbol aliment, using hand tool.

Title: DOCKHAND
Definition: Operates motor- boat to transport passengers or cargo to and from anchored amphibious airplanes and removes planes from water: Loads cargo or directs passengers aboard motorboat. Pilots boat to plane or dock and discharges cargo or passengers. Positions wheeled beaching gear at end of ramp in water and, standing in water, pushes and pulls plane over gear. Drives tractor to draw plane and gear up ramp onto shore for removal to hangar. Cleans plane interiors and exteriors.

Title: AIR-COMPRESOR OPERATOR
Definition: compression man compressor engineer Tends air compressors driven by steam, electric, or gasoline powered units to generate and supply compressed air for operation of pneumatic tools, hoists, and air lances: Starts power unit to build up specified pressure in compressor. Adjusts controls or sets automatic controls to maintain continuous air supply to pneumatic tools or equipment. Observes temperature and pressure gages and adjusts controls accordingly. Lubricates and cleans equipment. May connect pipelines from compressor to pneumatic tools or equipment. May repair low pressure steam boilers that furnish power for air compressor units by disassembling unit of boiler and replacing damaged parts, using handtools. May be designated according to type of equipment operated as AIR-COMPRESSOR OPERATOR, STATIONARY; COMPRESSOR OPERATOR, PORTABLE.

Title: PLYWOOD-SCARFER OPERATOR
Definition: scarfer operator. Tends machine that scarfs ends of plywood panels: Installs knives in rotary cutter head and adjusts angle of cutter, according to thickness of panel and adjusts guides according to width of panel, using handtools. Positions and clamps panel on machine table and starts machine. Presses pedal to move panel under rotary cutter that scarfs end of panel. Removes scarfed panels from machine and stacks them on pallets or carts for gluing.

Title: TIRE TECHNICIAN
Definition: Tests experimental tires and determines strength, wear- ability. and cause of failure: Inflates tire on test machine, and adjusts controls to simulate road conditions, such as speed, weight-mileage check, and roadbed. Maintains periodic follow up on test until tire fails or has run for specified time. Cuts cross section from test tires, new experimental tires, or actual road tested tires with powersaw. Counts bead wires and plies in cross section, verifies angle of plies with protractor, and measures specified areas on tire to ascertain effects of testing. Records test results and prepares graphs to compare test results.

Title: FREIGHT-CAR CLEANER, DELTA SYSTEM
Definition: Performs any combination of following duties to clean freight cars as they are pulled through Delta system (central cleaning station): Pushes buttons on control panel to activate track switches, conveyors, vacuum cleaner, warning siren, and winch. Hooks cable to string of cars and starts winch to move cars. Removes grain doors and places them on conveyor to storage area. Removes nails, cleats, crate bracings, and shipping paper from walls and floor, using claw hammer and crowbar. Tosses debris onto incinerator conveyor. Sweeps debris out car door into conveyor pit below track, using broom. Pushes and pulls vacuum cleaner nozzle over floor to remove debris, such as wood chips, sawdust, grain, flour, and powdered chemicals. Washes down ceiling and walls with hose to remove dust. Pushes button to route cleaned cars to side tracks as they roll away by gravity.

Title: PIPING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates sewing machine with attachment that folds material edges inside and blind- stitches seam to make piping. Places roll of material on holder and threads end through feeding device, using hook.

Title: FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in drying, pulverizing, mixing, and pressing ingredients used to produce fuel briquettes: Feels fuel-mixture to estimate moisture content. Observes reading on hygrometer to determine humidity of atmosphere, and specified temperature for drier and flow rate of material. Inspects finished product and takes sample for pressure test. Specifies changes in percentage of binder to bring product to specified quality level. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.).

Title: ALINER
Definition: testman. Adjusts tuned circuits in radio and television receivers for maximum signal response: Connects receiver chassis to test-equipment, such as signal generator and output meter or oscillograph. Adjusts condensers in radio frequency and intermediate frequency stages of audio circuit until maximum signal is indicated in output meter, using screwdriver or socket wrench. Tunes television receivers for video response on all channels. Usually designated according to equipment adjusted as RADIO- CHASSIS ALINER; TELEVISION ALINER.

Title: BLEACHER HELPER
Definition: bleach- house helper; bleach-house worker. Assists BLEACHER in mixing bleaching chemicals, removing bleached garments from machine, and by performing other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: BIAS-CUTTING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Operates machine to cut tubular doth into narrow widths for bias tape or binding: Positions roll of doth on shaft or truck of flat-folded cloth on stand at feeding end of machine. Places tubes on take up roller. Turns setscrew to space circular knives on cutting shaft according to width specified for tape. Pulls open end of tubular doth over arm of machine, under guide bars, through feed rollers, and under rotary knives. Laps ends of bias-cut doth around tubes. Depresses pedal to start, stop, and control speed of machine and guides doth under guide bars and through feed rollers to cut doth on bias. Removes rolls of bias tape or binding from machine. May wrap rolls in paper for storage or shipment.

Title: SALESPERSON, FURS
Definition: Sells ready- to-wear or custom-made fur garments and pieces, such as capes, coats, neckpieces, and stoles, performing duties as described under SALESPERSON (ret. tr.; whole.tr.): Displays garments from stock and assists customer in trying on garment. Explains qualities of various kinds of fur, how fur garments are made, how many skins are used, and when particular types of furs should be worn. Displays samples of fur skins and lining at request of customer desiring custom-made garment. Estimates cost of altering, remodeling or repairing garment. Receives fur garment for storage, writes description on ticket, and estimates value of garment and storage cost. SALESPERSON.

Title: LIBRARIAN
Definition: Keeps library of stock and process films in motion-picture studio for future use or reference: Receives, catalogs, and stores films by title or scene reference. Selects and issues requested items to studio personnel. May cut and assemble portions of positive films, using hand-powered sprocket machine.

Title: FILTERMAN
Definition: head fitter man. Tends filter press that filters liquors, such as gelatin, glue, and malt beverages: Turns valves to open lines and pumps liquor through cotton, silk, or wood pulp filter. Inspects filtered liquors for specified degree of clarity. Recirculates cloudy liquor through filter until clear, or connects line to fresh filter press. Reads gages that indicate pressure in lines and turns valves to maintain specified pressure. Turns valves to transfer clear liquor to specified department. May clean filter by backwashing it with water. May add chill-proofing enzymes to filter, when filtering beer, to eliminate proteins and increase clarity.

Title: GLASS-BULB SILVERER
Definition: Coats interiors of ornamental glass balls with silvering solution: Pours solution into balls through small openings. Holds stopper over openings and shakes balls until interior surfaces are covered. Pours surplus silvering solution out of balls.

Title: ABSORPTION-AND-ADSORPTION ENGINEER
Definition: adsorption -and- adsorption engineer. Designs equipment and devises chemical processes to remove and separate components of gas mixtures or liquid solutions by absorption and adsorption, using knowledge of chemistry and engineering: Devises processes and oversees workers, using equipment, such as crushers, grinders, kilns, screens, pumps, compressors, pipelines, valves, tanks, and separators. Oversees workers controlling flow of liquid or gas through an adsorbent, such as fuller's earth, clays, carbons, charcoal, and bone char in granular form (percolation method); or mixing adsorbent with liquid or gas and removing adsorbent by filtration, settling, or combination of both (contact filtration method). Oversees workers using absorption method to remove soluble constituent of gas or vapor by dissolving it in a liquid, using packed columns or towers into which liquid is sprayed.

Title: TREATING ENGINEER
Definition: retort engineer; timber - treating -tank operator; treat!ng- plant operator. Controls one or more cylinder retorts to impregnate wood products, such as railroad ties, piling, poles, and crossarms, with preserving or fire proofing chemicals: Turns valves to admit treating solution and compressed air into retort and steam into heating colls. Observes gages and turns valves to maintain specified heat, pressure, and level of solution in retort, according to treating schedule. Pumps treating solution back into storage tank at end of treating cycle. Signals TREATING- ENGINEER HELPER to open retort doors. Heats unseasoned wood in retort to remove moisture preparatory to treating process. May operate locomotive or winch to move tram loads of wood products in and out of retort. May operator mixing machine to blend preservative Ingredients according to formula. May take and test sample borings, using laboratory equipment, to determine if treatment meets customers' specifications or standard chemical analysis requirements. May be required to hold license.

Title: ADVANCE MAN
Definition: advance agent. Coordinates business details concerned with production of entertainment in advance of theatrical troupe, lecturer, circus, road show, motion picture, or other entertainment: Inspects performance location and reports its condition, and if stage presentation, inspects equipment and accommodation of theater, such as size of stage, seating capacity, and number of dressing rooms. Completes business arrangements, such as advance sale of tickets and procurement of legal permits. May distribute advertising and publicity matter, working in cooperation with PUBLIC-RELATIONS MAN I (profess. & kin.).

Title: ROUGE MIXER
Definition: Tends machine that mixes powdered rouge and water to make polishing paste for lens blanks. Dumps specified amount of rouge into mixing tank and meters prescribed amount of water into tank. Starts agitator and allows ingredients to mix for prescribed time. Draws off sample and tests for density, using hydrometer.

Title: TRANSFORMER ASSEMBLER
Definition: see TESTER, MOTORS AND CONTROLS.

Title: COAT HANDLER
Definition: Assists COAL- TOWER OPERATOR in unloading coal from barges: Docks barge by fastening rope to barge and to electric winch on pier, moving switch handle on winch to pull barge in, and ties barge to pier. Guides scoop bucket by hand as it is operated by COAL-TOWER OPERATOR to avoid damaging barge or pier. Breaks up large or frozen coal, using coal shovel. Repairs damage caused to barge or pier by scoop backet, using carpenter's hammer and nails. Performs other duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: MANNEQUIN MOUNTER
Definition: balancer; set up man. Attaches arms, legs, and pedestals to display form bodies: Trims openings with knife to fit socket blocks. Tacks block in opening. Sets arm or leg in place in socket block. Inserts pedestal into cavity of bust form and tacks form to pedestal. Sets form on workbench between alining bars. Alines bust form with bars to balance it and nails form to pedestal.

Title: GUM-SCORING-MACHINE-OPERATOR
Definition: gum-rolling-machine tender. Operates one or more machines that roll chewing gum into sheets and score (partially cut) sheets to specified size: Turns hand wheels to adjust rollers, knives, and scoring blades on machine to regulate thickness of sheet gum and depth of scoring according to specifications, using ruler. Starts scoring machine and flow of gum from mixer into hopper of machine. Measures width, length, and thickness of scored sheets to insure conformance to specifications, using ruler. Examines sheets for scoring defects and completeness of sugar coating. May give directions to other workers engaged in loading and unloading scoring machine and coating gum with sugar.

Title: FOREMAN
Definition: mill foreman. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in producing wood products, using knowledge of and experience with specific processes and products: Analyzes work orders to determine production schedules. Computes amounts of stock and supplies required for operations, based on production schedules, and requisitions materials from storage area. Inspects wood products for finish, dimensional accuracy, and quality of construction to verify conformance to company standards. Directs workers in adjusting machines and equipment that fabricate products which fail to meet standards. May lay out designs on stock lumber to guide workers in machining and assembling products [LAY-OUT MAN I]. May plan flow of materials through department and develop physical layout of machines according to work orders. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to process supervised as FOREMAN, ASSEMBLY; FOREMAN, MACHINING; or according to department or establishment supervised as FOREMAN, PARTICLE BOARD (particle board); FOREMAN, SAWMILL (sawmill).See volume II for additional titles.

Title: BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: boring-machine operator. multiple spindle. Sets up and operates single or multiple spindle boring machine to bore holes In wooden parts: Examines blueprints, drawings, or samples and written specifications to ascertain size, type, and setting of boring tools, stops, Jigs, and guides to be used. Selects boring tools and accessories and Installs them in machine, using rule and wrenches. Adjusts spindle locations and stops to regulate spacing and depth of bore, using rule or template and wrenches, or turns hand wheels to move table and guides to center stock under bits and regulate depth of bore. Starts machine, places stock on table against guides, and moves lever or depresses pedal to engage wood stock with rotating bits. Verifies location and depth of holes, using rule, template, or by fitting parts together. May be designated according to machine operated as BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, DOUBLE END; BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, HORIZONTAL; BORING-MACHINE OPERATOR, VERTICAL; CLUSTER-BORE OPERATOR; GANG-BORE OPERATOR.

Title: DISTILLER
Definition: stiller; still tender; turpentine maker. Tends kettle still in which resin is distilled into oil of turpentine and rosin: Lights fire under still. Regulates intensity of fire during distilling process, as determined by characteristic sounds made by still, by inspection of distillate or by observation of thermometer. Admits water to still at specified time during process. Examines distillate to determine completion of process. Discharges residual rosin in still into strainers. Quenches fires at end of process. Bolls animal gins, water, and other Ingredients according to formula. Pours glue Into barrel, shakes barrel to coat inside with glue, and places barrel over kettle to drain.

Title: POWER-PLANT ENGINEER
Definition: Designs machinery for generating electricity, performing duties as described under DESIGN ENGINEER (profess. & kin.), and oversees its construction, installation, operation, and maintenance.

Title: SUPERINTENDENT, DISTRIBUTION
Definition: superintendent, city plant; superintendent, gas distribution; superintendent. Operations division. Supervises and coordinates activities of workers in city gas-distribution plant to insure adequate facilities and gas supply to meet consumer demands with minimum interruptions to services Schedules activities, such as gas dispatching, pressnre regulation, pumping of drips, odorization of gas, and patrolling and inspection of facilities. Authorizes and supervises, through subordinate workers, repair and construction or installation of structures, mains, services (pipes leading from mains to residences), meters, regulators, gas appliances, and other distribution equipment. Formulates policies for maintaining customer relationships and supervises workers engaged in investigating and adjusting distribution or appliance complaints.

Title: STAMPMAN
Definition: battery man; stamper. Tends stamping mills that crush ore to specified fineness: Turns valve to regulate flow of ore and water over plates beneath stamps. Examines crushed ore at outflow of mill to determine degree of fineness. Adjusts raising and dropping sequence of stamps. Replaces broken stamps, plates, and shafts.

Title: TICKET-DISPENSER MAN
Definition: Changes code slugs (printing dies) and installs rolls of ticket tape in ticket dispensing machine before each race at racetrack: Unlocks machine with key and turns knob to reset number register to zero. Changes code slug so that different symbols are printed on tickets. Replaces depleted roll of ticket tape, threading end of tape through feed roller to type roller. Presses key of machine to obtain sample ticket. Examines ticket to ascertain that machine is printing correctly and adjusts machine to correct defects. Relocks machine.

Title: SANDBLAST OPERATOR
Definition: Tends automatic sandblasting machine that cleans grease, oil, and grit from fragmentation-bomb cavities: Rolls bomb off conveyor into machine cabinet. Closes door and sets automatic timer at starting position. Pushes button to release pressurized sand stream Into bomb cavity. Stops machine when timer indicates completion of sandblasting. Opens cabinet and removes bomb.

Title: MEDICAL-APPARATUS MODEL MAKER
Definition: Constructs, analyzes, and adjusts electromechanical models of precision electronic medical equipment, such as heart stimulators, animal resuscitators, and radio-frequency generators, following mechanical prints and schematic diagrams, using metal working machines, hand tools, and electronic testing equipment: Operates punch press, brake, and drill press to modify standard chassis following mechanical prints, schematic diagrams, and location of specified electronic components, such as resistors and capacitors. Secures hardware, such as terminals, cable clamps, power plugs, dials, rheostats, and control knobs, to chassis, using pliers, screwdrivers, and wrenches. Solders electronic components and wires to terminals and to controls in chassis, following schematic diagram. Tests device for specified performance, using multimeter and oscilloscope. Consults ELECTRICAL ENGINEER (profess. & kin.) For performance analysis, and modifies or changes components, hardware, wiring, or chassis as indicated by analysis.

Title: SCRIBING-MACHINE OPERATOR
Definition: Tends machine that inscribes graduations in metal surface of measuring tools, such as carpenters' steel squares and rules, and machinists' scales: Slides workpiece into spring clamp on machine carriage. Starts machine that scribes graduations along length of tool by automatic indexing of multiple scribing points or cutters. Removes scribed tool at end of cycle and examines and compares it with master scale to verify legibility and accuracy of graduations.

Title: SHILL
Definition: Induces persons to buy tickets or participate in games of chance by playing game and posing as member of audience.

Title: HYDRAULIC-PRESS OPERATOR
Definition: Tends hydraulic-pressing machine that smooths wrinkles from folded knitted garments: Opens valves to admit steam to pressing plate. Lays folded garments in tray. Slides tray under plate and onto top of piston of machine. Shifts lever to raise piston and force tray against steam-heated plate to press garments. Pulls tray from under steam plate and removes garments after piston automatically lowers.

Title: BALLOON MAKER
Definition: Cuts out inflatable rubber figures, such as animals and comic characters, for use in parades and carnivals. Punches hole and inserts air valve in each component member of figure, cements valve in place, and cements members together and to body of figure, forming inflatable balloon. Inflates figure and inspects for leaks.

Title: PILOT, HIGHWAY PATROL
Definition: Pilots airplane or drives automobile to engage in law enforcement activities: Patrols highway by aircraft to enforce traffic laws and coordinates air operations with ground personnel to apprehend traffic and other law violators. Flies emergency missions to deliver medical supplies. Engages in routine police ground activities.

Title: KILN DRAWER
Definition: round-kiln drawer. Removes fired ceramic ware from kiln and prepares kiln and saggers for reuse: Removes brick and mortar that seals kiln door during firing. Climbs stepladder inside kiln and hands down uppermost saggers to coworker for removal from kiln. Removes ware from saggers for removal to cleaning room. Scrapes clay and sand from surfaces of saggers, and removes broken pins that support glased ware in saggers during firing. Sweeps and shovels debris from interior of kiln. May be designated according to kiln drawn as BISQUE-KILN DRAWER; GLOST KILN DRAWER; TUNNEL-KILN DRAWER.

Title: DRAFTSMAN, OIL AND GAS
Definition: Drafts plans and drawings for layout, construction, and operation of oil fields, refineries, and pipeline systems from field notes, rough or detailed sketches, and specifications: Develops detail drawings for construction of equipment and structures, such as drilling derricks, compressor stations, gasoline plants, frame, steel, and masonry buildings, piping manifolds and pipeline systems, and for manufacture, fabrication, and assembly of machines and machine parts [DRAFTSMAN, ARCHITECTURAL (profess. & kin.); DRAFTSMAN, CIVIL (profess. & kin.); DRAFTSMAN, MECHANICAL (profess. & kin.)]. Prepares maps of pipeline systems and oil and gas locations, using field survey notes and aerial photographs [DRAFTSMAN, MAP (profess. & kin.)]. May draft topographical maps [DRAFTSMAN, TOPO

Title: TANK ASSEMBLER
Definition: act-up man; tank cooper. Assembles boards, staves, and rods to form tanks: Arranges boards in shape of bottom and marks identification on each board to facilitate assembling. Marks location of dowel holes in boards or staves and drills holes. Drives croze of staves on bottoms with hammer until tank is completed. Places and tightens washers, rods, and nuts on rectangular tanks to make boards secure. Inspects tank for workmanship, smoothing uneven joints with drawnknife. Marks identification on staves and disassembles tanks to prepare them for shipment. May place metal hoops around staves to withstand pressure. May be designated according to shape or section of tank assembled as CIRCULAR- TANK COOPER; RECTANGULAR-TANK COOPER; TANK-BOTTOM ASSEMBLER; TANK-STAVE ASSEMBLER.

Title: BOOSTER ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembles elements of explosive shell boosters, performing any combination of the following duties: Places cushion disks in bottoms of booster cups. Stamps copper washers with identifying data and glues onionskin disks over holes. Puts together parts of releasing mechanism (rotors) and assembles them with stamped washers and housings (body pieces) to complete boosters. Gages overall length of completed units, using snap gages.

Title: MACHINE SET-UP MAN, PAPER GOODS
Definition: Sets up and adjusts machines that convert, saw, corrugate, band, wrap, box, stitch, form, or seal paper or pa per board sheets into products, such as toilet tissue, towels, napkins, bags, envelopes, tubing, cartons, wax rolls, and containers, according to specifications, by any combination of the following tasks: Adjusts rolls, guides, and chutes to accommodate type of paper or paper board fed from parent rolls or flat stock from automatic feed racks, using handtools. Measures, spaces, and sets saw blades, cutters, and perforators, according to product specifications, using rule, thumbscrews, and wrenches. Installs printing attachment to machine and makes adjustments for clarity of print. Threads wire through stitching head and synchronizes speed for spacing stitches. Installs or resets cutting dies according to work orders, using handtools. Operates machine for test run to verify adjustments and observes functioning of machine parts, such as gages, elevator, belts, slip clutches, oil injectors, glue feeders, and electrical devices. Repairs or replaces defective parts. May be designated according to type of machine adjusted as BAG-MACHINE SET-UP MAN; GLUING-MA- CHINE ADJUSTER; STITCHER SET -UP MAN, AUTOMATIC.

Title: MENDER
Definition: Operates sewing machine to repair defective stitching on articles, such as curtains, draperies, and quilts: Rips out defective stitching, using razor blade, and operates more than one type of sewing machine to perform tasks, such as binding raw edges or seams [BINDER II (any ind.)], hemming articles [HEMMER (any ind.)], tacking seam ends [TACKING- MACHINE OPERATOR (any ind.)], or attaching hardware to articles [RING ATTACHER].

Title: MACHINIST HELPER, OUTSIDE
Definition: machinist helper, marine. Performs duties as described under HELPER (any ind.).

Title: FOILING-MACHINE ADJUSTER
Definition: Repairs and adjusts machines that stamp out small disks of shellacked paper and press them over open ends of charged primer cups: Adjusts die block so that disks are properly pressed in place. Removes and disassembles die-block assembly for cleaning. Replaces defective parts, such as bent punches and worn rollers. Inspects samples of completed primers. Usually adjusts other machines used in the assembly of cartridge primers, such as toggle presses and anvil shakers.

Title: ASSEMBLY FOREMAN
Definition: Supervises and coordinates activities of workers engaged in assembling balers, combines, motors, tractors, and other agricultural machines and equipment: Coordinates work of production and stock control departments to maintain flow of material to assembly line. Inspects defective parts and directs routing of rejects to salvage or rework department. Investigates and determines causes of assembly defects and orders corrective action. Studies present layout of equipment to effect changeover of assembly line for processing new models. Performs other duties as described under FOREMAN (any ind.). May be designated according to component assembled as MOTOR-ASSEMBLY FOREMAN.

Title: SALVAGER
Definition: Inspects cartons of rejected kitchen or penny matches for salvage: Replaces slightly damaged cartons, binding strips, or matchbook slides. Packs salvaged cartons in tote box and drops salvage able material in scrap can. Adds matches to short load cartons.

Title: BLINTZE ROLLER
Definition: cheese pancake roller. Fills precut sheets of egg dough with cheese, folds ends over filling, and rolls lengthwise to make blintzes (rolled cheese pancakes). Places blintzes on conveyor leading to packer.

Title: CHARCOAL BURNER, BEEHIVE KILN
Definition: collier; kiln bar tier. Operates series of beehive kilns to produce charcoal: Places kindling In kiln and starts fire. Seals top of kiln when specified heat Ls attained, using cement and hand trowel. Observes color of smoke as it issues through draft holes in kiln bottom to insure burning of charcoal as specified. Opens and closes draft holes, using bricks, to regulate forming of charcoal. Seals draft holes and cracks in kiln with cement to smother fire when charcoal has been formed.

Title: PALM-AND-BACK FORGER
Definition: see PALM-AND-BACK FORGER under SEWING-MACHINE OPERATOR, REGULAR EQUIPMENT (any ind.).

Title: MANAGER, SALES
Definition: Manages sales functions of drycleaning establishment: Supervises and coordinates activities of RETIAL-RECEIVING CLERK and SALESMAN-DRIVERS (any ind.). Visits customers to make estimates on proposed work, such as cleaning draperies, rugs, and upholstered furniture. Adjusts customers' complaints. Directs advertising and promotion campaigns.

Title: COREMAKER, PIPE
Definition: Makes day cores around which ferrous and nonferrous pipe is cast: Clamps rod in bench vises so that it can be rotated. Wraps rod with paper, straw, or jute, tying it firmly in place with twine. Mixes mud, sand, and loam to form day. Spreads clay over wrapping, adding molasses to make mixture cohesive and working coating by hand so that it is smooth and even. Spreads core blacking over core and places it In drying oven for a specified period. Removes dried core and applies second coating to bring core to specified diameter. Spreads blacking on core and returns it to oven for final drying.

Title: FIELD-RING ASSEMBLER
Definition: Assembler, dx. Held ring; assembler, dx. Field yoke. Assembles field poles and interpoles to steel housing ring (yoke) to build field rings for d.c. motors and generators: Slips insulated coils over pole piece and drives fiber spacing wedges between them. Bolts field poles and interpoles to inside face of yoke, ad-

Title: ZIPPER SEWER
Definition: Operates sewing machine equipped with guides that prevent needle from contacting metal to sew slide fasteners to openings of garments, such as pants, Jackets, and skirts.

Title: DENSITOMETER READER
Definition: Determines photographic density (resistance to passage of light) of motion picture film, using densitometer. Records readings on scene sheet for evaluation by PHOTOGRAPHIC 8BNSITOMETRI8T.

Title: CLERK-TYPIST
Definition: Performs general clerical work requiring use of typewriter in majority of duties: Compiles and types reports, bills, application forms, shipping tickets, and other matter from clerical records. Files records and reports, posts information to records, sorts and distributes mail, answers telephone, and performs similar duties. Computes amounts using adding machine. May be designated according to records typed as TRUST-REMITTANCE CLERK (banking). May type on or from specialized forms and be designated C.O.D. BILLER; STORAGE-RECEIPT POSTER; WAYBILL CLERK. See volume II for additional titles.

Title: TIP-LENGTH CHECKER
Definition: tip tester. Measures length of tips cut from tobacco leaves and computes data pertaining to sample: Gathers tip samples from conveyor belts and places samples in tip- length measuring boxes, according to length of tips. Counts tips of each length and records number and length. Computes average length of tips and percentage of tips over specified length. Notifies supervisor of percentage of tips over specified length.

Title: DOG-POUND ATTENDANT
Definition: poind keeper. Attends to animals picked up and brought to pound by feeding and watering them and cleaning and disinfecting their pens. Makes routine repairs to pens and other installations.
